Her plans and dreams are to continue building wealth for her children so that they will have land where they can live and work, and also to improve her home with plaster.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Asuncion Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Asunción 41  años  de edad,   vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace  06  años al negocio de venta de golosinas, pan y tamales su venta es de forma ambulante.
Doña Asunción sus cliente son los amigos y personas que a diario ella visita y que le visitan en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora que desea salir adelante y es un ejemplo de trabajo y de superación. 
Doña Asunción está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pataste, yuca, papas, cebolla, chiles, harina, maíz, leña, carne de pollo, res, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y es su sexto  préstamo que solicita.
Doña Asunción su sueño es mejor su  negocio 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Asunción, 41 years old, lives with her husband and their three children. For the past six years she has dedicated herself to the sale of snack foods, bread, and tamales. She does not have a fixed post from which she sells.

Asunción's clients are her friends and others who visit her daily. She is a very hardworking woman and wants very much to get ahead. She is a great example of someone who does everything in her power to do so. 

Asunción is asking for this loan in order to buy chayote, yucca, potatoes, onions, chilies, flour, corn, firewood, chicken, beef, etc. for her business. With the help of this loan she will be able to improve the business, and as a result her quality of life as well. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma, as this is the 6th loan she will be receiving from the institution. Asunción's dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy chayote, yucca, potatoes, onions, chilies, flour, corn, firewood, chicken, beef, etc. for her business

loans.name: Musy

texts.es: Musy tiene 22 años, es soltera, y vive en la casa de su familia junta sus padres y sus 2 hermanos. Musy se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas heladas al por mayor o por unidades. Tiene una refrigeradora donde diariamente congela las bebidas que vende a sus clientes. Trabaja sola desde hace 1 año. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico para pagar sus gastos personales  y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, además le agrada la independencia financiera que tiene. Desea convertirse en una prospera empresaria y tener un local amplio para desarrollar mejor su actividad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.1000, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. Además se siente segura trabajando con los miembros de su banco comunal ya que ha observado que es un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado comprará más bebidas de diversas marcas y presentaciones para complacer el gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Musy is 22 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents and two siblings. She sells cold soft drinks on both a wholesale and individual basis. She has a refrigerator where every day she cools the drinks that she sells to her clients. She has been working on her own for the past year. Musy likes this business as it has enabled her to have her own income with which she covers her personal expenses, and she is able to support her parents with their home expenses as well. She really values the degree of independence having her own income has provided. 

Musy would like to become a prosperous businesswoman and someday have a larger location from which she can develop her business. Currently, Musy is asking for a loan of S/. 1,000, and she is grateful for all of those people who make it possible for her to receive this loan that she needs to improve her business. Musy feels very supported working with the other members of her lending group, since there is a lot of group solidarity. With the amount that she is asking for, Musy will buy more drinks of various types in order to satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell to her clients

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos. Marcia se dedica a la venta de hielos, gaseosas y chupetes de diversos sabores elaborados con frutas tropicales. Para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, ahí conserva a bajas temperaturas todos los productos que ofrece. Ha hecho esta actividad por más de 1 año, trabaja sola atendiendo a sus clientes de manera cordial. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, además puede contar con los ingresos económicos necesarios para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de continuar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. 
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de gaseosas y frutas de la región para elabore chupetes y continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Marcia is 20 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents, siblings, and small children. She works selling ice cream, sodas, and ice pops that she makes using various tropical fruits. She has her own refrigerator that she purchased with her savings, which is where she stores all of her goods to be sold. She has worked selling these items for the past year, and works alone attending her clients very cordially. Marcia enjoys having this business as it allows her to work from home and be able to take care of her children. She also is able to earn the income she needs to support her home expenses. Her plan is to continue to grow her business and increase the variety of products that she sells. 

At the moment, Marcia is asking for a loan of S/. 500. She is very happy to know that she can count on this financial support. She plans to use this loan to purchase more sodas and local fruits, in order to make more ice pops and continue her work. She is very dedicated to complying with the repayments of this loan when they are due.

loans.use: to buy sodas and fruits to continue her drink and ice-pop business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 34 años, está casada con Rogelio con quien tiene dos hijos, juntos viven en una casa construida a base de adobe. Olga tiene una tienda de productos comestibles desde hace 8 años y este es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. Cuando comenzó con su negocio uso los pocos ahorros que tenía para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros lo cual le sirvió para obtener sus primeras ganancias y surtir su negocio, actualmente tiene mas productos. Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo porque con el tiempo se ha convertido en una vecina muy querida y conocida. Dedica el fruto de su trabajo a sus hijos a quienes siempre los envía al colegio y evita que pasen necesidades. Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es construir su vivienda  a base de material noble para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para comprar productos comestibles tales como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, paquetes de gaseosa y cereales porque son los productos que tiene mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Olga is 34 years old and has two children with her husband Rogelio. They live in an adobe house. 

Olga has owned a grocery store for the past 8 years and this is her family's main source of income. When she started her business, she used the small amount of money that she had saved to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and other things that generated her first profits, which she used to stock the store. She currently has more products.

She is very happy with her business because, with time, it has become a very dear and well-known neighborhood store. She dedicates the fruit of her labor to her children, who she always sends to high school and makes sure they do not suffer.

One of her long-term goals is to build her home with better materials to improve her quality of life.

This is her second Kiva loan and she is thankful for the financial support that she has received to continue her business. She promises to make her payments on time.

She requests 4,000 nuevos soles to buy food products like bags of rice, bags of sugar, and boxes of soda and cereal because these products are in high demand.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, soda, and cereal.

loans.name: Sobre Ruedas Group

texts.es: En el Banco Comunal Sobre Ruedas de Villarrica, Región de la Araucanía de Chile, se ubica este Banco Comunal en el cual sus socios tienes rubros como colectivos y venta de frutas y verduras, Florencio, que está ubicado al extremo derecho de la foto con su mano en el bolsillo y sweater verde, se dedica a la venta de provisiones y frutas. Comenzó hace 6 años con su negocio, porque antes trabajo como maestro carpintero, pero la gente no fue constante con los pagos de los trabajos que hacía, así que prefirió colocar un negocio más rentable y en donde pudiera estar más tiempo con su señora, así que se consiguió dinero y pudo empezar con su negocio, compro maquinas y hasta pudo acceder a comprarse una camioneta para el traslado de la mercadería que compraba, pero él necesita dinero para comprar más mercadería e insumos para su negocio. Espera que tenga una buena venta, ya que tiene su clientela, y lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajara junto a Fondo Esperanza es la ayuda monetaria que dan ya que así puede optar a tener algo seguro de dinero y contar con ello para comprar la mercadería que necesita.
texts.en:
The banking group "Sobre Ruedas de Villarrica", located in the region of Araucanía, Chile, is composed of members working in a variety of businesses, including the sale of fruits and vegetables. 

Florencio, located on the extreme right of the photo (with his hands in his pockets and wearing a green sweater), works selling basic provisions and fruits. He began his business 6 years ago. Previously, Florencio worked as a carpenter, but because people were very inconsistent with their payments he preferred to start a more profitable business which would also enable him to spend more time at home with his wife. He bought the necessary equipment he needed and also bought himself a small truck with which he can transport the merchandise that he buys. Right now, Florencio needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise to stock his business. He expects that he will have good sales, as he already has a strong client base. 

Florencio has really enjoyed working with the Fondo Esperanza, as it is the monetary support he has received that has enabled him to have the financial security he now enjoys, as well as the ability to buy the merchandise that he needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira.
Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos. Hace 8 años cultiva café  y ahora vende café y maíz en el mercado local de donde obtiene ingresos para subsistir. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para el cultivo de café y maíz, ya que es el tiempo de cuidar el cultivo para sacar buena producción. El tiene como meta recuperar un terreno que fue dañado por una falla geológica y ampliar el cultivo.
texts.en:
José, 52 years old, is married and has 3 children. He lives in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. 

All his life, José has dedicated himself to cultivating basic grains. Eight years ago, he also began to cultivate coffee, and he now sells coffee and corn in the local market. This is how he obtains the income he needs to survive. José is currently asking for his second loan of 15,000 Lempiras, in order to buy fertilizer for his coffee and corn crops. Now is the time to take care of his harvest in order to ensure a good yield. His goal is to recover his land that was damaged by natural causes, and he would also like to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee and corn crops

loans.name: Consuelo Cuanda

texts.es:
Consuelo es casada aun no tiene hijos vive con la esposa, vive en Chimbo Provincia Bolivar.

Consuelo se dedica a la venta minorias de globos para todo tipo de fiestas en un local pequeño de su casa.
Con el dinero desea comprarse  un electrodomestico una lavadora.

El sueño es tener siempre trabajo para tener mas dienro para vivir bien.

En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar.
texts.en:
Consuelo is married and lives with her husband in Chimbo Provincia Bolivar. They do not yet have any children. 

Consuelo works selling balloons and other party items from her home. 

With the loan that she is currently asking for, Consuelo plans to buy a washing machine for her home. Her goal is to always have a job in order to have more money and live well. In her free time, Consuelo enjoys going for walks.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 42 años, está casada y vive en casa de su tío junto su esposo y sus 2 hijas. María se dedica a la venta de zapatos y productos de belleza femeninos, además de ropas para damas y caballeros. Todos estos productos los vende, sus principales clientes son sus familiares.  Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 5 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda a conseguir nuevos clientes y la transporta hacia los lugares donde tiene que entregar sus pedidos. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico que le sirve para solventar sus gastos, además su labor le permite tener una ocupación. Tiene deseos de convertirse en una prospera empresaria y ver que su negocio crezca progresivamente. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos productos de belleza para ampliar su selección.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and lives with her uncle, husband, and two daughters. María works selling shoes and beauty products, as well as men's and women's clothing. Her main clients are her family members and close friends. She has had her business for the past 5 years, and counts on the support of her husband who helps her find new clients and also helps with the transport of goods when she has to deliver orders. María enjoys having this business because it allows her to generate income to cover her costs, while also giving her something to do during the day. Her dream is to become a prosperous businesswoman, and see her business grow progressively. 

Currently, María is asking for a loan of S/. 1,000. She is very grateful for the economic support that she receives from this institution in order for her to continue achieving her goals. She plans to use this loan in order to buy a variety of cosmetic items in order to increase the selection she offers. She promises to be punctual with all loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to grow her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 44 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Lourdes se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales, instala diariamente su mesa al frente de su hogar desde donde atiende sus clientes. Trabaja en esta labor desde hace 4 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor para la preparación y atención de los clientes. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de su pequeño hijo quien es la motivación para seguir progresando. Tiene planes de seguir adelante y ampliarlo con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas tales como arroz, aceites, papas y otros.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 44 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their three children. Lourdes works selling local foods, and sets up a table every day in front of her home from which she attends her clients. She has had this business for the past four years, and counts on the support of her oldest daughter who helps prepare food and assist customers. Lourdes enjoys having this business as it enables her to have an income with which she can cover her home expenses as well as the needs of her young son. This is her motivation to continue working. Lourdes plans to grow her business and improve it over time with better chairs and tables, in order to make it more comfortable for her customers. 

Currently, Lourdes is asking for a loan of S/. 1,000. She is very grateful for the financial support given to her which has enabled her to get ahead with her work. She plans to use this loan to purchase ingredients needed for food preparation, such as rice, cooking oil, potatoes, and others. She promises to repay all loan installments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice and sugar to use in food preparation

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Having studied civil engineering, it was only natural for Jose to pursue his passion for construction and design. In pursuit of social and economic stability, he opened Vittorium Design in August 2012. He sells affordable energy-efficient windows and protection from hurricanes. He currently runs his business out of a virtual office space, where he is able to receive mail and rent hourly room space to meet with potential clients. 

The biggest challenge Jose faces is expanding his marketing campaign to reach more people, especially those who do not want to place a 50% deposit. This loan will help him to purchase more inventory and increase marketing efforts before the hurricane season hits, meeting the local demand for hurricane shutters. 

Originally from the Dominican Republic, Jose has been living in the United States since 1982. He currently resides in Miami with his wife and two children.

loans.use: to increase marketing efforts in preparation for the hurricane season in Miami

loans.name: Sulman

texts.en:
Nearly 3 years ago, Sulman was diagnosed with cancer. During treatment, she discovered her talent for jewelry design at a workshop as she began searching for a way to move forward with her life. Shortly thereafter, people began inquiring about where she got her jewelry--prompting Sulman to make a business out of her unique designs. Today, this creative outlet gives her the motivation needed to remain in good health.

Her home-based business has been in operation for over two years now. She produces necklaces, bracelets, and other customer jewelry pieces for friends, family, and her extended network. She currently purchases materials from Michaels and other such stores and hand crafts particular pieces per order. Her business is currently experiencing significant growth through word of mouth. She has picked up more clientele and recently she has been picking up some larger orders. In order to fill these orders she has requested a loan to invest in the materials needed to fill these orders.

Originally from Costa Rica, she has been living in the United States for over 35 years with her husband. Her future goal is to expand her business internationally.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to fill additional orders

loans.name: Rensike

texts.en:
Nearly 13 years ago, Rensike left Cuba with a dream of gaining economic independence. He knew it would be hard to start from scratch, but he persevered in light of this uncertainty. During his first few years in the United States, he studied and worked as a technician installing cable TV and satellite. He did so until he was able to start buying his own equipment for resale. Gradually, he became a distributor and waved goodbye to his days as an installation technician. For that past few years he has been working from home using a rental storage unit to keep boxes fully organized for immediate distribution.

His business is profitable at the moment; however, he is in need of a loan to increase working capital to buy dishes and antennas, allowing him to have more in stock to commit to more local installers. His goals for the future include becoming an authorized dealer for big companies such as Dish Network and Direct TV and becoming one of the largest satellite providers in Southern Florida.

He currently lives with his wife and daughter, who rely on him for financial support.

loans.use: to establish credit and foster the growth his business is experiencing

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 46 años, está casada y vive en una casa alquilada junta su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Maritza se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir de distintas marcas, modelos y tallas, tanto para hombres como para mujeres. Toda su mercadería la renueva de manera mensual que le envían desde otra ciudad. Trabaja en este rubro desde hace 5 años. Recibe el apoyo de su hijo y de su esposo quienes le ayudan a movilizar la mercadería pesada. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la facilidad que tiene de conseguir nuevos clientes, además le permite organizar su tiempo y realizar las labores domésticas en su hogar, y ahora su principal meta es tener un espacio de su casa en el que pueda establecer una pequeña boutique para continuar progresando. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir como polos, shorts, pantalones, blusas y sábanas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 46 years old. She is married and lives in a rented house with husband and their 2 children. 

Maritza earns a living selling garments of different makes, models and sizes, for both men and women. She replenishes her merchandise on a monthly basis with items sent to her from another city. She has been working in this field for 5 years. She receives the support of her son and her husband who help her move the heavy goods. 

What she likes about her work is the ease with which she acquires new customers. It also allows her to organize her time and perform household chores at home. Now her main goal is to have an area of her house where she can establish a small boutique to continue developing. 

On this occasion she requests 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles. She is very excited to know that there are people who offer financial backing to help people continue developing their work. She also commits to being a responsible and punctual partner. 

With the requested amount she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise comprised of garments such as t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses and linen.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in her store

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a young entrepreneur who works hard for his future. His current business, a food cart specializing in Latin American snacks (pan de bonos & arepas), grew from his passion for baking. His cart operates out of a local supermarket (Presidente) and offers coffee and other various beverages as well. Although he is the sole owner of his business, he is thankful for his brothers and family for added support. 

This is his second loan from Accion East and Online, which he nearly paid off in full. This current loan will help Andres to buy a new mixer and an oven to increase his level of production. 

The great challenge Andres faces is local competition and establishing a reputation for his business. His aspirations for the future include increasing his inventory, becoming a wholesaler, and opening a food truck with Jac Brothers.

loans.use: to purchase a new mixer and an oven to increase production

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Married couple Lucas and Tammy own Rock Surfaces Inc, a home-based company that has been in operation since February 2009. The business manufactures and installs marble and granite counter tops. Tammy runs the finances while Lucas manages the jobs and installation. They provide their services to private individuals and businesses alike. 

This loan will help Lucas purchase the equipment necessary to contract fewer services from LC Marble Granite, enabling him to increase his profit, along with building credit. In particular, he would like a fork lift that he can use to move the counter tops at job sites, a bridge saw and an air compressor. 

The couple lives with their daughter and Tammy’s mother. Lucas continues to send remittances to his mother and younger sister in Brazil.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to increase economic independence

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Originally from Jamaica, Sandra is starting a healthcare consultancy firm to provide her clients with more information about health care.“I decided to start my own business because I have an inherent interest in healthcare administration,” says Sandra. She goes on to explain her vision: “I see a need to deliver quality service in this field. I believe I can deliver that quality service while changing and improving lives.” 

She will provide consulting services to individuals and businesses alike. These services will focus on advice as to different insurance options and how to remain within local and federal guidelines. She will also assist individuals with determining the best insurance product for them. 

This loan will help Sandra to incorporate/register her business, to purchase office equipment and supplies, and begin investing in marketing materials. 

Sandra lives happily with her husband and three children. As for her future aspirations, Sandra states, “I hope to obtain government contacts as well as grants to assist in growing my business. I also hope to educate the public on the new healthcare law that will be implemented in October of this year. In growing my business, I expect to begin hiring employees to assist in scaling up the business. Personally, I expect to become successfully not just in business but by continuing to raise healthy and happy children, who will make positive contributions to society.”

loans.use: to register her business, purchase office equipment and supplies, and begin investing in marketing materials

loans.name: Maged

texts.en:
After moving to the U.S. from Egypt with his wife Magda, Maged pursued his lifelong fascination with gems and precious metals by opening up a jewelry store in the Bronx. He eventually moved his store to a more profitable location in Elmhurst, a location that sees heavier foot traffic. 

In addition to this newer, more profitable location, Maged has worked over time with Accion East and Online to formalize his business by depositing more of his cash and improving his credit after a particularly difficult bankruptcy during the financial crisis. Now Maged is able to support himself and his wife, as well as occasionally send money back to his family in Cairo. 

Maged has years of experience working with jewelry, and now buys, sells, and repairs all kinds in his store. While he purchases some merchandise wholesale, his most profitable activity is purchasing jewelry and reselling it. 

This loan will help Maged acquire working capital. While his sales are strong he says he would like more working capital to purchase inventory in light of changing fashion trends as we enter the summer season. He personally hopes to be able to spend more time with his family in the future, as well as make some renovations to his store to make it more appealing to customers.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to prepare for changing fashion trends

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Huyen was born in 1977.She has two children who are learning in the 11th and the 6th grade. Her husband works abroad. He earns about 15,000,000 dong (VND) per month. Huyen raises pigs to earn a living. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for a long time. Her family’s total income is about 20,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in business is lacking capital to invest in breeding livestock. Her dream is to let her children have a good education and stable jobs. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach her dream. She can expand her breeding to gain more earnings and save the profit for her children’s education.

Huyen is a hardworking and careful woman. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more pigs to breed on her farm. 

Other members who are part of Huyen’s group include the following:
 
Thuy is 36 years old. She has two children. She sells fruit in the market. She wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her business.
 
Linh is 28 years old. She has two children. She raises pigs. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her work.
 
Hue is 24 years old. She raises pigs. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her work.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to breed on her farm.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Alàglöwa Te Kà Bei Biketse Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Alàglowa Te Ka Bei Biketse es el nombre que escogió este grupo de 8 mujeres indígenas de una comunidad en la Alta Talamanca, llamada Gavilán Canta, que se dedican a la agricultura. Su nombre está escrito en un dialecto Cabecar y significa “Mujeres Pensando en un Futuro Mejor”. Ellas tienen mucha experiencia en organización y están convencidas que si luchan en grupo pueden lograr mejorar el entorno en el que viven.  La líder del grupo es Maritza, una mujer de 31 años, soltera, Jefa de hogar y madre de 3 niños. Ella es agricultora, cultiva plátano y banano, y es está actividad la que le permite llevar el sustento a sus hijos.  Este es su primer crédito y su plan de inversión es la compra de insumos para siembra como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, bolsas y otros. El crédito va ser de mucha ayuda para ellas ya que les permitirá mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos para poder colocarlos a un mejor precio directamente al consumidor sin necesidad de intermediarios y poder darle es estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The lending group "Banco Mujer Alàglowa Te Ka Bei Biketse" is composed of 8 indigenous women in the community of Gavilán Canta, located in Alta Talamanca. The name of this group is written in the local dialect Cabecar, and it means "Women Thinking of a Better Future." The women in this group all work in agriculture and have a lot of experience doing so. They are convinced that by working together as a group they will be able to improve the area in which they live. 

The leader of the group, Maritza, is 31 years old and a single mother of three children. She cultivates bananas and plantains, and the income she earns from this activity allows her to support her children. This is her first loan, which she plans to invest in seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide among other items. This loan will be a great help for her, as it will enable her to improve the quality of her harvests, sell her goods for a better price (directly to the customer and without the use of an intermediary), and use the income to support her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and other agricultural items

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Hace más de un año decidió vender comidas en su casa. Ofrece baleadas, tacos, pollo frito con tajadas y otras. Su actividad a sido la elaboracion de pan casero y ahora la comida para vender en su comunidad. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a ODEF por 10,000 lempiras, para comprar insumos como carnes, harinas, condimentos y otros insumos para la elaboración de comidas y vender. Ella quiere tener su propio capital de trabajo y poder estudiar y ver su negocio crecer cada dia.
texts.en:
Elsa, 24 years old, is married with two children and lives in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. For the past year she has worked selling food from her home. She offers baleadas, tacos, and fried chicken among other items. She also prepares homemade bread which she sells in her community. 

Elsa is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras from ODEF, in order to buy ingredients she will use in food preparation such as meat, flour, and condiments. Elsa would like to have enough money in order to study and see her business grow each day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, flour, lard, and other condiments used in food preparation

loans.name: Jhim

texts.es: Jhim tiene 35 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junto su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Jhim se dedica al transporte de carga y pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, es una trabajo que le ha brindado muchos beneficios, entre ellos el de mantener la estabilidad de la economía de su hogar. Gracias a su esfuerzo a podido obtener 2 vehículos los cuales alquila a diario. Empezó a desarrollar esta labor desde hace 10 años cuando compró su primer vehículo  que el mismo conducía. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder realizar otras funciones, le está yendo muy bien y lo que ahora desea es comprar otro mototaxi y continuar brindando trabajo a otras personas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará piezas y repuestos para su mototaxi más antiguo ya que necesita refeccionar las llantas y el tapizado de los asientos y del toldo.
texts.en:
Jhim is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their three children. Jhim works transporting passengers in the city where he lives with his moto-taxi. This job has provided him with many benefits, especially the ability to maintain the economic stability of his home. Thanks to his hard work and effort, he has been able to purchase two vehicles which he rents out daily. He began this business over 10 years ago when he purchased his first moto-taxi which he drove. Now, he would like to buy an additional vehicle, in order to continue to provide employment opportunities to others. 

Currently, Jhim is asking for a loan of S/. 1,000. He is very grateful for the economic support he has received from those whose support will enable him to meet his goals. He promises to be punctual with all loan repayments and responsibilities. With the loan that he is asking for, Jhim will buy parts to fix one of his moto-taxis, which currently requires a number of improvements.

loans.use: to buy parts to fix his moto-taxi

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Mrs.Odgerel is 27 years old and lives with her parents, younger sister and her daughter in a house in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her parents work in local companies and her daughter Purevjargal is 5 and goes to local kindergarten. 

Odgerel has been working as saleswoman in a local market for years and has obtained lot of experience and built close relationships with her clients and suppliers. She is now starting her own clothing retail business in the local market and requesting 2,000,000 MNT to import a variety of clothing from China to sell at her rental stall. She is a hardworking, modest and open-minded woman who hopes to expand her business in the future and have her daughter grow up with a good education.

loans.use: to import a variety of clothing from China to sell at her rental stall

loans.name: Lavonne

texts.en:
LaVonne began her startup business, Be Bold & Beautiful Beauty Supply Store, less than six months ago from her apartment in Birmingham, Alabama.  With more than five years of experience in the beauty industry, selling and marketing hair care products, her short-term goal is to continue selling products to current customers and begin marketing her new business at her local church, through new and old friends, and word of mouth.

Recently, LaVonne decided to take the leap and begin purchasing her own product to sell to current and potential customers in her area.  To do this, she needed money to purchase her product.  LaVonne came to Accion Texas Inc. after discovering the nonprofit microlender at a local bank in her neighborhood. After she applied for a microloan, LaVonne received approval for a $5,450 loan and began purchasing beauty products such as brushes, hair color, wigs, nail polish and many other items to beautify women around Birmingham.

Without the loan, Lavonne says “it would have taken me a lot longer to purchase inventory.” In the near future, LaVonne plans to create her own website and hire one part-time employee, but as of now she remains the sole employee.

loans.use: to buy brushes, hair color, wigs, nail polish and many other items to beautify women around Birmingham.

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Jeremy has been an independent State Farm Insurance agent for five years now, and has continued increasing and expanding to the point where he created three jobs in his hometown of Baton Rouge.

As his insurance sales continue to increase, so has the workload for his three employees. To offer better customer service, Jeremy decided he would hire five new employees and have an eight-member team. The 30-year-old returning client of Accion Texas Inc. knew he wouldn’t have to go far for a loan.

As this is his second loan with the nonprofit microlender, Jeremy used his $5,450 loan to provide payroll for the new hires and to cover operational expenses.  Jeremy says without the loan, he would not be able to hire any additional employees to serve the steadily increasing business. View his website and get quotes from Jeremy at http://www.jrjacksoninsurance.com/.

loans.use: to hire additional employees

loans.name: Kaber

texts.es: Kaber es un joven emprendedor. el tiene un negocio de fabricación de Tablillas para muebles. sin embargo el gran avance en el sector donde vive ha hecho que la demanda aumente, por lo que necesita comprar mas materia prima para hacer crecer el negocio y tener mayor variedad de productos. es por esto que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para poder mejorar su producción y tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Kaber is a young entrepreneur who has a business making furniture. He has seen demand rise and as a result needs to increase is production in order to meet this rising demand. He needs to buy more raw materials for his business in order to offer a variety of products. As a result, he is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Colones, in order to improve his production and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to make furniture

loans.name: Porley

texts.en:
Porley, a rural villager from Sa Ang province's Kandal district, is 31 years old. He has earned a living through planting cassava for almost ten years. Porley is able to save up to six US dollars per day from his current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is the first-cycle loan for Porley with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. He is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee in a local university specializing in Finance and Banking. He sincerely hopes that this loan will enable him to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee in a local university

loans.name: Budeehuu

texts.en:
Mr. Budeehuu is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Bayarmaa is 39 years old and helps her husband to run their organic food products retail business. His son and two daughters all attend local secondary school. 

Budeehuu and his wife started their family business in 2000 as organic salt producers and now they have expanded their operation and import organic food products from Russia to sell to local customers. They are now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to import large amounts of organic food products from Russia to sell in a rental stall at the local market. Budeehuu and his wife are hardworking and responsible people.

loans.use: to import a large amount of organic food products from Russia to sell in a rental stall

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro, tiene 52 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. El siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace cuatro años que decidió con su esposa establecer una pulpería para vender granos básicos, manteca, harinas, azúcar, café, pan, condimentos, pastillas, huevos, refrescos, carnes etc.  Ha obtenido un segundo préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para  mantener surtida la pulpería con productos alimenticios como manteca, arroz, frijoles, harina, pan, refrescos, huevos y otros. Su plan es ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Pedro is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children. He lives in the municipality of Esparta in Atlántida. He has always worked in commerce. 

Four years ago, he and his wife decided to open a grocery store to sell staple grains, butter, flour, sugar, coffee, bread, condiments, medicine, eggs, soda, meat, etc. 

He has requested a second loan for 6,000 lempiras to continue to stock his grocery store with food products like butter, rice, beans, flour, bread, soda, eggs, and other things.

His plan is to help his children so that they can study.

loans.use: to stock food products like butter, rice, beans, flour, bread, soda, eggs, and other things.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Doña Jessica es una mujer muy esforzada. ella desea poner un negocio de venta de Gabeteros, mesas, sillas, estantes y demás artículos de plástico. por lo que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para  comprar todos los artículos y ponerlos a la venta. con esto pretende mejorar su calidad de vida y permitir un desarrollo para la comunidad y para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very strong woman.  She hopes to establish a business selling bureaus, tables, chairs, shelves, and other items made of plastic.  This is why she is requesting a loan of one million colones (1.000.000); she will buy all of the items and put them up for sale.  

In doing this, she will improve her quality of life.  This will also allow for development in the community and in her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell plastic items.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur  is 37 years old and a married man. He has three children who are going to school. Zaur has a small store in his own town. He sells tea, rice, sweets, bread, sugar, etc. Zaur's wife is a teacher but after her work day she also helps her husband in this business. 

Zaur works every day from Monday to Sunday .He opens his store at 8 o’clock in the morning and closes at night at  12 o’clock. He says that it is very hard work, but "to take care of my family, I must work".

He needs to repair his store, to buy more products and to buy new refrigerator. For that he needs a loan of 2000 AZN. He hopes that Kiva will help him. This is his 4th loan. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair his store, to buy more products and to buy new refrigerator

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1976. She has two children who are in the sixth and the 10th grade. Her husband makes food to sell to earn a living. He earns about 5,000,000 Dong (VND) per month. Lan is a worker. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for a long time. Besides that, she also helps with her husband's business. 

Her challenge in work is lacking capital to invest in her family's food stall. Her dream is to let her children have a good education. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach this dream. 

She is a hardworking woman. Lan has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2005. In the last loan, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more ingredients to cook food and to expand her family's business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook food and to expand her family’s business.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es: Narda tiene 49 años, es divorciada, vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus padres y sus 2 hijos. Narda se dedica a la venta de plátanos. Ha establecido su negocio en un espacio de la casa de su madre. Diariamente atiende a sus clientes que acuden a ella a su casa, ejecuta esta labor desde hace 5 años y recibe la ayuda de su madre. Complementa su labor con la venta de carbones y hielos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarles todo lo que sus hijos necesitan. Ahora espera seguir trabajando y establecer un local de ventas más amplio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el préstamo obtenido comprará progresivamente varios racimos de plátano para que continúe vendiendo.
texts.en:
Narda is forty-nine years old and is divorced.  She lives in her mother's house together with her parents and her two children.  Narda makes a living selling bananas.  She has established her business in an area of her mother's house.  Every day, she attends to her customers that come to see her.  She has been in this business for five years and her mother helps her.  She complements this work with another business selling charcoal and ice.  

The thing she likes the most about her work is that it allows her to have an economic income.  This gives her peace of mind in being able to offer her children everything they need.  

Today, she hopes to continue working and to establish a greater place in which to sell her products.  In this opportunity, she requests S/. 1000.  She is thankful and happy to know that she can continue receiving the financial support that she needs in order to advance her business.  With the loan, she will  buy bunches of bananas over time so that she can continue selling.

loans.use: to buy bananas in order to sell them in her business.

loans.name: Jeffer Omar

texts.es: Jeffer, un joven que busca como salir adelante en la vida, le fue mal en su matrimonio, hoy en  día es soltero pero siempre está al pendiente de las necesidades de su hijo, el continua con su actividad comercial la venta de ropa y perfumes. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de venta ambulante desde hace varios años, siendo su único medio de ingresos para sufragar sus gastos.
texts.en: Jeffer is a young man who is looking for a way to get on in life. Things went badly in his marriage and now he is single but he always looks after his son's needs. He is continuing with his commercial activities selling clothing and perfumes. He is asking for a loan to invest in his business as a street vendor which he has had for several years. This is his only source of income to cover his expenses.

loans.use: to invest in assorted clothing and perfumes

loans.name: Maudi

texts.es: Maudi tiene 25 años, está casada y vive en la casa de su madre junta su esposo y su hija. Maudi se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, para esto cuenta con una congeladora que compró, desde ahí atiende a sus clientes con bebidas heladas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en la atención de los clientes. Trabaja en esta labor desde hace 2 años y complementa su negocio con la venta de comida. Le agrada su trabajo ya que cuenta con un ingreso económico que le permitió suplir algunas necesidades, tiene planes de seguir trabajando en ello y mejorarlo con el paso del tiempo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará gaseosas en diferentes presentaciones y sabores, además desea incursionar en la venta de comida con la compra de algunos ingredientes como arroz, condimentos, carnes, verduras y aceite.
texts.en:
Maudi is 25 years old, married and lives in her mother's home with her husband and daughter. Maudi makes a living selling soft drinks and has a freezer that she purchased for it. From this point she has attended to her customers with ice cold refreshments. Her husband supports in attending to her clients. She has had this business for two years and will complement it with the sale of food. She likes her work because her income has allowed her to fulfill her needs. She plans to continue her business and improve it with time. 

She is now requesting 1200 nuevos soles and is thankful to those who are offering her this loan which she needs to continue developing her business. she is certain that she will continue to be a punctual client, paying all of her loan installments on time. With the amount requested she will purchase soft drinks of different brands and flavors. She also would like to venture into food sales with the purchase of ingredients including rice, condiments, meats, vegetables and oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including rice and condiments to expand into food prep.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single, 25-year-old business lady. She is the mother of one child, who is 2. She has been selling phone accessories for the last two years with success. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES, which she uses to support herself and her child. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after she having been introduced by an existing KADET client. She plans to use the loan to purchase more mobile phone accessories. The anticipated profits will be used for the education of her child. 

She hopes to become an established businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantsetseg is 43 years old and lives with her husband in a 'ger' in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband Erdenetogtoh is 51 and a plumber and provides services to his clients. 

Narantsetseg has been running a butcher shop business since 1995 in a rental stall of the local market. She has built close relationships with her customers over the years. She purchases livestock from herders and sells meat products to local customers in her stall. She is now planning to produce organic meat products and increase her sales and profit. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of livestock from herders for her business. She is hardworking, open-minded and a communicative woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of livestock from herders

loans.name: Banco Mujer Alàglowà Shkàbölö Group

texts.es:
Doña Xinia es integrante del Banco Mujer Alàglowà Shkbölö, un grupo de mujeres indígenas y el nombre significa en un su dialecto Bribrí “Mujeres Trabajadoras”. Xinia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y por problemas de salud no pudo tener hijos;  Se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos, y su plan de sus inversión es la compra de estos animales y sus alimentos, ella ya ha tenido 3 préstamos con los que pudo iniciar y consolidar su negocio, esto le brindó independencia económica, seguridad es si misma y principalmente sentirse una mujer útil y poder aportar a los gastos de su casa. Su objetivo es aumentar la producción y el engorde de sus animales y así poder abastecer a otras comunidades cercanas.  
Junto a Doña Xinia hay 4 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Xinia is a member of the Banco Mujer Alàglowà Shkbölö, a group of indigenous women. In their Bribrí dialect, the name means "Hardworking Women".

Xinia is 42 years old, married, and could not have children due to health problems. She makes a living by raising chickens and pigs, and her plan is to invest her loan in the purchase of these animals and food for them.

She has had three loans with Kiva, which she has used to begin and strengthen her business. This brings her economic independence, self-confidence, and, most importantly, allows her to feel useful and to contribute to the household expenses. 

Her goal is to increase the production and fattening of her animals and supply them to nearby communities. Along with Xinia, there are 4 other members who will invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, food, and food pellets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products, blenders, tables, and paint for her store.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 20 años, es soltera, y vive en la casa de sus padres. Mery se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas faciales y corporales y otros que compra por catálogo y los vende. Realiza este negocio hace 3 años y trabaja sola. También vende ropas para niños pero de manera ocasional en temporadas festivas. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que puede manejar su tiempo libre para ocuparlo en sus estudios, además le agrada los ingresos económicos que le genera con los cuales puede apoyar a sus padres para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de seguir trabajando ya que se siente bien y conforme con su negocio, pues le da la independencia que ella necesita. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará algunos productos de belleza como talcos y perfumes para que siga trabajando.
texts.en:
Mery is 20 years old, is single and lives in her parents' house. Mery makes a living selling beauty products such as perfumes, face and body creams and other products which she buys from a catalogue and then sells. She began her business 3 years ago and works alone. She also sells children's clothing but only occasionally during holiday times. 

What she likes about her business is that she can organise her free time to spend on her studies and she is happy with the income she generates, which enables her to help her parents out with the household expenses. She plans to carry on working and feels comfortable and happy with her business, since it gives her the independence she needs. 

On this occasion she is asking for a loan of 500 Soles. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support which will make her feel sure of making progress with her business. At the same time she promises again to be punctual in paying her instalments. She will use the sum requested to buy beauty products such as talc and perfumes so that she can carry on working.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as talc and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Patricia Emperatriz

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada. Tiene ochos años de casada vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, la señora es ama de casa y se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para construir su cocina; debido a que en este momento esta a la intemperie; por lo que no está muy segura ni cómoda. Con el préstamo, podrá satisfacer la necesidad económica que tiene de capital para la construcción de su cocina. Además de satisfacer las incomodidades que le provoca estar a la intemperie y las malas condiciones de la hornilla donde elabora las tortillas y sus alimentos; por lo que sus alimentos estarán mejor protegidos tendrán mejor salubridad.

A futuro menciono la señora,  que planea tener hijos, comenzar a incrementar su familia y junto a su esposo seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones del hogar para sus futuros hijos. Además seguir trabajando con los créditos ya que son una herramienta para salir adelante en los objetivos trazados.
texts.en:
Patricia is 24 years old and married.  She has been married for 8 years and lives with her husband, who works in agriculture.  She is head of the household and works on household chores.

The loan she is requested from Fundación Campo is to buy materials to build a kitchen.  Since right now it is outside, it is not very secure or comfortable.  With the loan, she will be able to satisfy the economic necessity of capital needed to build the kitchen and make it more comfortable to be in the kitchen, while improving the bad conditions for the oven where she cooks tortillas and other foods.  So, her foods will be better protected and will be healthier.

In the future she plans to have children.  She will start to have a family and with her husband will continue working to improve the conditions of their home for their future children.  They will keep working with the loans since they are a tool to get ahead in outlined goals.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her kitchen.

loans.name: Shamistan

texts.en:
Shamistan is 54 years old, married, and lives with his family in his own town. 

He grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. He says that even though this business is very hard,  together with his wife he has been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. 

Shamistan grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in his own store. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation.  

He is looking forward for the increased sales in the coming summer, because people purchase fruits a lot.

Nowadays he needs a loan of 1,800 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history. This is his fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Somsoore Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mr SOUMAILA est la responsable du groupe SOMSOORE II. Marié  et sans enfant. Il a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mr vend des prêt à porter depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 15. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Il veut s’acheter 12 paires de chemise et 10paires de pantalons.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il souhaite étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. SOUMAILA is responsible for the group called SOMSOORE II. Married and with no children, he is supporting two people. 

Mr. SOUMAILA has been selling ready-made clothing for four years. He buys his stock in Sector 15 market. His clients are women and men. He wishes to buy 12 shirts and 10 pairs of pants. 

He wishes to reinvest his profit in his business. He would like to expand his business and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 12 shirts and 10 pairs of pants

loans.name: Shurentsetseg

texts.en:
Shurentsetseg, 34 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her elder son studies at college and her younger son goes to high school. 

She has been running a grocery store since 2008 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in buying, marketing and selling food. Besides the grocery store, she also makes diary products and sells them to local vendors.

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy food from a China border city at a low price. As a result, she can continue to run her grocery store without worrying about inventory shortages. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase food in large quantity.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 40-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is  the mother of four children. Now they are growing older and their needs are increasing as well.
 
Previously, her husband was driving an auto rickshaw that did not belong to him, so he had to pay a daily fare to the owner of the auto rickshaw. 

He decided to buy his own rickshaw to increase his income and savings. Parveen has some savings, but they are insufficient to buy a new auto rickshaw. That is why she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 so that her husband could buy a new auto rickshaw.

She hopes that this loan can bring happiness and joy to her family’s life and she can easily meet the daily household expenses.

Parveen is very glad after taking this loan and assures us that she will payback the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy their own auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 35-year-old woman living with her spouse and  five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop, where he earns sufficient income for his family. Recently, he spend a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which affected his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. He tried to take loans from banks and other organizations but he does not have any property to use as security. 

So Shagufta requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because BRAC Pakistan provides the facility to empower poor people without asking about assets. With the help of the loan, Shagufta's husband will purchase products for the butcher shop.

Shagufta wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. 
She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase products for the butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ceramic floor tiles.

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Obed, who in in his mid 40s, is married and has four children, and all of them are still at school.  

He has been running a retail shop, selling food items for three years now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Obed's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory. At first, he had small capital, so the shop had very few items, but as he was taking more loans, he was increasing the stock inventory. He is happy with the loan because the shop has grown more. He has paid back all his loans successfully. 

He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the shop inventory -- things like sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, packets of salt, maize flour, etc. He dreams to shop more business items in future. 

He will share this loan with her loan group "Mbayuwayu," which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the shop inventory.

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Batdelger, 28 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. She has been renting and running  a shop where she sells souvenirs and CDs to local people. Her husband is a driver and currently working at a transportation company. 

Five years ago, she and her husband built their house and since that time, they haven't made any renovations. So she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass, bricks, foam, planks and shingles. Using those materials, the family will repair and insulate their old house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Aby's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois en avril 2010 et il est composé de femmes commerçantes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.

Madame Aby est la représentante, elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont quatre garçons.

Elle s'active dans le commerce de bois de chauffe depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce 

domaine .

Son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs CFA lui permettra de s'approvisionner en bois de chauffe qu'elle aura revendu dans son village.

Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettent d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge économique sanitaire et 

scolaire de ses enfants et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of small loans of the "banc villageois" in April 2010 and it is made up of businesswomen who are united by good social and professional relations. 

Madame Aby, the representative, is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of nine children, among whom there are four sons. She has been working at firewood selling for a long time and has a good deal of experience in this field. 

Her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA will permit her to stock up on firewood that she will resell in her village. The profit from her business will allow her to help her husband support their children financially, covering healthcare and schooling, and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 63-year-old man from Bugumbe West, located in Migori county in Western Kenya. He supports six people in his family. He is married to Salome, who is a farmer, and together they support their family. Joseph has five children who are 25, 19, 18, 17 and 16 years old.

Joseph has been a hawker for the last seven years and generates a monthly income of KES 28,000. He is taking his first loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to purchase brand new goods like custom-made toys for hawking. He will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

His dream is to become financially stable and take good care of his family with his business.

loans.use: To purchase more toys for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy packaging materials so that she can sell well-packed medicine

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old; he is married with one child, age four. 

He has been selling different items such as potatoes, rice and bananas for three years.  Emmanuel wants the loan to add more items such as potatoes, rice and bananas to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, rice and bananas for sale

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is 55 years old, a widowed woman with three daughters.  She is applying for a loan of 1800 AZN  to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house selling gold. She is making a good income from selling gold and she wants to buy more inventory with the loan. 

Zamina lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she makes sales every day. She began her business in 2001 with her own working capital. Zamina  is thankful to Aqroinvest   and Kiva for supporting her.She has a good loan history and this is her 6th loan.

loans.use: to buy more inventory with the loan

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha is 63 years old, from Ndunyu Njeru, and she supports one child, age 18 years. 

She is a farmer and has applied for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labour. She paid her previous loan on time. She hopes to expand her farming business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future Maritha hopes to grow her farming business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a father of one child aged one. He is 34 years old. He owns a restaurant, selling cooked food. With the loan, he wants to buy more cooking oil and beans for use in the restaurant. The profits from the business will be used to put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more food for use in his restaurant.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
This is Mirriam, 54, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Calixto, a seaman, and they have children. 

Mirriam operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community; she earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day. She manages their household while operating the business, and she and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mirriam hopes that her business will continue to grow, and dreams of a better life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Merg

texts.en: Merg, a 47-year-old divorcee, has six children who are all in school. She resorted to dairy farming since there was available land and so she had to look for a market in hotels and dairies in order to get income to take care of the needs of all her children and dependents. She is thankful to Ugafode for giving her financial aid when she needed it most. She has been able to grow her business using the funds and is excited that Kiva is interested in partnering with her. She is hard working and shrewd, and she believes she will go far in her business.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 31 años está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus dos hijos. Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de comidas peruanas. Trabaja de lunes a viernes por las noches en la casa de su hermana. Realiza este negocio hace 5 años y desde que empezó lo ha hecho sola. Aprendió de su madre los secretos para cocinar bien Tiene mucho éxito, y siempre vende todo su comida. Ahora desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar las mesas y sillas donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará un carrito para vender sus comidas e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como papas, carnes, condimentos, aceites, harina y otros.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 31 years old, is married, and lives in her own house together with her husband and their two children.  Alejandrina works selling peruvian food.  She works from Monday to Friday in the evening at her sister's house.  She started this business 5 years ago and has been doing it by herself the whole time.  She learned the secret to cooking well from her mother and she has great success, always selling all of her food.

She now wants to expand her business and improve the tables and seats so she can make her customers more comfortable.  She is now asking for 2,500 sols.  She is grateful and happy to know that she continues to have the financial support that she needs to move forward and progress her business.

With the amount requested, she will buy a cart to use to sell her food and ingredients that she uses to make it, such as potatoes, meat, sauces/seasonings, oils, flour, etc.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make her food.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda. Her previous loan helped her in buying more items for her buy and sell business. The loan also helped in the education of her children and in their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a variety store.

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She will also use the loan in buying items for her buy and sell business. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her family will always have good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 36 years old. She sells different items in her business. With the loan, she wants to add more vegetable cooking oil and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees. She is very happy with the previous loan, which helped him to expand the volume of her sales.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store for resale.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra, de 25 años de edad, es la propietaria de un negocio de Diseño gráfico y publicidad, desde hace 3 años,  cuando ella como observadora, percibió  esa necesidad en muchas de las empresas a su alrededor y en términos de potenciar sus habilidades mientras generaba ingresos,  decidió ponerlas al servicio de la comunidad, en el municipio de Soledad. Los principales productos de su oferta son los diseños gráficos, artículos publicitarios, a los cuales aplica los avances de la tecnología del internet. Alexandra inicia su jornada de trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde, para atender a sus principales clientes, que son empresas aledañas y vecinos que habitan a su alrededor. En la actualidad Alexandra está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina laser de impresión. Con los anteriores créditos ha logrado adecuar su infraestructura y con ello ha alcanzado más clientes. Su meta es establecerse adecuadamente y finalmente formar una familia saludable. Mientras esto ocurre Alexandra se esmera día a día, por hacer crecer su empresa, aplicando a ella mucho trabajo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Alexandra, who is 25 years old, is the owner of a graphic design and advertising business. Three years ago, looking around her, she noticed a need for this in many of the businesses around her and in order to improve her skills while earning an income, she decided to offer these skills as a service to the community in the municipality of Soledad. The main products she offers are graphic design and advertising, for which she makes use of the technological advances of the internet.

Alexandra works from 8 in the morning until 6 at night to offer a service to her main customers, who are neighbouring businesses and people who live nearby. Currently Alexandra is asking for a Kiva loan, a second loan, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy a laser printer. 

With the previous loans she has been able to build up her infrastructure and thus been able to reach more customers. Her goal is to become firmly established and eventually start a healthy family. In the meantime, Alexandra puts in a lot of hard work and dedication every day to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy a laser printer.

loans.name: Al-Sana Group

texts.en: Al-Sana is a group that consists of four women who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 160,000 YER. Sana is a 39-year-old married woman who is happy to be a part of this group. She distributes women's clothing, perfumes and incense. She started the business with a small amount, in order to earn more profit. She loves her work and hopes to continue. She has applied for her second loan of 40,000 YER, which she will use to continue buying clothes, perfumes and incense for resale. The members of this group thank Kiva for funding the first loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for her business

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, de 49 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 02 hijos de 27 y 18 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Florinda tiene un salón de belleza , el cual está instalado en su hogar , desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes brindándoles un buen servicio, se inicio con un capital propio hace 04 años, realizando sus labores por si sola. Le gusta su negocio de belleza pues aprendió todo lo necesario en un centro de estudios de su localidad, ahora contando con los ingresos económicos que le genera su actividad económica, desea continuar con su negocio, y con la ganancias desea ampliar su salón de belleza para poder atender a más personas  y darles una mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será su séptimo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelnate, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará materiales para implementar su salón de belleza como tintes, líquidos de uñas, tijeras y otros.
texts.en:
Florinda is 49 years old, divorced, and has 2 children who are 27 and 18 years old.  She lives with them in her own house.  Florinda has her own beauty salon within her house where she attends to her customers in a friendly manner, offering them good service.  She started it 4 years ago with her own money and doing all the work herself.

She likes her beauty salon and learned everything she needs to run it from a school in her community.  With the funds that her work earns her, she wishes to continue to improve her business by expanding her beauty parlor and thus be able to serve more people and make her customers more comfortable.
