This will be her 7th Kiva and she is grateful for the support that she gets that helps her progress.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time.  With the amount requested (1,000 sols), she will buy supplies to add to her beauty salon, including dyes, nail polish, scissors, etc.

loans.use: buy supplies such as dyes, nail polish, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man aged 39 with five children  of whom three attend school. He is a business man with a retail shop in a trading center that sells all types of  merchandise from his home area. He says he works seven days a week. He has a banana plantation which is also a source of income to him. 

He started the a retail business in the year 2008 and he says it has been prosperous because of hard work.

Peter says that the reason why he started this business is to take care of his family and he acquired this loan to buy more stock for the business so to expand it. He says that his main clients are from different areas surrounding the area where he has the shop. He faces a challenge of bad debtors and lack of enough capital to adequately meet the requirements of his customers which leads to them going to other people that have the items.

He describes himself as a hard-working man and a focused man who will soon overcome the challenge now that he is getting financing from Ugafode.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: 3.9.305.9.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đợi is 27 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

Mrs. Đợi has a business selling fruit; she has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Đợi is the group leader of the 3.9.305.9.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members.  This is Đợi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell.

With her business profit, Đợi hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 32 years old. She sells rice and has been in the business for two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice to sell. Her dream is to become a rice distributor in the future. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: 03.01.84 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Hạnh is 62 years old and she is married with two children. Hạnh is the group leader of the 03.01.84 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent; her other child is grown up.

In 2011, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Lormero

texts.en:
Lormero lives in the town of Cavaillon, in the South Department of Haiti. He has had a store for 4 years that sells Digicel cellular phone, SIM card, phone recharge card and there is a Western Union inside. He has one employee in his store. He has recently decided to start selling EarthSpark clean energy products to expand his current business and hopefully be able to employ more staff.

With a Kiva loan, Lormero will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills to launch his business. For his first inventory he will purchase solar desk lamps and charcoal-efficient cookstoves.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Tiornola 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  TIORNOLA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à IFOLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Mme ASSANATOU debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et  semences agricoles pour entretenir 1hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 115.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called TIORNOLA 2 are married women with an average age of 43 and on average, four children, all living in polygamous families in Ifola, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
They work together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution and the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

The crop cultivated by Mrs. Assanatou, standing in the middle, is maize. With her loan she is intending to buy inputs and seeds to farm one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village, at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to make a profit of 115,000 francs CFA this season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install seals around his doors and windows.

loans.name: Tiornola 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  TIORNOLA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à IFOLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme  SATOU debout en troisième  position de la  droite vers la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 1hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the TIORNOLA 3 group are married  women who are, on average, 43 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Ifola, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third-largest administrative region of Mali). 

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their seventh loan with this institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Satou, third from the right in the photo, grows maize.  She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds in order to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.  After the harvest, she sells her production in her village, at the market, to both men and women.

She is expecting to make a profit of 85,000 CFA francs per growing season, which will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: 3.14.306.1.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Công works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Công is 40 years old, and she is married with four children. One child is grown, so Công supports three dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Công joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Công is the group leader of the 3.14.306.1. Thiệu Khánh Solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Công hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Vilma quien con su credikiva aumentó su capital de trabajo, pudo tener un fondo de efectivo para atender los pedidos de su clientela. Su clientes aumentaron, así como también sus ventas y utilidades lo cual dio una gran satisfacción a Vilma, porque sus ingreso familiares están mejorando. Ella dice a sus financiadores que está: “Muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido; aspiro a seguir recibiéndolo”. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo financiamiento, mediante Kiva, con el cual comprará calzado, perfumería y cosméticos, pues ya llegó el segundo semestre del año y con ello el usual ascenso de sus ventas, porque su clientela fija empieza a solicitar pedidos y a recomendarle nuevos compradores y esto es justamente el éxito e su credikiva.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Vilma who used her Kiva loan to increase her working capital.  She was able to have funds sufficient to fill her customer orders.  The number of her customers increased as well as her sales and profits which gave Vilma much satisfaction because her family income is improving.  She says to her lenders: “I’m very grateful for the economic support received; I hope to continue receiving it.”  

She’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy shoes, perfumery and cosmetics because the second semester of the year has arrived and sales usually increase at this time.  Because her clientele is regular, they start placing orders and recommending new buyers to her and this is precisely the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumery and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sik M Minga Group

texts.fr:
Mr ALOYS est la responsable du groupe SIK M MINGA. Marié, il est père d’un (01) enfant. L’enfant est âgé de 03ans. Il a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mr fait la mercerie depuis 02ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Il veut s’acheter 12 rouleaux de popeline et 05 rouleaux de doubles colles.
Mr veut épargner ses bénéfices. Il souhaite étendre les limites de son activité et acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Aloys is the representative of the Sik M Minga group.  He is married and the father of a 3-year-old child.  He financially supports two persons.

He has been selling sewing supplies for two years.  He stocks up at the District 10 market and resells to both men and women.

He wants to buy 12 rolls of poplin and five rolls of double-sided adhesive tape.

Aloys wants to save his profits, expand his activity and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 12 rolls of poplin and five rolls of double-sided adhesive tape.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira, junto a su hija.
Desde hace mas de 8 años que inicio su negocio de venta de comida y golosinas, con el fin de obtener recursos económicos para la subsistencia.
Doña María elabora tamales, ticucos (alimento típico de maíz, y carne) y pan, además en su vivienda vende golosinas, abarrotes, dulces y condimentos. La venta de tamales la realiza en forma ambulante en su comunidad.
Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo por la cantidad de 8,000 Lempiras, para surtir su negocio de productos como harina de maíz, condimentos, carnes, abarrotes, y otras golosinas para vender.
Su sueño es que su hija se gradúe y que las ventas se incrementen para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 59, is a single mother. She lives with her daughter in a rural community in the municipality of Gracias, which is in the department of Lempira.

More than 8 years ago, she started her business selling food and snacks in order to earn money to make a living. Maria makes tamales, ticucos (a traditional dish made from corn and meat), and bread. She also sells snacks, groceries, sweets, and condiments from her home. She sells her tamales from place to place in her community. 

She has requested her second loan for 8,000 Honduran lempiras to stock up her business with products such as corn flour, condiments, meat, groceries, and other snacks to sell. Her dream is for her daughter to graduate and for her sales to increase so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to stock up her business with products such as corn flour, condiments, meat, groceries, and other snacks.

loans.name: Martha De Jesús

texts.es:
Martha  tiene 39 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. posee 18 años de experiencia en su negocio de tortilleria y una tienda, esta aprendiendo el oficio por si sola, ya que sus padres no le dieron estudio no tuvo la oportunidad de encontrar un empleo formal, y es de su negocio que logra mantener a su familia. Ella, inicia la jornada de elaborar tortillas a las 9: 00 de la mañana y termina a las 12 : 00 meridiano, para lo cual utiliza una hornilla de leña y un comal de arcilla o barro, aunque su compañero de vida,  también le ayuda en la atención de sus clientes en la tienda 

 Martha aborda un autobús en su comunidad, viaja durante 20 minutos hasta la ciudad, en donde compra sus productos para la tienda las compras las hace por la tarde ya que en la mañana se dedica a la tortilleria, luego regresa a casa con sus compras.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 sacos de maíz, 1 saco de frijoles , arroz, aceite, azúcar, leña y todo lo necesario para surtir su tienda y poder dar buen servicio a todos sus clientes y satisfacer sus demandas y evitara salir muy seguido a la ciudad a comprar por poquitos, ya que esto le incurre en mas gastos y precios mas elevados.

Planea ahorrar y dar estudio a sus hijos para que estos al ser adultos sean profesionales útiles al país y su familia.
texts.en:
Martha, 39, has a spouse and two children.  She has 18 years’ experience in her tortilla and grocery store business.  She’s learning the occupation on her own because he parents didn’t provide her with schooling and she’s never been able to get a formal job so she manages to support her family by means of her business.  She starts making tortillas at nine in the morning and finishes at noon.  To do so, she uses a wood-burning stove and a clay griddle.  Her life companion helps her take care of customers in the store.

Martha boards a bus in her community and takes a 20-minute trip to the city where she buys the goods for the store.  She makes her purchases afternoons because she spends mornings making tortillas; she then returns home with her purchases.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 5 sacks of corn, one sack of beans, rice, oil, sugar, firewood and everything needed to stock her store and provide good customer service and meet demand; she will also be able to avoid having to go into the city so often to buy things little by little since this incurs more expense and higher prices.

She plans to save and provide her children with schooling so that when they become adults they will be professionals useful to the country and to their family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es: Doris de 42 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, etc.  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus  tres hijos, Doris  desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, labiales, etc. ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles,  con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Doris, 42, sells all types of personal use items like lotion, deodorant, perfume, cream, etc.  Her business is home-based and she uses profits earned from her sales and help from her husband to cover household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  

Doris wants to enlarge the business and this is why she’s requesting a loan that will make it possible for her to buy everything needed like perfume, nail polish, deodorant, lipstick, etc. because she has many customers because she sells her products at affordable prices.  With the requested help she’ll be able to earn higher profits so she can continue providing for her family’s needs with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy perfume, nail polish, deodorant, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehia is a 25-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. He has been working as a blacksmith since three years ago. To be able to afford the high costs of living and meet his family’s needs, Yehia is obliged to work very hard. Even though, he stated that his financials are barely enough.

So today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase tools and tackle needed to help him enhance his way of work. 

Yehia is very positive about the future of his business and is willing to expand his work into other areas in the coming days.

loans.use: to purchase tools and tackle needed for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 45 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos con su esposa y viven en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Anteriormente solo tenia el negocio de discomóvil que alquila para eventos especiales, y hace mas de 5 años decidió por establecer el negocio de una llantera, presta el servicio de reparación de llantas para vehículos, motos y bicicletas y además vende repuestos como llantas, neumáticos y otros. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 17,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar repuestos como llantas usadas, neumáticos, para vehículos, y camiones para su negocio.  Tiene como plan lograr tener los dos negocios libres de deudas y en crecimiento.
texts.en:
Francisco, 45, is married and has two children with his wife; they live in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  His only business used to bet to rent a portable jukebox for special events but more than five years ago decided to start a tire repair shop; he provides tire repair services for vehicles, motorcycles and bicycles and also sells spare parts like tires, inner tubes and others.  

The loan he’s requested is for 17,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy used tires and inner tubes for vehicles and trucks for his business.  His plan is to have both businesses debt-free and growing.

loans.use: to buy tires and inner tubes for vehicles, motorcycles, bicycles and trucks.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
This is Nemesia, 58, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Nilo, a taxi driver and a father to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nemesia operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy biscuits from wholesalers and then sells the biscuits to customers for a profit. She also does a rug-making business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales daily.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stock of different biscuits to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

Nemesia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of different biscuits needed in her business.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Don luis vive con su esposa en casa propia, el es un hombre trabajador, responsable, desde  hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso esta solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y asi que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his own house with his wife.  He’s a hardworking, responsible man who has been working for several years producing and selling dairy products in the zone where he resides.  He has a very good clientele because he’s known how to win over their trust.  He offers quality and good prices in his products and he’s decided to invest in his cattle’s care since his business depends on that.

This is why he’s asked for a loan to be able to buy vitamins and feed concentrate for the cattle which will allow his business to grow.  With this, he expects to obtain favorable results and to continue providing economic help at home that is so needed.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and animal feed.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Zenon de 43 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz, cuando ha pasado la cosecha trabaja de albañil, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas y con el pago de su trabajo logra solventar algunos de los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Zenon está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Zenon is 43 years old and has been working in agriculture for many years planting beans and corn. When harvest time is over he works in construction. With the sales he receives from his harvest and from his work he is able to pay his living expenses. Zenon is a responsible, honest and hardworking man. He lives with his wife and four children. 

Zenon is requesting a loan to be able to buy supplies for his crop such as fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc... His present earning isn’t enough to cover those costs. This way he can have a better income and have financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc...

loans.name: Tukhtamurod

texts.ru: Тухтамурод семейный человек. У него жена, двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Он проживает со своей семьей в селе Кумшох, джамоате Х.Холматов района Шахритус. Тухтамуроду 34 года. Он подзарабатывает на жизнь таксистом. Его доход едва хватает на семейные расходы. Поэтому Тухтамурод решил начать новый бизнес. Его интересует животноводство. Он хочет заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота, так как это прибыльное дело. Тухтамурод имеет все условия для разведения скота. Во дворе его дома есть коровник размером 8х4 метра, построенный с кирпича, досок и шифера. А также в их селе имеется хорошее пастбище для разведения скота. С этой целью Тухтамурод обратился за кредитом, чтобы начать бизнес. На сумму кредита он хочет приобрести двух голов крупно-рогатого скота для откорма и продажи. С помощью нового бизнеса Тухтамурод хочет улучшить условия проживания семьи. По природе Тухтамурод позитивный человек. Он верит в успех бизнеса и ожидает от Вас поддержки.
texts.en: Tukhtamurod is a family man.  He has a wife, two sons and two daughters.  He lives with his family in the Kumshoh village, H. Holmatov jamoat of the Shahrituz district.  Tukhtamurod is 34 years old.  He earns a living by working as a taxi driver.  His salary is barely enough for family expenses.  This is why Tukhtamurod decided to start a new business.  He is interested in animal husbandry.  He wants to get involved in buying and selling cattle because it is a profitable business.  Tukhtamurod has all of the conditions for breeding livestock.  He has an 8x4 meter cowshed, built from bricks, wood panels and slate, in the yard of his house.  Also, their village has good pastures for raising livestock.  With this goal, Tukhtamurod requested a loan to start this business.  He wants to use the loan to buy two heads of cattle for fattening up and resale.  Tukhtamurod wants to improve his family's living conditions with the help of the new business.  Tukhtamurod is a positive person by nature.  He believes in the business success and awaits support from you.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle for fattening up and resale in order to start his new animal husbandry business

loans.name: 3.14.307.3.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Thêu works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 60 years old and she is married with one child. Her child is grown up so Thêu supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thêu is the group leader of the 3.14.307.3.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2012, Thêu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Thêu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thêu hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.14.308.2.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Bích works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Bích is 50 years old and she is married with two children. Her children are grown up so Bích supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Bích is the group leader of the 3.14.308.2.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2012, Bích joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Bích has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bích hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Concepción Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Posee 4 años de experiencia en su negocio de venta de sorbetes, esta aprendió el oficio por si sola, ya que sus padres no le dieron estudio no tuvo la oportunidad de encontrar un empleo formal, y es de su negocio que logra mantener a su familia, ademas viaja todos los días en autobús desde su comunidad hasta el centro de la ciudad durante 30 minutos, para lo cual aborda un autobús a las 5:00 de la mañana luego llega a su local donde elabora el chocolate, luego rellena los conos con sorbete y los baña de chocolate y los embolsa, para cuando llegan los vendedores, ella ya les tiene lista la venta a cada uno y los despacha para que salgan a vender, al final del día a las 4:00 de la tarde aborda el autobús y regresa a su casa   

ella,  inicio su negocio con poquita venta, luego ha venido creciendo y alquila un pequeño local donde funciona su negocio  y es  así como  los distribuidores mayoristas le llevan el producto hasta su local. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para  incrementar los inventarios de su sorbeteria, también quiere comprar unos novillos para engorde en repasto de unos $600.00; ya que así sus hijos también se mantendrán ocupados cuidando los animales y no estén pensando en cosas malas y al final de un periodo de tiempo los venderá  y recibirá un ingreso extra  para la subsistencia de su familia.


Planea ahorrar y dar estudio a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y también hacer grande su casa ya que es bien pequeña.
texts.en:
Marina is 33 years old, married, and has three children.  She has four years’ experience in her ice cream business and learned this trade on her own.  Her parents were not able to provide her with an education so she could not get a job.  She supports her family through her business and boards the bus at 5:00 am every day to go from her community to the city center.  She arrives at her workplace where she makes the chocolate and then adds the ice cream to the cones, dips them in chocolate, and packages them up so that they are ready for when the salesmen arrive to pick them up.  Her day ends at 4:00 pm, when she boards the bus to return home.

She started her business with few sales, but they grew and she rents a small shop where she runs her business and where the suppliers make their deliveries.

She is asking for this loan through Fundación Campo in order to increase her ice cream inventory and she also wants to buy some steers for about $600 to raise in a pasture.  This way her children will also stay busy looking after the animals rather than thinking about bad things.  She will sell the steers and receive extra income to support the family after some time. 

She plans to save up to provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals and increase the size of her small home.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Negociantes (Business Women) Group

texts.en:
The women of this group, located in the municipality of San Francisco, Suchitepéquez, are calling themselves the Mujeres Negociantes (Business Women) as that is precisely how they see themselves. Each of them is eager to improve their lives and families and they believe they will be able to do this through their businesses, despite the difficult economic situation in Guatemala. The group is composed of a diverse collection of businesses that includes small stores selling daily need products, clothing sales, shoe sales and even a Christian bookstore.  

Gabriela Cecilia is one of the members of the Mujeres Negociantes. She is a young single mother with a 4 year-old son, whom she has been raising on her own for the last three years.  Gabriela has an 8th grade education.  Two years ago, her mother gave her Q500 (US$65) to host a birthday party for her then 2 year-old son. However, instead of investing in a party, Gabriela Cecilia took the money and bought blouses and pants to re-sell, igniting her entrepreneurial spirit. She realized that she and her child’s need went beyond a one day event and she thought if she could make money on the money given to her by her mother, she would be able to provide for herself and her son. 

Since that day, Gabriela has continued to be involved in the sale of clothes. Her dream is to increase her stock of products and add lingerie to her business as well as purchase her pants in blouses in bulk. She currently has a profit of Q639 (US$83) and works 2 hours a day Monday thru Friday, averaging $1.38/hour.  Her business plan shows that with a loan of she will be able to improve her stock of lingerie, blouses and pants.  She is going to increase her area of sales (which she does door to door) and she plans to double her working hours.  Her foreseen profit is Q1,546 (US$201) per month.

Gabriela’s inspiration is her son. She is working hard to improve her business to be a positive role model to him and raise a good man!

Gabriela is the first one from left to right on the picture.

loans.use: add new products to her clothes business and increase her profits

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  N'GOLONIANA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme MAH assise la quatrième position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 35.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women who are, on average, 37 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in N'goloniana, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Mah, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the front row, fourth from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds in order to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.  

After the harvest, she sells her production at her village market to both men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 35,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 48-year-old, married man, living with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. 

Since 2011, he has owned a bakery and he has worked for more than 25 years in this occupation. He produces tasty pastries and bread which he sells to many customers from his town and adjacent villages. 

With his requested loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., Mahmoud will purchase a grill machine, since he plans to start serving sandwiches, and a refrigerator, to keep his products in good condition. He is very positive and he is sure that the loan will help him achieve remarkable growth in a short period.

loans.use: to purchase a grill machine and a refrigerator for his bakery.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола является повторной клиенткой в ИМОНе. Она добросовестная и честная женщина и поэтому первый займ она погасила вовремя. Лола замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Лола с детства была трудолюбивой и помогала родителям по домохозяйству. После замужества, она трудилась еще больше, так как ее муж не имел достаточного дохода для содержания семьи. Лола хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей индустриальных товаров. Она будет торговать на местном рынке. С полученного дохода, она собирается улучшить условию проживания и отправить своих детей в хорошие школы. Она всегда помогает бедным людям и имеет доброе сердце. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для приобретения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lola is a repeat client of IMON.  She is a conscientious woman and this is why she repaid her first loan on-time.  Lola is married and raising two children.  Since childhood, Lola has been a hard worker and helped her parents with the household.  After getting married, she worked even harder because her husband did not have enough income to support the family.  Lola wants to organize her own business of buying and selling industrial goods.  She will sell them at a local market.  She plans to use the resulting income to improve her quality of living and send her children to good schools.  She always helps poor people and has a kind heart.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars to obtain a working capital.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy home products and start her new business

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  N'GOLONIANA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Mme  ROKIA  debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in N'goloniana, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Rokia, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is standing, first from the left.  

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds in order to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production at her village market, and her customers are both men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 50,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 60 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores siembras, cuando sus cosechas  están listas las comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio;  francisco necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc.  y poder mejorar el terreno donde desea sembrar que es el que muestra la fotografía para obtener mejores cosechas y poder seguir llevando el pan de cada días a su hogar sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Francisco, 60, lives with his life partner in their own home. He grows corn and beans. He has been working in agriculture for 10 years and it has provided him with experience which allows him to have the best cultivated land. When his crops are ready, he sells them around the community. He already has many customers because of the quality, good prices and above all the good service. 

Francisco is requesting a loan with INTEGRAL because he needs to invest it in his crops. The loan will allow him to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, etc... Also, it will allow him to improve his harvesting land, shown in the photograph, in order to have a better harvest and to be able to continue bringing money home daily without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, etc...

loans.name: Al-Kfah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Kfah Group. It consists of five women who applied for a loan of YER 340,000. 

Afrah is a 48-year-old, married woman who sells women's clothes in her stand, located in Aden, Yemen. She applied for a second loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) and will use the loan to buy a variety of clothes to stock her business. The reason for requesting the loan is that she received some orders, but she did not have the necessary capital to get the products. 

Afrah’s business challenges are competition and high seasonal demand, so she will use the profits to increase her merchandise and, thus, her sales. She and the rest of the members of the group thank Kiva lenders for funding them in their first loan and they hope to be funded in this group.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to stock her business.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en: Rodulfo is 56 years old and is married. He and his wife work hard to provide for their children’s needs. In fact, Rodulfo is willing to work hard every single day to give his family a good quality of life. While his wife has raised hogs in their village, Rodulfo has devoted himself to farming rice for the past twenty years. He is now requesting a 18,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizer for his crops. He hopes to harvest more rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijas y vive con su esposo e hijas en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente trabajo por muchos años en la maquila y su experiencia la ha desarrollado con su propio negocio. Hace 5 años que se dedica a la confección de ropa de cama, cortinas, forros de muebles y también hace reparaciones de pantalones, blusas, camisas, etc. la ropa de cama y cortinas las vende de forma ambulante y por pedidos. El préstamo que solicita es por 2,500 Lempiras para comprar telas e hilos, agujas para la confección de los pedidos que tiene por sus clientes. El sueño de su vida es llegar a tener su propia casa y que sus hijas se gradúen.
texts.en:
María is 40, married, and a mother of three daughters. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Choloma, Cortes. 

María previously worked for many years in a factory, an experience that led her to open her own business. She has for five years worked making items such as bedding, curtains, and furniture covers. María also mends pants, blouses, shirts, etc., and sells bedding and curtains in the street and by special order. 

María is requesting a loan of 2,500 Lempiras to purchase fabric, thread, and needles to meet orders from her customers. María's dream is to own her own home and see her children graduate from school.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc., for her seamstress shop.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco de 45 años  de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco  hijos,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol.  Francisco desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 45, is a very devoted family man who has always provided the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and five children. 

Francisco is very hard-working farmer and grows the principal grain crops in the area, corn and beans. He has always gone about his work cheerfully and with great enthusiasm. Francisco would like to boost his sales, so he visited the offices of INTEGRAL to request a loan that would allow him to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and other agricultural supplies. He hopes to receive the loan as he has no other income and these funds will allow him to keep providing for his family's daily needs without difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda, 42 years old, is married to a carpenter and they are blessed with two children. 

For almost ten years, she's been engaged in a hog-raising business. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 2,500 per hog. 

Luzviminda wants to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her hog-raising business will grow, so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 62 years old. She is married with two children. She sells cabbage and has been in the business for the past eleven years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more cabbage for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale, such as cabbages.

loans.name: Amsardine Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est la responsable du groupe AMSARBINE. Marié, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 01 va à l’école. 
Mme fait la restauration depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne àBissighin. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de riz et 01sac de maïs pour sa cuisine.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices pour son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the AMSARDINE group.  She is married and the mother of two children.  Her oldest child is 25, the youngest is 12.  One of her children is in school.

Mariam has been preparing meals for the past seven years.  She buys her supplies in Bissighin and her customers are both men and women.

She wants to buy one bag of rice and one bag of maize for her kitchen.

She wants to save her profits in order to invest in her business.  Her goal is to expand her activity and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice and one bag of maize for her kitchen.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр трудолюбивый человек. Ему 53 года. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Бахтиёр с целью получения дохода и обеспечения семьи, 13 лет назад начал свой бизнес предоставлением услугу такси. Он очень хорошо знает все тонкости своего дела, так как имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу. Бахтиёр очень общительный человек и он очень вежливо относится со своими клиентами, поэтому он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет отремонтировать свою машину марки Опель-Астра. Он не имеет достаточно денег для ремонта машины и поэтому он запрашивает займ для ремонта машины. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на вашу благотворительность.
texts.en: Bahtiyor is a hardworking person.  He is 53 years old.  He is married and has four children.  Bahtiyor started his taxi service business 13 years ago in order to earn an income and provide for his family.  He knows all of nuances of his business very well because he has a lot of experience in this business.  Bahtiyor is a very communicable person and treats all of his customers politely and this is why he has his regular customers.  He wants to repair his Opel Astra car.  He does not have enough money to repair his car and this is why he is requesting this loan to repair the car.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to repair his Opel Astra car

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma, 66, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow, and she has ten children who all have moved out of her house already. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Thelma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Thelma dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to have peace and joy every day.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Kelly, quien con su credikiva logró comprar vidrios y pinturas para tallar y decorar. Ella con esta inversión logró tener un buen inventario y cubrir la demanda de sus productos. Su negocio ha crecido, tiene nuevos clientes y ofrece servicios de instalación, que antes no ofrecía.  A Kelly la tiene muy motivada por el crecimiento de su negocio.  Por eso envía el siguiente mensaje  de agradecimiento a sus financiadores: “Estoy muy contenta por la oportunidad de tener un crédito y ver como crece mi negocio. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a una nueva financiación con Kiva, mediante la cual comprará vidrios, porque dibujará paisajes para exponerlos,  debido a que su local está ubicado en un sector muy comercial y necesita impactar su mercado, para potencializar la venta y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Thanks to Kelly's previous Kiva loan, she has been able to buy glass and paintings to carve and decorate. With that loan, she was able to have a good inventory and could cover the demand for her products. Her business has grown with new clients, and she now offers installation services, which she didn't before.  Kelly is very motivated to grow her business. That is why she sends the following message of thanks to her supporters: "I am very happy to have the opportunity to have a loan and see how it grows my business." Currently, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva, with which she will buy glass so she can draw landscapes for display. Her business is located in a very commercial area, and she needs to impact the market in order to strengthen her sales, which is exactly what her loan from Kiva helps her do.

loans.use: to buy glass so she can draw landscapes for display.

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Sheilla from Bulawayo. She is widowed and cares for her five children. They are all attending school, primary and secondary. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Sheilla runs a retail business, selling clothes, footwear and kitchen utensils. She also sells blankets, suitcases and ladies’ fashion bags. The business has been in operation for over three years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital to fulfill her orders.

Sheilla has requested a loan of USD 750 to order stocks of clothes, footwear, blankets and kitchen wares. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees and cover other household expenses. 

In the future, Sheilla plans to open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been involved in cattle breeding for many years. She breeds a cow, oxen and ten sheep. Her husband helps Anahit to sell gathered agricultural products locally and gather income. Anahit and her family live in a small village, Lukashin, which is located in the Armavir region. Locals here are mostly involved in land cultivation so the meat and milk that Anahit gathers from her cattle breeding business are in high demand.

Anahit has a retired mother-in-law and a son. The whole family works hard to gather enough income to cover the family's minimal needs. Now Anahit has requested this loan in order to increase her livestock. With the loan's help she plans to purchase five oxen and ten sheep. This is very important for the whole family to enlarge their farming activities and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for five oxen and ten sheep

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра проживает вместе со своей семьей в сельской местности. Она более 15 лет занимается скотоводством и еще работает в сельсовете секретарём. Ее муж Азим, предприниматель и они имеет 3 детей. Сын Гулчехры студент и она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Гулчехра запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulchehra lives with her family in a rural area.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years and also works as a secretary at the village council.  Her husband, Azim, is an entrepreneur, and they have three children.  Gulchehra's son is a student, and she has to pay for his tuition contract, but does not have money.  Gulchehra is requesting a loan in the amount of 1050 US dollars to pay for her son's tuition.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru: Давлат трудолюбивый человек, который имеет доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Давлат занимается скотоводством. Он имеет большой опыт в этой сфере, так как уже более 23 лет, он занимается скотоводством. Давлат покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и перепродает по более высокой цене, чем он приобрел. Он имеет дополнительный доход от земледелия. Корм для скота он выращивает сам и поэтому он бесплатно откармливает скот. Введению бизнеса его жена и дети помогают ему. Он хочет достроить дом, который он начал построить несколько лет назад. Он сделал фундамент дома и теперь хочет сделать стены и покрыть крышу дома. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 11500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, кирпич, древесину и т.п.  для постройки дома. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему достроить дом и таким образом улучшить условию домохозяйства.
texts.en: Davlat is a hardworking person, who has a kind heart and a good disposition.  He is married and raising two children.  Davlat is involved in animal husbandry.  Davlat buys livestock, fattens it up for several months and resells it at a higher price than what he purchased it for.  He has an additional income from farming.  He grows livestock feed himself and thus feeds livestock for free.  His wife and children help him with running the business.  He wants to finish building a house that he started building several years ago.  He made the foundation for the home and now wants to build walls and the roof of the house.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 11500 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, bricks, wood, etc., to build his house.  He awaits your kindness.  This loan will help him to finish building the house and therefore improve the household conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, bricks, wood, etc., to build his house

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.ru: Махмадсаиду 28 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Махмадсаид в 2007 году окончил Таджикский Экономический Университет. Он прошел стажировку в Китае. Махмадсаид работает в заводе по производству цемента. Он очень трудолюбивый и честный человек и поэтому его на работе все знают и уважают. Махмадсаид является единственным кормильцем в семье, так как дети не совершеннолетние, а жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Махмадсаид очень нуждается в деньгах, так как его младший брат собирается жениться, но не имеет денег. Он попросил Махмадсаида помочь ему. Махмадсаид запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для проведения свадебного мероприятия любимого брата. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему сделать счастливым его брата.
texts.en: Mahmadsaid is 28 years old.  He is married and raising two adolescent children.  Mahmadsaid graduated from the Tajikistan Economics University in 2007.  He completed his training in China.  Mahmadsaid works at a cement manufacturing plant.  He is a very hardworking and honest person and this is why everyone knows and respects him at work.  Mahmadsaid is the sole provider for his family because his children are adolescent, and wife is a homemaker and is involved in raising the children.  Mahmadsaid really needs money because his younger brother is planning to get married, but does not have money.  He asked Mahmadsaid to help him.  Mahmadsaid is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars to hold a wedding event for his beloved brother.  He awaits your kindness.  This loan will help him to make his brother happy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding event for his beloved brother

loans.name: Ricardo Samuel

texts.es: Ricardo de 32 años de edad es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos  hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad sus cosechas las comercializa  en  los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Ricardo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ricardo, age 32, is a very kind and hard-working man.  He lives with his wife and their two children.  He works very hard on his own piece of land where he grows corn and beans.  His products are very good quality, and he sells his harvests at the different markets that are close to where he lives.

Ricardo is requesting a loan from Integral in order to have the money he needs to buy agricultural supplies like pest controls, fertilizers, composts, and seeds, among other things he needs for his crops.  He is anxious to increase his sales in order to be able to get greater earnings and to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like pest controls, fertilizers, composts, and seeds, among other things he needs for his crops.

loans.name: Ides

texts.es:
Ides tiene 44 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 5 hijos; pero solo dos están con ella una de 15 y la otra de 17 años, una nieta de 5 años y los varones se casaron y se fueron de la casa. Ella nació cerca de la laguna, vivía con sus padres su papá era pescador artesanal y su mamá vendía el pescado que extraía el papá  y de algunos pescadores mas. así Ides aprendió esa actividad, con el paso de los años se acompaño tubo 2 hijos y al final no pudo vivir con su compañero de vida y quedo sola nuevamente, luego de algún tiempo conoció a quien ahora es su compañero de vida tienen ya 20 años de vivir juntos en un tiempo su esposo emigro de forma ilegal a los EEUU y pudieron construir la casa en la que  viven actualmente en la zona norte de la laguna que resulta ser un terreno que es propiedad del gobierno, es un espacio que resulta de la consolidación de una capa de lava volcánica y construyen con un permiso del estado cuando su esposo se vino de los EEUU instalaron una pequeña tienda y se dedicaron a la crianza de pollos de engorde en el mes de diciembre y gallinas ponedoras por lo general maneja 200 gallinas ponedoras mientras su esposo trabaja como agente de seguridad en la alcaldía municipal de la la ciudad.             

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar alimento a 300 pollas ponedoras de 11 semanas de edad de la raza Hy line red ( gallina roja ) ya que por la demanda de los huevos decidieron aumentar el numero de animales en el lote de reemplazo y les falta fondos para alimentar a las aves en desarrollo.  Las gallinas las compra en la ciudad y debe pagar un pick up para que le haga el viaje y paga $ 20 por por cada viaje a unos 15  kilómetros de su casa y luego hacen un recorrido subiendo las cosas por la cuesta de piedras escabrosas hasta la casa.         

Con el préstamo, tendrá dinero para comprar alimento concentrado para las pollas y satisfacer las necesidades alimentarias del lote de pollas en desarrollo; ya que lo que se produce con la postura de las 200 gallinas no es suficiente para cargar con el gasto de las demás; porque de las 200 gallinas se sacan diario unos 170-180 huevos por los ciclos de posturas de algunas y si se desarrollan bien este lote se garantiza que empiecen a poner a las 17 semanas como estaba programado y que la producción sea homogénea con animales sanos y fuertes    

 se espera llevar a producción este nuevo lote de 350 pollas  que reemplazara al de 200 gallinas y se espera por lo tanto tener mejores ingresos para la familia porque lo del salario de su esposo,  mas lo que se vende en la tienda casi no alcanza para cubrir los gastos de la familia y para el otro año sera mas ya que la hija de 15 años deberá estudiar bachillerato y deberá viajar todos los días  y la de 17 años esta embarazada y el papá del niño no se hizo responsable del embarazo y la nieta de 5 años deberá ir al jardín de niños, el otro año habrá mas gastos por lo tanto se deberá trabajar mas duro.   

En un  futuro espera mejorar las instalaciones de la granja mas que todo en la estructura física; ya que ahora las aves permanecen en una casa de lamina encerradas totalmente con poca ventilación natural y espera algún día tener galeras especiales con sus bebederos y comederos colgantes y todo mas ordenado y que las niñas estudien hasta la universidad para que vivan de diferente manera
texts.en:
Ides is 44, in a relationship, and has five children (only two of her children are with her, one aged 15 and one aged 17, as well as a five-year-old granddaughter. Her sons are married and have left home). Ides was born near La Laguna and grew up with her parents. Her father was a traditional fisherman, and her mother sold her father's fish, as well as other people's fish. Ines learned this job, and with the passing of the years she developed a relationship and had two children. In the end, she was unable to live with her partner and became single again. After some time, she met someone new and is now in a long-term relationship with him. They have been together for 20 years. At one point he emigrated illegally to the United States. They were able to build the home in which they now live, in the northern zone of La Laguna, on land which is owned by the government. It's an area that was created from the hardening of a layer of volcanic lava, and they built their home with the state's permission when her spouse returned from the US. They then opened a small store and started raising chickens in December. They also raise laying hens. In general, they have 200 laying hens. Her spouse works as a security guard at city hall.
This loan which she is requesting from Fundación Campo is for the purchase of 300 Hy-line red laying hens, 11 weeks old. They decided to increase the number of animals they have because of demand for their eggs, and they do not have the money to feed them. They buy their chickens in the city and have to pay someone to make the voyage; they pay $20 for each voyage of about 15 kilometres from their home, and then they have to walk, which increases the cost because of the uneven ground leading to their home.
With this loan, she will have money to buy chicken feed and to satisfy the dietary needs of her current batch of growing chickens. What she makes from 200 hens is not enough to cover the costs of the rest; 200 hens lay about 170-180 eggs per day given their cycles. If they grow well, this group will definitely start to lay at 17 weeks as expected, and production will be homogeneous with healthy and strong animals.
She hopes to increase production with this new group of 350 chickens, which will replace the 200 hens. She hopes to have a better income for her family because her spouse's salary and their income from their store barely covers their family's costs. Next year, their costs will be higher because their 15-year-old daughter should start high school, and she will have to travel every day. What's more, their 17-year-old daughter is pregnant, and the baby's father is not taking responsibility for the pregnancy. Their 5-year-old granddaughter will have to start kindergarten; next year there will be more costs, so they will have to work harder.
In the future, Ides hopes to improve the farm equipment, especially the structures. The birds currently live in a laminate house and are entirely closed in with little natural ventilation. One day, she hopes to have special housing for them with hanging water and food dishes, and everything better organized. She hopes that her girls will go to university so that they can live differently.

loans.use: to buy feed for 300 Hy-line red laying hens who are 11 weeks old.

loans.name: Ulash

texts.ru: Улаш женщина с добрым сердцем, которая живет очень бедно на южной части Таджикистана. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей: 2 дочери и 2 сыновья. Она имеет 2 умных внуков. Улаш очень любит своих внуков и старается купить для них молоко и мясо, чтобы они всегда правильно питались. Улаш очень трудолюбивая женщина и более 30 лет она упорно трудится на поле. Она выращивает зерно и овощи. Улаш с удовольствием трудится на поле, и для нее не страшно ни холодная пагода и не горячая солнце Таджикистана. Она имеет большое горе. Ее муж серьёзно болен. Он должен лечиться, но так как они еще не собрали урожай, не имеют денег. Здоровье ее мужа ухудшается и он срочно должен пойти к врачу. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для лечения мужа. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ulash is a woman with a kind heart who lives in poverty in the southern part of Tajikistan.  She is 50 years old, married and has four children--two daughters and two sons.  She has two smart grandchildren that she loves very much.  She tries to buy them milk and meat so that they are always well fed.  Ulash is hardworking and for more than 30 years has worked in the field growing grains and vegetables.  She is happy with her work and isn't deterred by cold weather or Tajikistan's scorching sun.  She has a large mountain.  Ulash's husband is seriously ill.  He needs treatment but since they have not yet had their harvest, they don't have the money.  Her husband's health is getting worse and he urgently needs to see a doctor.  Ulash is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni for her husband's treatment.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her husband's treatment.

loans.name: Amenata

texts.en: Amenata is 37 years old and lives at West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and has five children who are in school and live at home. Her oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. She was unable to attend school.  She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years now, she has been selling charcoal from a shop in the local market. She sells every day from 8AM to 4PM.  She enjoys her business because of the flow of customers. She started this business with money given to her by friends. Most likely she used a shared taxi to get her charcoal to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business.  She plans is to build a house for her children in the near future.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Tiornola 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  TIORNOLA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à IFOLA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Mme ARIYATOU debout en première  position de la  droite vers la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et  semences agricoles pour entretenir 1hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 95.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tiornola 1 group are married women averaging  43 years of age, with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Ifola, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, having duly repaid their prior loans. They grow corn, which is the case of Mrs. Ariyatou, for example. She is the first one standing from the right in the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs  [fertilizers etc] and seeds to work 1 ha of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village market to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to earn 95,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive con su hijo y su madre en casa propia,  Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; la clienta es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y cal,  la clienta tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower is a single mother who lives with her child and mother in her own home. She owns a tortilla store which is very well-known in the area in which she lives. She has many customers since she sells the best tortillas, hot, and with the fastest service at really accessible prices. The borrower is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to come out ahead. She has a winner’s attitude, and so always keeps herself ahead of the competition. She thinks that when someone wants something, that person should know that there are risks and that is why life is worth the effort. 

She wants to run the risk to be able to grow her business and so is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy corn wholesale and lime. The borrower is hoping that in this way she will be able to bring home economic security and a full life to her family.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Leonce

texts.en: Leonce is 43 years old. He owns a bar and has been in the business for six years. He is married and has five children. With the loan, he would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon who is living with his wife and three children.  Two of them are still attending school. He started to work as a plumber many years ago, and after gaining the needed experience he was eager to start his own business in 1998. He works on his own and his family members are really proud of him as he works very hard to satisfy their needs. Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase additional plumbing tools and supplies. This will facilitate his business operations, especially while installing faucets, tubes, pipes etc.  In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing shop.

loans.use: purchase additional plumbing tools and supplies

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
Zoe is 30 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband does office work. She has five children ages 13, 10, 9, 7 and 5 who live at home and currently are attending school.

Zoe stated: I does not know how to read and write.  

She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past two years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market; she sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM.  She likes her business because she has lots of customers; she started this business with money given to her by husband. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. 

Zoe is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her dream is to build a house for her children.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive con su hijo de 3 años de edad en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias  que están cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues su mercadería la vende a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio  para darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower is a single mother who lives with her 3-year-old son in her own home. She has made a living through the sale of clothing for two years. She sells her clothing travelling to the different neighborhoods that are near her residence. She has many customers since she sells her merchandise at accessible prices. With the profits that she obtains from her sales she will manage to settle some home expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale, and to be able to continue with her business to provide a better quality of life to her son.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
This is Ma. Sol, 32, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Zaldy, a driver, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Sol is a dried fish vendor. She buys different kinds of dried fish from her suppliers then sells them in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. She also sells beaded wallets.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.  To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more dried fish needed in her business.

Ma. Sol dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Yuliza Yeraldine

texts.es:
Yuliza es una joven de 24 años de edad, de carácter muy carismático y con muchas ganas  de salir adelante.  Yuliza vive en la ciudad  de Pisco, en la cual se aprecia paisajes hermosos, una gastronomía variada y sobre todo un clima muy cálido.  Yuliza vive al lado de su esposo con el cuan tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, por el cual trabaja muy duro para poder sacarlo adelante y junto a su esposo se sacrifican para poder darle una vida digna y con mejores oportunidades para progresar. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar solo hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Pesquera.
