Luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Yuliza logro comprar un bote, el cual alquila y de esta manera tiene unos ingresos con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene la mejor motivación del mundo el cual es su hijo.

Yuliza esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su bote y poder comprar herramientas y trajes para las personas que manejan el bote, de esta manera tendrá un bote en buen estado y poder seguir trabajando cada día para poder salir adelante y sobre todo hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Yuliza is a young 24-year-old. She is very charismatic and has a great desire to get ahead. She lives in the city of Pisco, where there is beautiful countryside, a varied gastronomy, and above all a very hot climate. Yuliza lives with her husband. They have a five-year-old son. She works very hard to get him ahead. She and her husband sacrifice and give their all in order to provide him with a good life and better opportunities to progress. Because of limited economic resources, she was only able to attend school until the fifth grade of secondary school. She would have liked to study aquaculture engineering.
With a great deal of hard work and savings, Yuliza was able to buy a boat to rent out. This makes her an income to cover her household costs. She believes that she is succeeding because she is very kind to her customers, and above all because she has the greatest motivation in the world: her son.
Yuliza is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to repair her boat and buy tools and suits for the people who drive the boat. She will have a boat in good shape and be able to keep working every day to get ahead and make her greatest dream reality: to give her son a profession and to be able to build her home out of a good material.

loans.use: to repair her boat and buy tools and suits.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира имеет высшее образование. Ей 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Мунира в 1999 году окончила Национальный Университет Таджикистана. Она имеет большой опыт в сфере педагогической деятельности. Она более 13 лет работает в школе. Шесть последние годы она работает в школе как директор. Она гордость своего района. Мунира давно мечтает купить золотые украшения, чтобы потом дать как приданное, своему ребенку. Она не имеет сбережения и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munira is 44 years old, married and has one child.  In 1999, she got a degree from the National University of Tajikistan.  She has much experience in the field of teaching.  For more than 13 years, she has worked in a school.  The last six years she has worked as the school's director.  She is proud of her region.  Munira has long dreamed of buying gold jewelry that she can later give to her child as a dowry.  She does not have savings so she is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy gold jewelry for her child

loans.name: Astenia Noemy

texts.es: Astenia de 34 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años siembra maíz, maicillo y loroco, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer  responsable, honesta y trabajadora  vive con su esposo  y su  hijo. Astenia está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: herbicidas, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con su siembra ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Astenia is 35 years old and has been working in agriculture for 10 years planting corn, sorghum, and loroco.  With the sales that she makes from her harvest, she is able to take care of the household bills.  She is a responsible, honest, and hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband and their son.

Astenia is asking for a loan so she can buy supplies for her harvest, such as herbicide, manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc.  In addition, she wants to be able to improve her land (which is pictured in the photo).  In this way, she can continue with her harvest, since the money she makes from it doesn't pay for these expenses.  In addition, she can have better income and greater financial stability.

loans.use: buy herbicide, manure, seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies so she can improve her land.

loans.name: Teresa Dse Jesus

texts.es: Doña teresa de 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos  hijos, doña teresa desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes desodorantes, etc. por mayor  ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa is 44 and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. 

She sells a great variety of personal care products such as lotions, deodorants, perfumes, and others out of her home. With the income from her sales and her husband's help, the couple meets their household expenses. 

Doña Teresa hopes to grow her business and is therefore requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase wholesale the inventory her business requires: perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, etc. Doña Teresa has many customers as she offers products at reasonable prices. The funds she's requested will allow her to boost her income and continue providing for her family's needs without difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Antonia Luisa

texts.es: Antonia de 46 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de pan francés desde hace varios años, lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 18 años de edad,  doña Antonia esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar pan francés por mayor y asi seguir con su negocio para poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Antonia is 46 years old. She has made a living selling French bread for some years. She does so by traveling to the different neighborhoods that are close to her home. With the profits that she makes she manages to settle some of her home expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and 18-year-old son. 

Antonia is requesting a loan to be able to buy French bread wholesale and so continue with her business to be able to give a better quality of life to her family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy French bread wholesale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old and is married to Joyce. They have been blessed with 2 two-year old children.  Peter sells clothes and has been in this business for three years.  Right now his monthly income is KES 15,500.  He is borrowing KES 30,000 to purchase more stock of clothes to sell.  He plans to plow back the profit into the business.  This is his first loan, and his hope and dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of clothes

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 24 year-old woman from Bugumbe, located in the west of Migori county.  She supports four people in her family.  She is married to Mahiri, who is also a businessman from the same location and supports the family.  She has three children who are eight, six, and three years old, respectively.

She is a hawker, selling different varieties of goods. She has been doing this business for the last four years and generates a monthly income of KES 20,000.  She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase more varieties of commodities.  Lucia will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business.  Her dream is to extend the business and to change her life and that of her family, too.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
This is Ronald, 40, a resident of GMA, Cavite in the Philippines. He is married to Marianne, the mother of their children. He and his wife work hard and manage their household together.

Ronald runs a sari-sari, which is basically a small convenience store where groceries, toiletries and beverages are sold piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, five PHP’s worth of cooking oil or an egg. He buys his goods wholesale, then sells them at retail prices. His store is next to his house, and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 PHP a day in sales.

To help him continue operations, he is applying for a 19,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his inventory. He hopes to grow his business and dreams of all his children finishing school.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients, of which Ronald is one, are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his business.

loans.name: Gamira

texts.ru: Гамира, 52 года, замужем, 2 дочери школьного возраста. С 2000 года занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка и 10 овец. Бизнес начала с 10 000 сом (KGS).  Гамира очень трудолюбивая, благодаря ее трудолюбию, ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 5 000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота Гамира обратилась к нам в  Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку кормов для скота. На доходы от кредита Гамира  хочет сделать ремонт своего дома.
texts.en: Gamira is 52 years old, married and has two daughters that are school-aged.  Since 2000, she has worked with livestock and she now has one dairy cow and 10 sheep.  She started her business with 10,000 KGS.  Gamira is very hardworking and thanks to her efforts, her monthly profits are around 5,000 KGS.  With the goal of increasing the number of animals in her herd, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy feed for her animals.  She wants to use the income provided by the loan to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: Асрор молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 20 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Асрор после окончания школы очень хотел поступить в университет, но так как его родители бедные люди у него не было возможности, поступить в университет. Итак, 3 года назад, он начал свой бизнес, скотоводством. Он живет в аграрной местности и поэтому они сами выращивают сено для скота. Асрор хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как он живет очень в старом доме. Асрор планирует отремонтировать все комнаты. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, цемент, песок и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Asror is an energetic young man. He is 20, single, and lives with his parents. Asror really wanted to go to university after finishing high school but did not have the opportunity because his parents are poor. So, three years ago he started his own business raising cattle. He lives in an agricultural region so they grow hay for the cattle. Asror wants to repair his house because it is very old and plans to renovate all the rooms. He has asked for a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy building materials such as paint, cement, sand, and so forth. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as paint, cement and soil for home repairs

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 46-year-old housewife who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband owns a fruit shop from which he sells apples, bananas and oranges in the market. This is the only source of income for the family.

Presently Allah Rakhi’s husband is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his income and savings. However, due to his lack of capital he finds it difficult to do so.

Therefore, as head of her borrower's group Allah Rakhi is applying for a 105,000 PKR loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With her third of the loan proceeds she can help her husband buy a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profit. With these earnings her husband plans to grow his business.

Allah Rakhi is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan’s assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits for her husband to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 32-year-old businessman. He is married to Alice who takes care of their family. They are blessed with three children.

Martin has been selling clothes for the past five years. He earns a monthly income of approximately 20,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

Martin is applying for a 80,000 KES loan through KADET to buy extra clothes and shoes to sell. With the expected profits he will expand his business.

Martin’s dream is to buy a house and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy extra clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a single father of two children. He has not settled because he is busy trying to make money such that he and the children will have a happy future. That's why he is doing his best to do several odd jobs to create income. 

Richard wants a loan to buy agricultural products which are now at a low price, due to the fact that it is harvest season. He will be able to sell them to nearby schools who buy items, such as maize and beans, for their students. He believes that if he maintained the partnership with Kiva, through UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (UGAFODE), his financial problems will be a tale of the past. He is a hard-working and resilient man.

In the photograph, Richard is with the UGAFODE credit officer at his store, where he also collects ripened coffee.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 42 años de edad se dedica a la venta de refrescos en un lugar del centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, desde que llegó del departamento del Cesar, hace 17 años, buscando opciones de paz y bienestar al lado de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 5 a 19 años. En esta ciudad encontró un ambiente propicio para vivir y emprender su propia aventura de negocios, con el cual ha logrado obtener su vivienda y el sostenimiento de su hogar. Cuando se inició como comerciante, lo hizo con una tienda que poco a poco fue ampliando, pero ese negocio lo convirtió en refresquería, debido a que la tienda demandaba mucha operatividad y esfuerzo y disfrutaba muy poco de su familia y el tiempo le ha dado la razón, pues además le ha permitido generar ingresos para que sus hijos logren estudiar y esto para el y su cónyuge es muy importante. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, noveno financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual Pedro comprará, refrescos, bebidas nacionales, jugos y cervezas al por mayor y de contado, para provisionarse y tener disponibilidad de inventarios que apacigüen el aumento permanente de los precios de estos productos y esto es la razón por la cual su credikiva se convierte en una inversión de éxito, pues le provee ahorros, por compras a precios especiales por su volumen y se anticipa al alza de los precios de los artículos que mas vende. Con los financiamientos de la Fundación ha logrado adquirir activos fijos como sus enfriadores y surtir su negocio efectivamente, con lo cual su clientela siempre encuentra lo que necesita y esto le ha convenido porque ha logrado fidelizarlos. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir un local propio y ampliar su mercado para incrementar sus utilidades y en un futuro lograr el cumplimiento de su sueño familiar de bienestar. 
Con su  credito  pasados compró refrescos y bebidas que aumentaron sus inventarios y generaron mayores utilidades. Con sus ganancias en el negocio, ha logrado fortalecer el ahorro y adquirir su propia casa, además de que su hija  esté estudiando una carrera universitaria. En la actualidad esta aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual reforzará   sus inventarios con cervezas y gaseosas en mayor volumen,  que son los productos con mayor demanda y que rotan fácilmente. El  está muy satisfecho y dice a sus financiadores en Kiva; “Muchas gracias por su confianza y el apoyo brindado. “
texts.en:
Pedro, age 42, sells pop in the centre of Barranquilla. He has done this since arriving in the department of Cesar 17 years ago looking for a way to bring his family peace and well-being. His family is his wife and their four children between the ages of 5 and 19. In this city he has found a favourable environment in which to live and launch his own business venture. With his business, he has been able to obtain a home and sustain his family. When he started off as a businessman, he had a store which he expanded bit by bit. He has turned this business into a refreshment stall because the store required a lot of labour and hard work, and he was not able to enjoy his family very much because he had no time. This refreshment stall has allowed him to generate an income so that his children can study; this is very important for him and his partner. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his ninth loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, Pedro will buy pop, national drinks, juice, and beer wholesale and with cash. This will allow him to stock up and have a good inventory to get through the permanent price increases of these products. This is why his loan will be a successful investment. It will allow him to save by getting special prices based on volume. He anticipates that the prices on the products he sells most will increase.
With his loans from the Fundación, he has been able to acquire fixed assets such as his freezers, and to stock his business effectively. Because of this, his customers always find what they need; this has been good for Pedro, because he has ensured their loyalty. His goal for the future is to acquire a proper storefront and to expand his market in order to increase his income. He hopes to achieve his dream of familial well-being in the future.
With his previous loans he bought pop and drinks, which increased his inventory and generated greater utilities. With his income from his business, he has been able to strengthen his savings and acquire his own home. What's more, his daughter is studying in university. 
He is now applying for a new loan with which he will reinforce his stock with greater volumes of beer and pop. These are the products in highest demand and they rotate easily. He is very satisfied and tells the Kiva lenders: "Thank you so much for your confidence and support."

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beer and pop.

loans.name: Juana Rosario

texts.es:
Juana Rosario tiene 45 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos a quienes ama muchísimo y por los cuales trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante y que sean mejores que ella, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, los cuales son el Candelabro de paracas y las “Islas Ballestas”, asimismo tiene como actividades principales la pesca y la agricultura. 

Juana es muy trabajadora, desde hace ya 2 años inicio su negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas, ella trabaja alrededor d e10 horas al día y los fines de semana hasta 15 horas y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es atenta con los clientes.

Juan está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo  y por ello podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio en especial cervezas y gaseosas, lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y hacer que sean felices”.
texts.en:
Juana Rosario is 45. She lives with her husband and two children, whom she loves very much and for whom she works very hard so that they can succeed and live better than she has. Her home is located in the city of Pisco, a city which has one of the country's most important tourist attractions: the Paracas Candelabra and the Ballesta Islands. The main economic activities are fishing and agriculture.
Juana is very hard-working. She started her business selling pop and beer two years ago. She works about 10 hours per day, and 15 hours per day on the weekends. She can see up to 40 customers per day. She thinks that her business is going well for her because she is attentive to her customers.
Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; this is the second time that you are providing your great support. She will buy more merchandise for her business, especially beer and pop. This will allow her to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers, and to keep working to make her great dream reality: "To give my children careers and to make sure that they are happy".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like beer and pop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica al cultivo de pilones de café desde hace 6 años, tiene mucha clientela pues esa  cosecha es muy vendible en la zona donde ella reside con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para la producción  de pilones de café como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc.  y seguir con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar su familia lo que necesita si limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client has cultivated coffee for six years. She has many clients because this is a very marketable product in the area where she lives. With her income, she helps with the household costs. She lives in her own home with her partner and her daughter. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of supplies for the production of coffee, such as seeds, manure, fertilizer, and herbicides. This will allow her to continue with her crops, since this is her only way to make a living and to provide her family with all they need, without limits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en:
Sabit is 50 years old, married and has four children; only one of them goes to school at this time. His wife works as a custodian in a private company to help support the family.

In order to provide for his family, Sabit has worked as a taxi driver for more than two years. He enjoys his work and a large customer base which he has attained due to his professionalism and demonstrated level of responsibility.

Sabit is applying for a 1000 EUR loan—his first—through KosInvest. He wants to buy new tires for and paint his taxi, as it has been a long time since he has been able to do so. This will help him improve his business, as he will be providing his customers with a safe, clean and well-maintained mode of transportation. He hopes to continue to work as a taxi driver and continuously provide better transport services to his passengers.

Sabit hopes to have a better life and provide an education for his children to ensure their future. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy new tires for and paint his taxi

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилджон жизнерадостный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 46 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй живёт в сельском районе. Одилджон закончил университет архитектуры, и получил специальность архитектора. И сейчас он работает архитектором в управлении своего района. Жена Одилджона домохозяйка, она хорошая жена и заботливая мама. Ежедневно она занимается домашними делами, ухаживает за детьми и воспитывает их по хорошим принципам. Одилджону приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Иногда он работает и ночами, заканчивает свои проекты. Хотя эта работа приносит ему хороший доход, но этих денежных средств не хватает, чтобы полностью удовлетворить все нужды семьи.  Также Одилджон желает благоустроить свой дом, в котором они живут. Его дом служит ему уже много лет, и сейчас находится в неблагоприятном состоянии и нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Но ремонт дома требует больших расходов и денежных средств. Поэтому Одилджон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он очень ждёт и надеется на положительный результат, а также заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Odiljon is a 46-year old man with an optimistic, positive life outlook. He is married and has three children. He and his family live in the rural area. Odiljoin has graduated from  the university with a degree in architecture. Now he works as an architect for his region’s administration. His wife is a homemaker: she is a good wife and caring mother. Every day she takes care of the household needs, takes care of the children and bringing them up. Odiljoin needs to work a lot in order to support his family. Sometimes he works late at night in order to finish his projects. Even though this work brings in a good income, this is insufficient to provide for all the family needs. He also would like to improve the house they live in. His house has been in use for many years, and is now in a bad condition and needs  major renovations. But renovations require a lot of expenses and financial means. This is way Odiljon has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy construction materials to renovate his home. He is really hoping for a positive decision and also thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward lives in Malindi in Kenya. He is married and the father of three, the youngest being a month old. One of his children has started school.

Edward has been running a motorbike transport business for the last three years. He took a first loan from Kiva to buy a motorbike (his third child was born during the course of this loan term.) The business is now doing fine.

Edward is now applying for a 83,450 KES loan through Milango to buy another motorbike so as to increase the number of customers he serves. The extra income he accrues from the use of the loan will go towards building his family their own house.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Parizat

texts.ru: Паризат, 36 лет, замужем, многодетная мать, имеет 5 детей (3 дочери и 2 сына). Образование-среднее. После окончания средней школы Паризат работала курьером до распада Союза. В 1995 году начала заниматься сельским хозяйством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5 000 сом (KGS). Супруг Паризат помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Паризат и ее супруга, на сегодняшний день они имеют хорошее  хозяйство: 200 овец и дойных коров. Также в наличии имеет 4,34 ГА поливной земли, где выращивает в основном фасоль. Прибыль позволила Паризат размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Паризат обратилась в наш Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец. Доходы от кредита Паризат  планирует вложить обучение детей, а также построить новый дом.Семья очень дружная и целеустремленная.
texts.en:
Parizat is 36 years old, married and the mother of many children. She has five children (three daughters and two sons). She has secondary education. After finishing high school, Parizat worked as a courier until the collapse of the Soviet Union. 

In 1995 Parizat started working with agriculture and livestock breeding, after having started a business with 5,000 som (KGS). Parizat's husband helps her in her business. Thanks to Parizat and her husband's persistent work, today they have a good business: 200 sheep and milking cows. They also have 4.34 hectares of irrigated land available, where they mainly grow beans. The income made it possible for Parizat to multiply the number of livestock on the farm and thereby increase the well-being of the family.

With an aim to further develop her business, Parizat turned to our microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of six sheep. Parizat plans to invest the income from the loan in her children's education, and also to build a new house. The family is very friendly and ambitious.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 40 лет, замужем, многодетная мама 6 детей (1 сын 5 дочерей). Образование среднее. Вместе с супругом начали заниматься сельским хозяйством много лет назад с небольшой суммы в 15000 сом (KGS). Супруг подрабатывает оказывая всяческие услуги населению, сама посезонно работает в хлебо-булочной пекарне. В хозяйстве имеет: 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 1 овцу и 1 лошадь.Ежемесячный доход 8000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока 3 коров. Прибыль позволила Элмире размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в наш Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в ремонт дома, а также на образование старшей дочери.
texts.en:
Elmira is 40 years old, married and the mother of 6 children (one son and five daughters). She has secondary education. 

Together with her husband she started a farming business many years ago with a small sum of 15,000 som (KGS). Her husband earns money providing different services to the population, while Elmira has seasonal work in a bakery. At the farm they have three dairy cows, three calves, one sheep and one horse. The monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS) from selling milk from the three cows. The income enabled Elmira to multiply the number of livestock at the farm and thereby improve the family's well-being. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Elmira turned to our microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a horse. Elmira plans to invest the income from the loan in repairing her house and also for the education of the oldest daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco de 48 años de edad, casado con tres hijos, los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad, están estudiando en la Universidad. Es originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Juan se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. El cual ha luchado muy fuerte para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor,  ya que el no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una ferretería ubicada en su casa de habitación. El negocio consiste en la venta de material de construcción como zinc, cal, cemento, hierro, madera, perlines, clavos, alambres entre otros. El dedica a  su negocio unas 10 horas diaria, actividad que la disfruta mucho. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de material de construcción, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Juan Francisco agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco is 48 years old, married, and has three children that he cares for.  They study at university.  He is originally from Leon, a place located in the western part of the country.  Juan is known for being a hardworking, responsible man with a personal desire to succeed.  He has worked hard to provide a better future for his children, since he himself was not able to go to school due to a lack of resources.

With a spirit of grace and a desire to get ahead, he has a hardware store in his home.  The business consists of selling building materials such as zinc metal sheeting, lime, cement, iron, lumber, girders, nails, wire, and other things.  He spends about 10 hours a day on his business and enjoys it very much.  His objective for this loan is to stock his business so that he can have a better income in the near future.  Juan Francisco is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 20-year-old single Lebanese man. He has been working as a plumber for the past five years, and in 2011 he started to work independently serving customers, no matter where they reside.  His only target is to earn enough income to live in good conditions.  

Mohamad plans to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to renew his business tools and continue to work with a high degree of professionalism. 

He has a part-time worker helping him, and he plans to hire him as a full time worker as soon as he is sure that he will be able to achieve a significant expansion in his business, and increase its capital thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to renew his business tools

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is a single lady of 39 years; she is the mother of three children who are all in school.  She sells clothes, shoes and hand bags in Kangemi, and has been in this business for two years.  She gets a monthly income of 30,000 shillings.

This will be Keziah's first loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire loan to buy handbags to sell. 

In the future, she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy new handbags to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old. She sells shoes, and has been in the business for the past six years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house to live in.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Faniya

texts.ru: Фания, 64 года, замужем, 2 детей и внуки. Образование высшее. Работала врачом-ветеринаром на протяжении 16 лет. С 1990 года Фания вместе со своей семьей начала разводить скот. Бизнес в сфере животноводства был начат с 25 000 сом (KGS). Супруг Фании помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Фании и образованию в области ветеринарии, на сегодняшний день она имеет хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. Также в наличии имеет 1,40 ГА орошаемой земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает клевер. Урожай используют в качестве корма скоту. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Фания обратилась в наш Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60 000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Фания планирует вложить в помощь своим детям улучшить семейное благосостояние, а также сделать капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Faniya is 64 years old, married, and has two children and grandchildren. She has higher education. She worked as veterinary for a period of 16 years. 

In 1990 Faniya started with livestock breeding together with her family. The livestock breeding business was started with 25,000 som (KGS). Faniya's husband helps with the business. Thanks to Faniya's persistent work and her education as a veterinary, the farm today has two dairy cows and one calf. Further they have 1.40 hectares of land available, on which she plants clover every year. The harvest is used as fodder for the livestock. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Faniya turned to our microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of steers. Faniya plans to invest the income from the loan in helping her children improve their families' well-being, and also to large repairs on the house.

loans.use: to purchase steers

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en: Zakaria is a 30-year-old single Lebanese man. After gaining 11 years of experience, he was able to open his own barbershop in 2009. Due to his good business reputation, he was capable of building a good number of loyal customers. With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase shaving tools and supplies in addition to new chairs for his salon. In that way, he will satisfy his customer’s demands and serve them at the top. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase shaving tools, supplies, and chairs

loans.name: 04-04-13-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo has a retail business selling shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes and clothes to resell.

Thảo is 40 years old and she is married with two children. Thảo is the group leader of the 04-04-13-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2009, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thảo has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  TIBINA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme MARIAM debout en deuxième  position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 1. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 105.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of this group called BENKADI 1 are married women with an average age of 37 and on average, four children, and they all live in polygamous families in Tibina, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution; the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Maize is the crop cultivated by Mme Mariam, standing second from left to right. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to plant and maintain one hectare of land. The produce is sold in the village, at the marketplace, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 105,000 francs CFA for the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar has become the only breadwinner in his family following his marriage. His wife does not work, since she is taking care of their five-year-old daughter.

Now Edgar is unemployed, but he is engaged in agriculture and farming. He has a private plot of land where he cultivates tomatoes, haricots, plums and also keeps four pigs and four piglets. As agriculture is the only source of income for Edgar, running and expanding his farm is very important to him.

He is asking a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, which is very important for the successful cultivation of the land. The loan will also be used to purchase forage for feeding the pigs. The loan will be a great financial support for Edgar, as he will be able to enlarge his farm and gather more income for the family.

Edgar hopes Kiva lenders will support him in developing his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Fatmire

texts.en:
Fatmire is a 47-year-old widow who has six children. Since the death of her husband she has had to work a lot in order to support herself and her children. As a way to do this, she has been making handicrafts, which has been going very well and has been successful. 

Fatmire now is in need of a loan for the first time in order for her to renovate her house and its façade. This loan will be of great help to her since without it, she would not be able to manage completing these improvements. In the future, Fatmire hopes to improve the living conditions of her family and reach her goal which is to give her family a sustainable future. She and her family are very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To do renovations and redo the façade of her house

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 45, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Mary Ann operates a school/office supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, cartolina and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. 

Mary Ann dreams of expanding her business and having another store. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more school and office supplies.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 39 years old and lives at the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children ages 20, 18 and 4. Her children are in school and live at home. She said that in all her days she has not been to school. She described herself as a caring mother. 

For the past four years she has been operating her own shop which sells soft drinks and other items in her community. She spends 15 hours a day on her business since her shop is attached to her house. She likes her business because she has a lot of customers, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother.  Most of the time she uses a shared taxi to get her stock to her shop.

She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.  She would like to say thanks to lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон, 40 лет, замужем, многодетная мама, имеет 4 детей. Супруг помогает по бизнесу. В 2007 года начала свою трудовую деятельность с рынка. Торгует овощами и фруктами на местном рынке. Бизнес начинала с 5000 сом, расширила свой товарооборот.Чолпон очень трудолюбивая, одна тянет свою семью в материальном плане, дети маленькие. Благодаря ее трудолюбию и упорству, товарооборот на сегодняшний день составляет 20000 сом, что приносит хорошую прибыль ее семье в сумме 15 000 сом. В целях увеличения товарооборота, Чолпон обратилась к нам в  Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку фруктов и овощей на продажу. На доходы от кредита Чолпон хочет купить домой мебель и жить благополучно.
texts.en: Cholpon is 40 years old, married and is a mother with many children - she has four.  Her husband helps her with the business.  She started her business with the market in 2007.  She sells vegetables and fruits at the local market.  She started the business with 5,000 som and expanded her goods turnover.  Cholpon is very hardworking; she pulls her family financially, and the children are small.  Thanks to her hard work and persistence, today her product turnover amounts to 20,000 som, which yields a good profit to her family, in the amount of 15,000 som.  In order to increase product turnover, Cholpon requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.  She plans to use the earnings from the loan to buy furniture for home and to live well.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Kalipa

texts.ru: Калипа, 40 лет, замужем, дети школьного возраста. Разведением скота начала заниматься более 18 лет назад, с 1995 года, начав бизнес с 3000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 7000 сом (KGS). Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В своем хозяйстве имеет: 4 дойные коровы, 5 лошадей, 35 овец, дополнительно занимается полеводством. Калипа хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота и заниматься полеводством, в связи с этим обратилась к нам в  Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку овец. На доходы от кредита Калипа хочет улучшить благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Kalipa is 40 years old, married and has school-age children.  She got involved in breeding livestock over 18 years ago, since 1995, having started this business with 3,000 som (KGS).  Today, thanks to her persistence and drive, she earns a monthly profit of 7,000 som (KGS).  Her husband helps her with the business.  Kalipa has 4 dairy cows, 5 horses and 35 sheep, and is additionally involved in farming.  Kalipa decided to increase her livestock headcount and continue to be involved in farming.  To achieve this, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to purchase sheep.  Kalipa plans to use the earnings from the loan to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold is 24 years of age and still single. He has worked and managed the farm for almost 10 years; last crop season he earned a net income of Php 4,500. He then decided to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 to pay for the labor of some farmers in their village. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can utilize it in his agricultural business.

loans.use: To pay for the labor of some farmers

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  TIBINA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme MAWA debout en première  position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 1 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 110.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of this group called BENKADI 2 are married women with an average age of 45 and on average six children, all living in polygamous families in Tibina, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to have success with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Mme Mawa, the first woman standing  left to right in the photo, cultivates maize. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold in the village, at the marketplace and after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 110,000 F CFA each crop season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Ovilla

texts.en:
This is Ovilla. Her previous loan helped her a lot not just in her business but also in the education of her children and their household expenditures. She sells barbecue and other street foods. She also has a general store.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ovilla dreams that her business will expand even more and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 34 years old. She sells meat and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more meat to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more meats to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 43 года, замужем.  Дети школьного возраста 1 дочь и 1 сын. Работает в школе преподавателем. Также более 10 лет занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 25000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 20000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь,  и  10 овец, а также имеется земельный надел 0,80 ГА на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Аида обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Аида  планирует сделать капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en: Aida is 43 years old, married.  Her children are of school-age - one daughter and one son.  She works as a teacher at a school.  Also, she has been involved in farming for over ten years, having started this business with a sum of 25,000 som (KGS).  Her monthly profit is 20,000 som (KGS).  Today, she was able to develop her farming business and also has her own farm.  Her farm has one dairy cow, one horse and ten sheep, and also a land plot of 0.80 hectares, where she annually grows beans.  Her husband helps her with the business.  In order to further grow her household and farming, Aida requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock.  Aida plans to use the earnings from the loan to make major repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La Sra Perla es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con la que quiere poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten de ella. Su sueño es poder seguir estudiando y mejorando cada día, ya que sabe que una persona nunca termina de aprender.
Solicita de este crédito para poder cubrir los gastos de su tesis, ya que eso le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Perla is a responsible person who is dedicated to her studies and her family. She aspires to become a successful professional, continue her studies, and serve other people.

Perla is studying for a nursing degree because she wants to help people who need her. Her dream is to continue studying and improving each day. She knows that a person should never stop learning. Perla is requesting this loan so that she can cover the expenses related to her thesis, so the money will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay the expenses related to her thesis.

loans.name: 06.6.8 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà operates a pub selling liquor, beer, and snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase liquor, beer, and snacks to resell.

Hà is 28 years old and she is married with one child. Hà is the group leader of the 06.06.8 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund For Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her child to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase liquor, beer, and snacks to resell.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Married with one little kid, Pheap is a 23-year-old rice grower residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has worked in her current business for five years. She is able to earn up to 23,500 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Pheap with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely managed her loans to upgrade her lifestyle in a gradual manner and has repaid her past loan with success. 

Now, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 2,700,00 KHR while 1,000,000 KHR is Pheap’s portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost. She highly believes that she can gain a  better income than before.

loans.use: to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Enis

texts.en:
The borrower Enis is 25 years old. He is married and has a four-month-old baby daughter. The family's main source of income comes from Enis who works in a kitchen in a local restaurant. His wife sometimes works as a babysitter in order to contribute and add income for the family. The money they generate is not enough to pay for renovations to their home. 

Enis' house needs repairs, including renovation of the walls in the rooms. Enis is therefore requesting a loan in order to pay for these repairs and improvements. This loan will also be helping him to keep his house warm during the wintertime, as it will improve the insulation, keeping his family warm and healthy and keeping costs for heating down. He hopes in this way to improve living conditions for his family and is very happy for this opportunity!

loans.use: To do renovation of the walls in the rooms of his house

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль, 48 лет, вдова.  Имеет 4 детей (2 сына и 2 дочери). С 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес начала с 3 000 сом. Муж умер в 2004 году. Несмотря на потерю кормильца семьи, Айгуль все-таки нашла в себе силы выстоять и продолжить разведение скота и развитие полеводства. На сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, а в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, и 30 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Также у нее в наличии имеется земельный надел, где она ежегодно сажает картофель и фасоль.   Ежемесячная прибыль Айгуль составляет 6000 сом. В целях дальнейшего своего хозяйства Айгуль обратилась в наш Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 20 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку селитры, а также на оплату услуг трактора по боронованию, вспашке и культивации земли. Дети помогают вести домашнее хозяйство. На доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует увеличить поголовье скота. Семья очень уважаемая в селе и дружная.
texts.en: Aigul is 48 years old, a widow.   She has four children - two sons and two daughters.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1995.  She started the business with 3,000 som.  Her husband passed away in 2004.  Despite the loss of the family's provider, Aigul after all found the strength in herself to persevere and continue raising livestock and developing farming.  Today, she is a successful farmer of her small farm, which has two dairy cows, one calf and thirty heads of small livestock.  Also, she has a land plot, where she annually plants potatoes and beans.  Aigul's monthly profit is 6,000 som.  In order to further grow her business, Aigul requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy saltpetre fertilizer and also to pay for the tractor services of harrowing, plowing and cultivating the soil.  The children help her to run the household.  Aigul plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase the livestock headcount.  The family is very respected in the village and friendly.

loans.use: to buy saltpetre fertilizer and also to pay for the tractor services of harrowing, plowing and cultivating the soil

loans.name: 07.01.01 Phu Son Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong operates a food stall selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Huong is 49 years old and she is married with one child. Huong is the group leader of the 07.01.01 phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members. Huong lives with one dependent. in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huong has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huong has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Huong faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huong hopes for her business to do well, for her child to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is 40 years old and she is happily married to Angelo. God has blessed them with loving children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Jennifer owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, etc. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell per piece for a higher price to have a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns Php 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Jennifer hopes that her business will be stable and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 43-year-old married mother of three children aged 24, 22 and 17 years. For three years now she has run a retail shop and a grocery store, earning a monthly income of ksh 34300. 

Elizabeth is taking a loan of ksh 20000 to add more stock to her retail shop. She plans to reinvest the profits into the business. This is her first loan, and she hopes to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To add more stock to her retail shop.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a business lady, a wife and a mother of four. All her children attend school. Martha has had previous loans with Milango, all of which she paid back without any difficulty. She is in motorcycle transport, the business she has done for the last four years. She has employed two people who help her run the business and she says that her husband is a help sometimes when she is facing a challenge. The challenges that she faces includes competition from other operators when it becomes difficult to get customers. 

Martha learned about Milango through friends and since she wanted a way of attracting credit she joined. She now seeks a loan to help her buy spare parts and repair one of her motorbikes that is broken down. The extra income that she raises from the loan will help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorbike

loans.name: 08-Pt3-05-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Oanh operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks, tables, and chairs to resell. 

Oanh is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Oanh is the group leader of the 08-PT3-05-Phú Sơn2 Solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent. One of her children is grown up.

In 2012, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Oanh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Oanh has been involved in this business for 3 years.
The main hardship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, tables, and chairs to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: Carolin Tatiana

texts.es: Carolin Tatiana es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a atender su cafetería, la cual inició luego de ser liquidada en una empresa donde laboraba. Es una mujer joven y enérgica, y le gusta ser independiente. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar activos fijos (sillas, mesas) y surtido (mecato, gaseosas, licor) para tener más variedad de productos que atraigan más flujo de clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Su mayor sueño es poder tener su negocio en un local propio, bien organizado y con buen inventario de productos disponibles para así incrementar su rentabilidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carolin Tatiana is a 24-year-old woman who is single and has no children. She currently manages a cafeteria, which she started after she was laid off at the company where she worked. Carolin is an energetic young woman who enjoys being independent.

With the loan she is requesting from Interactuar, Carolin will buy fixed assets (chairs, tables) and inventory (pastries, sodas, liquor) so that she can have a wider variety of products needed to generate more customer traffic and improve her earnings. Her greatest wish is to locate her business in a shop of her own and have it well-organized with a good amount of available inventory. As a result, she will able to increase her profitability and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (chairs, tables) and inventory (pastries, sodas, liquor).

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Rafael  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Ella era ama de casa pero actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la venta de comestibles, y con ello esta tratando de mejorar la vida de su familia y sus ingresos.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de una exhibidora para que pueda exhibir sus comestibles, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “San Rafael” is starting its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members work together and help one another move forward. They have taken a poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that eight of them are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Sra. Maria. Her most recent survey indicated that she is at a poverty stage of Level 1, which is to say that she has a very low income. Maria was a housewife, but she now works by selling food. Through her work, she is trying to improve the life of her family and her income.

Sra. Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy a display case for exhibiting her food. This will help to fulfill her business plan and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a display case for exhibiting her food.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 43-year-old business lady and a single mother to two children.

 Agnes has been running a quarry for the past twenty years with a monthly income of KES 35,000, which she uses to provide for her family. 

Agnes is applying for her sixth loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to buy quarry machines. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy quarry machines.

loans.name: Suyapa Ivonne

texts.es: Suyapa Ivonne 29 años de edad casada con dos hijos, menores de edad del domicilio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, Suyapa se desempeña como locutora y promotora en una radio de este municipio, el objetivo de este crédito es para cambiar el techo de su casa sala y cuarto, debido a que  el invierno está en puerta y no desea mojarse y así brindarle un techo digno donde vivir a sus pequeños Gemelos, desde hace más de un año ha querido realizar estas mejoras pero no las había realizado por falta de disponibilidad económico, Ella está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zin, Perlines, Tubos, Hierro, Clavos entre otros, Suyapa Agradece mucho la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas le ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Suyapa Ivonne, age 29, is married and has two minor children.  She lives in Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country.  Suyapa works as a radio announcer and developer in this municipality.

The objective of this loan is to change the roof of her house, living room, and room.  This is because winter is around the corner, and she does not wish to get wet.  This way she will give her little twins a decent roof to live under.  She has wanted to make these improvements for over a year.  However, she has not done so for lack of available money.

She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials like zinc roofing, beams, pipes, iron, and nails, among others.  Suyapa is very grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Entre Amigos Group

texts.es: Paola, que en la foto esta en el extremo derecho abajo con chaqueta café y bordes fucsia, es socia del Banco Comunal Entre Amigos, ubicado en Villarrica, Región de la Araucanía de Chile. Los socios de ese Banco tienen negocios como pastelería, longanizas, turismo, joyas, bazar y paquetería, costuras y Paola tiene un negocio en donde vende zapatos de segunda selección. Este negocio lo tiene hace 20 años, aunque ha ido cambiando de rubro durante este tiempo, pero siempre ha tenido su negocio, siempre ha sido comerciante. No ha tenido problemas o desafíos que enfrentar. El préstamo lo ocupará para comprar hierbas medicinales, ya que lo que ella quiere es poder comprar o arrendar una hectárea para poder plantar sus hierbas y así venderlas en su negocio. Espera que le vaya muy bien con este proyecto. Y lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que siempre tiene disposición para trabajar, muchas ganas lo que se traspasa a los socios, ya que aprenden.
texts.en:
Paola is in the lower right corner of the photo dressed in a brown jacket with magenta-colored details. She is a member of the communal bank Entre Amigos, located in Villarrica in the Araucanía Region in Chile. The members of this communal bank run businesses such as a pastry shop, selling sausages, tourism, jeweler, bazaar and package handling, and tailor. 

Paola has a business where she sells second-hand shoes. She has been running this business for twenty years, although its orientation has changed during this time. But she has always had her business, and she has always been a merchandiser. She has not had any problems nor faced any challenges. 

She will use the loan to buy medicinal herbs, since she would like to buy or rent a hectare where she can plant her herbs and then sell them in her shop. She hopes that she will be very successful with this project. What she has appreciated the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is its willingness to work and the enthusiasm it transfers to its members while they are learning.

loans.use: to buy inputs for selling herbs

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 49 years old. She has two children. The first one has gotten married. The second one is a marketer. Her husband breeds pigs and doves to earn a living.  He earns about 4,000,000 VND per month.  Thanh makes spring meat to sell in the market and she earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, she also helps her husband breed the pigs. Her family’s total income is about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is the lack of money to buy more pig feed because nowadays price of feed is too high while price of selling pigs is low. Her dream is to build a bigger pig farm.  This loan is one of steps to help her reach this dream.  Thanh wants to buy more 5 pigs to gain earnings and make more profit. She is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.   

Thanh has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more pigs to expand her farm. She will use the profit to build her farm.

loans.use: buy more pigs to expand her farm

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is 56 years old. She is a widow. She has two children who have gotten married. One of them is a worker to earn a living. The other has gotten married. 

Sang is a fruit seller in a market. She has done this job for 25 years. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. Sang’s challenge in life and work is not having transportation and other resources to buy fruits wholesale so she must buy from other retailers. Therefore, the price for these fruits are high. Her dream is to have good health and to sell for a long time. This loan is one of steps to help her get to this dream.  Sang will invest in her fruit store to gain earnings and make more profit. 

Sang is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.  She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2012. In her last loan cycle, she was loaned 5,152,000 VND. In this loan cycle, Sang would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy more kinds of fruits to sell.

loans.use: buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is 50 years old. She has three children who are married and have stable jobs. She and her husband make noodles and breed pigs to earn a living. They have done this job for 30 years and earn about 5,000,000 VND each month per person. Her family’s total earnings are 10,000,000 VND per month.

Binh’s challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to expand her noodle workshop. Her dream is to build houses for each of her children. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She will have capital to invest in her business and save the profit to expand the noodle workshop. 

Binh is a hardworking woman. She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy a noodle-making machine. She wants to gain earnings and save the profit to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: to buy a noodle-making machine.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 51-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and three children.  In 2003, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own business, producing a wide variety of homemade food which she sells to customers from her town and neighboring villages. Her husband, who works as an employee outside Lebanon, represents the main income source of the family. 

Today, Zahra is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase required products in addition to a new oven. She states that the loan will certainly help her increase her business productivity by a large percentage, which will return for her with higher profits. In the future, she plans to open her own grocery store.

loans.use: buy a new oven and products to make food for sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two siblings. He owns a small shop next to his house where he sells hubble-bubbles (hookahs) that allow customers to enjoy their time while having a break. Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase hubble-bubble appliances and related accessories. There are high demands for this type of service and Mohamad tends to satisfy these demands so as to increase his sales and therefore his income. With his business income, he is able to support his father with the family expenses. Mohamad is very ambitious and willing to work harder so as to enhance his family’s way of living and help them meet their needs.

loans.use: buy hubble-bubble appliances and accessories

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three working children. He has owned a home appliances shop since 2010. He sells a wide range of equipment and different supplies that might be needed at home. Today, Ghassan looks forward to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more appliances and apparatus to sell. He aims to strengthen his business operation by expanding his work and targeting a wider clientele in order to amplify his income. He is very optimistic and willing to open a new branch of his shop as soon as he can.

loans.use: buy home appliances to resell

loans.name: Racha

texts.en:
Racha is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She has been selling clothes from her home since 2010. Her products are designed for both men and women. 

Racha’s only goal is to support her family as much as she can. That’s why she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her inventory by diversifying her merchandise selection with new trends and brands with the aim of earning higher income and consequently improving her family’s way of living.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en: Ramzi is a 54-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children.  He has been working in the construction field for the past 35 years. Over these years, Ramzi faced ups and downs. But because of his talent and endowed skills, he was able to overcome all the barriers and obstacles and hire 2 part-time employees to help him achieve the work. Ramzi today shows high interest in having a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to reinforce his business by purchasing a concrete mixer that he will be using to smooth his work operations. In the future, Ramzi plans to open his own construction office.

loans.use: purchase a concrete mixer

loans.name: Bachir

texts.en:
Bachir, a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon, owns a café in his town where he welcomes customers from various areas and villages to rest and enjoy their time. He also serves popcorn and ice cream.

With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Bachir will purchase an espresso machine. He states that this machine will help him provide more customers with delectable coffee which will increase his income. In the future, he plans to expand his business and add a corner into his café where he will start to serve food plates and sandwiches.

loans.use: to purchase an espresso machine

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
