Jackson is 43 years old and works in the transport sector.  He is married to Margret, a teacher. They are blessed with four children who fully depend on them. 

Jackson has been in the transport industry for the past five years with a monthly income of KSH 20,000 which he uses to provide for his family. Jackson is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully.  

Jackson will use this loan to buy spare parts and service his motorbike.   With the expected profit from his business he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: buy spare parts and service his motorbike

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald operates a retail shop in Lyantonde town along a busy street.  He is married and has two young children whom he is working so hard to meet their basic needs including tuition.  Ronald did not get enough formal education and therefore wants his children to have the best. He hopes with the loan money his income will increase and he will therefore be able to adequately meet all their needs.  He also plans to build a structure of his own that will house his shop. 

Ronald is a hard working man.  In the photo Ronald is on right with the Ugafode Credit officer on the left.

loans.use: buy stocks to resell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 40 years old and lives at in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children ages 25 and 21.   Her children are in school and live at home. She said that all her days she has not been to school. She described herself as a caring mother. 

For the past four years Ruth has been operating her own shop where she sells slippers in the local market. She spends 8 hours a day on her business. She likes her business because she has a lot of customers.  She started this business with money given to her by mother.   Most of the time she use a taxi to get her stocks for her shop.  

Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase slippers for her business.  She plans is to build a house and educate her children.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: buy slippers to resell

loans.name: Oscar Ivan

texts.es:
Oscar Ivan de 44 años de edad, soltero con tres hijos menores de edad. Es originario de Achuapa lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Él se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitario por falta de recursos económicos, por eso lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta granos básicos y venta de insumos agrícolas. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra productos como granos básico arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maní, sorgo, cereales, cacao. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos como.  Oscar  Ivan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Oscar Iván, 44, is single with three minor children.  He’s from Achuapa, a place located in the northern zone of the country.  He’s noted for being a hardworking, responsible person who very much wants to improve personally.  Sadly, he was unable to attend university due to the lack of economic resources which is why he strives daily to provide a better future for his children.

Thanks to his spirit and drive to get ahead, his economic activity is selling basic grains and agricultural supplies.  He spends about 10 hours daily selling his products.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to buy products like basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, peanuts, sorghum, cereals and cocoa so that in the not too distant future he’ll earn better income.  Oscar Iván is grateful for the support Kiva lenders give to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a way to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents and two siblings. He is the owner of a shop where he sells detergents and plastic wares. He has been involved in this type of industry for the past three years, and he is starting to believe that this is what he always wanted to get occupied with. 

Today, he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to acquire more products for his shop. He seeks to increase his business sales, as he desires to earn greater income and live in a better situation.

loans.use: to acquire more products for his shop.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 22-year-old single man.  In 2010, he decided to start his own business working as an electrician. He works based upon customer's requests, and has a part-time worker under his supervision whenever there is more work to accomplish. 

Today, Kamal is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase electrical equipment and supplies. He states that these purchases will facilitate his accomplishments, and allow him to serve more customers. 

This is his first Kiva loan, and he is sure and certain that he will be capable of achieving remarkable growth in a short period based on getting the loan.

loans.use: purchase electrical equipment and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive con su esposo y con su hijo en casa propia, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia, desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, la clienta desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú y tener un poco mas de entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This client lives with her husband and son in her own house.  She’s a warrior and sees that her family does not lack what’s needed to subsist.  She currently works selling food near her house.  She’s done this for several years and has a large regular clientele because she sells the plate of food for a good price.  She wants to expand her stand, that is, to buy tables and chairs and more raw materials to vary her menu and increase her income a bit but she does not have enough income to make this investment which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy said items and thus earn higher profits to give her family what they need with no limit whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Rufino Armando

texts.es: Don Rufino de 58 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus seis  hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando sus cosechas ya están listas las almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a  comercializarlas en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo  prefieren  por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. don Rufino  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rufino, 58, lives with his life’s companion and their six children in his own house.  He works growing corn and beans and has been working in agriculture for several years so he’s acquired much experience that allows him to obtain the best crops.  When they are ready to be harvested he stores them in silos like the one shown in the photo to then go out selling them around the community.  He already has many customers that prefer him for the quality, good prices and above all good service.  

He needs to invest which is why he’s asking for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.  His acquaintances give Rufino good payment references and he’s very responsible; he’s sure that he will be able to repay the loan in the established time frame while at the same time trusts that he will provide economic security at home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gladys Georgina

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, aquí se puede encontrar una gran variedad de artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos, tres de ellos mayores de edad y una  de 18 años que es la que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Gladys es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar (licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otras muchas cosas mas) su forma de venta es por cartillas y por sistema acumulativo. Trabaja tres días por semana en todas sus actividades ya que ella tiene que ofrecer los productos,  entregar los productos y cobrar cada quince días, estos productos son entregados de acuerdo al número que les haya tocado a los clientes que van del uno al diez. Lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad, la misma que le permite tener sus ingresos para los gastos.

Este crédito es para comprar colchones planchas, licuadoras, sabanas entre otras cosas. Lleva cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer  crédito empezó en su negocio. 

Le gustaría tener un local o una distribuidora de estos productos.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” communal bank meets every two weeks in La Pila in Montecristi canton.  This place is very well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  A vast variety of crafts manufactured by the residents using traditional methods can be found here.

Gladys, 52, lives here.  She’s married and has four children, three adults and an 18-year-old girl still living with them.  Her husband is a merchant.

Gladys is a very good housewife who also spends time in commerce.  She sells items for the home (blenders, irons, and mattresses, among other things).  Her method of selling is by installment booklets and by a cumulative system.  She works three days a week in all her activities since she has to sell products, deliver them and collect payment every fifteen days.  The products are delivered according to the number each customer has been assigned from one to ten.  She’s been working in this activity for five years which makes it possible for her to earn income for her expenses.

This loan is to buy mattresses, irons, blenders and sheets, among other things.  She’s been in the communal bank five years and likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  She’d like to have a locale or a distributorship of these products.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, irons, blenders, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Yuri  Monserrate

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, aquí se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.

En este lugar vive la señora Yuri, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 5 años que este año empezó los estudios en jardín de infantes. El marido es comerciante. 
 
Doña Yuri es una gran mujer que a mas de dedicarse al hogar  también se dedica al comercio, ella y su esposo se dedican a la  compra y venta de  de adornos y cerámicas de toda variedad y motivos,  tiene un  local en la casa de sus suegros y no pagan arriendo por ser de la familia de su marido, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, ella trabaja en unión de sus esposo el cual además se encarga de darles el acabado a las obras ya que las compran semi terminadas,  estos productos los compran a artesanos de la zona para luego venderla a sus clientes. Llevan cinco  años con su negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer  crédito ellos empezaron su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” communal bank meets every two weeks in La Pila in Montecristi canton.  This place is very well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  A vast variety of crafts manufactured by the residents using their ancestral methods can be found here.

Yuri, 25, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a five-year-old daughter who started Kindergarten this year.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Yuri is a great woman who in addition to caring for her home also works in commerce.  She and her husband buy and sell ceramic decorations in all varieties and styles.  She has a locale in her in-laws’ house and they don’t have to pay rent on it since it belongs to her husband’s family.  They work every day from 8am until 5pm.  She works in conjunction with her husband.  He is in charge of giving the items the final touches since they purchase them semi-finished from local artisans to then sell them to their customers.  They’ve been in business five years and it makes it possible for them to get ahead.

This loan is to buy all types and models of crafts to stock their business.   She’s been in the communal bank five years and likes it because they started the business with their first loan.  Her dream is to own a house because they currently live in her in-laws’ house.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, a 25-year-old vigorous lady, has been stitching clothes for many years for the people of her community. She uses her income to support her entire family.

In order to meet customer demand, Robina has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of threads in various colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will enable her to stitch up more dresses and expand her clientele. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in various colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz is a 22-year-old lady and enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work two years ago. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes, and education. In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery, Mehnaz needs to buy more frames, needles, and threads in different colors. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. It will enable her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 53-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for Rs 15,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Idalia Margarita

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, aquí se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar vive la señora Idalia, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, su hija aun vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Idalia tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa que está ubicada en una vía principal,   ella prepara deliciosos platos y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde, ya que solo prepara desayunos y almuerzos. Trabaja sola aunque a veces le ayuda su hija y su esposo cuando él no tiene trabajo en el campo, ella prepara diferentes platos para satisfacer el gusto de sus clientes, razón por la cual día a día llegan muchas personas a servirse sus platos ya que son deliciosos, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio con el cual salen adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en el campo.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que su negocio mejore aun más.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” communal bank meets every two weeks in La Pila in Montecristi canton.  This place is very well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  A vast variety of crafts manufactured by the residents using their ancestral methods can be found here.

Idalia, 53, lives here.  She’s married and has two adult children; her daughter still lives with her.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Idalia has a small dining room at her house which is located on a main avenue.  She cooks delicious meals and works Monday to Saturday from 6am until 3pm since she only prepares breakfast and lunch.  She works alone but sometimes her daughter helps her and so does her husband when he doesn’t have any work in the fields to do.  She cooks different dishes to satisfy her customers’ taste buds which is why many people come by daily to enjoy her dishes because they are delicious.  She’s been in this business for more than ten years and it’s what makes it possible for them to move forward because her husband does not earn much in the fields.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other foodstuffs to prepare her dishes.  She’s been in the communal bank for four years and likes it because the loans are of much help for her to continue forward with her business.  Her dream is to continue moving ahead and that her business improves even more.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and others.

loans.name: Om-Raghd Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Raghd and is made up of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. The representative of the group, who is named Amonda, is a married woman who has two children. She is a very happy, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead. She has been selling clothes and perfumes. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva's partner, AMB, to buy clothes and perfumes and cosmetic materials for her business. She works about 10 hours a day and believes her business succeeds because of her dedication and friendly customer service.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes and cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru: Надира, 38 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей (2сына и 1 дочь). По специальности – учитель начальных классов. С 2004 года занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 3 дойные коровы и 8 телят и 10 коз, а также имеется 2,0 ГА поливной земли на которой она ежегодно выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Надира обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20 000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для картофеля. Доходы от кредита Надира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Nadira, 38 years old, married, has 3 children (2 sons and 1 daughter). Her training is in teaching elementary school classes. Since 2004, she has been engaged in farming, having started the business with 20,000 somons (KGS).  To date, she has been able to develop her agricultural capabilities, and also has her own farm. On the farm, she has a 3 dairy cows, 8 calves and 10 goats, as well as 2 hectares of irrigated land on which she grows potatoes every year. In order to further expand her farm and arable land, Nadira has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" Microfinance Bank to request a loan in the amount of 20,000 somons (KGS) in order to purchase fertilizer for potatoes. Nadira plans to invest the income from the loan towards increasing the amount of cattle on her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for potatoes

loans.name: Octavio Washington

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, aquí se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.

En este lugar vive el señor Octavio, tiene 61 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun vive en su casa, una de ellos es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 2 años que es la alegría de la casa. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Don Octavio es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que siempre y con mucho esfuerzo ha tratado de que no falte nada en su hogar,  se dedica a la compra y venta de  de adornos y cerámicas, su forma de venta es ambulante ya que el viaja a  otras ciudades llevando sus productos que son muy apreciados en todo el país , en estas ciudades se queda dos o tres días hasta que venda todo lo que lleva y realizar los cobros, luego regresa y se dedica a comprar a los artesanos del sector para en la siguiente semana viajar otra vez, lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los  créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “La Pila” communal bank meets every two weeks in La Pila in Montecristi canton.  This place is very well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  A vast variety of crafts manufactured by the residents using their ancestral methods can be found here.

Octavio, 61, lives here.  He’s married and has four children who are all adults now but two of his children still live at home.  One of them is a single mother and has a two-year-old daughter who is the home’s joy.  His wife is a housewife.

Octavio is a very responsible, hardworking man who has always tried with much effort to see that his home lacks nothing.  He works buying and selling decorations and ceramics.  He sells from place to place since he travels to other cities taking his products which are highly valued throughout the country.  He stays two or three days in these cities until he sells everything he’s carried and collected payments.  He then returns home and buys from the local artisans to prepare for the next trip.  He’s been in this business that allows him to get ahead more than 20 years.

This loan is to buy more crafts.  He’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  His dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Helen Valeria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Jesús De Nazaret. 

En este lugar vive la señora Helen, tiene 20 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo se dedica al comercio. 

Doña Helen es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado a base de su esfuerzo salir adelante, ella trabaja en una cafetería y pastelería muy concurrida en la ciudad, pero en sociedad con su mamá tienen un puesto en el centro de la ciudad en el cual venden ropa de todo tipo, en este lugar se reúnen muchos comerciantes informales a vender sus productos y ella junto a su mamá llevan más de 7 años con su negocio, cuando ella puede está en su local y cuando le toca trabajar su mamá se hace cargo de vender. Esto es un poco cansado para ella pero lo hace por su bienestar y de su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a financiar su negocio. 

Sus sueños son tener su propio local y una cafetería.
texts.en:
The “Jesús de Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed back then.

Helen, 20, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has no children yet.  Her husband works in commerce.

Helen is a very hardworking young woman who has always liked to get ahead by means of her own efforts.  She works in a very popular cafeteria and pastry shop in the city but in partnership with her mother she also has a stand in the city center where they sell all types of clothes.  Many merchants gather in this place to sell their products and she and her mother have been in business more than 7 years.  When she can she’s in her stand and when she must work at her job her mother takes care of the selling.  This is a bit tiring for her but she does it for her and her family’s well-being.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because the loans help her finance her business.  Her dream is to have a locale and a cafeteria of her own.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Уже более десяти лет как Владимир продает обувь женскую  на рынке. Летом торгует босоножками, туфлями,  зимой продает сапоги. Часто Владимир ездит с обувью по близлежащим селам, предлагая товар тем, кто там живет. Такие выезды к клиентам дают ему конкурентное приемущество и увеличивают его оборот.

Владимир просит предоставить ему кредит 20,000 гривен для расширения своего торгового места. Это поможет Владимиру лучше обслуживать своих клиентов и увеличить обороты. На вырученные деньги Владимир надеется купить новый автомобиль, т.к. он нужен ему для поездок по бизнесу.

Владимир женат. Жена помогает ему в бизнесе. Дети Владимира уже взрослые. Он мечтает заработать достаточно денег, чтобы помочь им приобрести собственное жилье.
texts.en: For more than ten years, Vladimir has been selling women's shoes at the market. In the summer, he sells sandals and shoes, in the winter, he sells boots. Vladimir often travels with the shoes to nearby villages, offering his merchandise to those who live there. These trips to meet customers give him a competitive advantage and increase his turnover.  Vladimir has requested to receive a loan of 20,000 hryvnia in order to expand his kiosk.  This will allow Vladimir to better serve the needs of his customers and increase turnover.  With the money, Vladimir hopes to buy a new car, which is necessary for him to make business trips.  Vladimir is married.  His wife helps him with his business.  His children are already grown.  He dreams of making enough money to help them obtain their own housing.

loans.use: to make a larger kiosk to sell more shoes

loans.name: Luis Melitón

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Jesús De Nazaret. 

En este lugar vive el señor Luis, tiene 62 años de edad, está divorciado y de esa relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive con él.

Don Luis es mecánico electricista y tiene un pequeño almacén en su casa en el cual se dedica a vender todo tipo de materiales eléctricos, tiene mucha clientela y su local es muy concurrido ya que allí ellos encuentran de todo y cómo él sabe mucho de esto les ayuda ofreciéndoles lo que realmente necesitan para su trabajo,  lleva más de 40 años con este negocio el cual le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos y que estos hoy en día sean personas de bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más materiales electicos y surtir el negocio con lo que le hace falta. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 ciclos  y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Jesús de Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed back then.

Luis, 62, lives here.  He’s divorced and has three adult children; one of his daughters lives with him.

Luis is an electrician and has a small store at home where he sells all types of electric items.  He has a large clientele and his locale is very popular because everything can be found there and since he knows a lot about it he help by offering what they really need for their work.  He’s been in this business for more than 40 years and it made it possible for him to raise his children who are now upstanding citizens.

He will use this loan to buy more electric goods to stock the business with what’s needed.  He’s been in the communal bank for two cycles and he likes the help the loans provide.  His dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy electric goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a fence and buy paint.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra tiene 50 años, está casada Y tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Alejandra Se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas, donde tiene plantaciones de productos que considera rentables de su región como  cacao orgánico, café; entre otros.
Se inicio hace mucho junto a su esposo con quien trabaja para mantenerse estable y darle lo mejor a sus hijos. Para mantener en buen estado sus plantaciones retira constantemente la maleza que crece en sus terrenos, además utiliza abono orgánico para mantener en buen estado sus parcelas. Cuando llega la cosecha suele contratar varios trabajadores para extraer los frutos maduros en menor tiempo y posteriormente secarlos para venderlo a los comprandores del lugar que le otorgan un precio de acuerdo a la calidad en que se hallan.
A lo largo de sus años de experiencia el único inconveniente que ha tenido es el ataque de plagas que perjudican el buen crecimiento de sus plantas así como sus ganancias. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva , y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para alquilar un terreno agrícola y cultivar cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 50, is married and has 3 children who live in a home made out of wood. Alejandra is a farmer, working 2 hectares of land that she has planted with products that she considers profitable in her region like organic cacao, coffee and other things. She started her work some time ago, alongside her husband, so that they can have some stability and give their children the best. 

In order to keep their plantations in good condition, they have to weed constantly, as well as applying organic compost. When harvest time comes they contract some day laborers to pick the ripe fruits in less time and later they dry them so they can sell them to the buyers in their region who give them a price according to the quality of the product. Throughout their years of experience the only inconvenience has been the attack of pests that threaten the growth of their plants and therefore their earnings. 

This is their first loan with Kiva, and they are grateful for the financial support that they received so that they can move forward. They promise to make their payments on time. On this occasion they received 2,000 nuevos soles to rent a piece of farm land and grow organic cacao.

loans.use: to rent a piece of farm land.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña morena  de 51 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, refrescos,aceite, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Morena is 51 years old and lives with her spouse and son. She owns a store where she sells basic needs items, beans, milk, eggs, bread, candy, soda pop, oil, and more. She has had this business for many years and it is given her sales experience that has enabled her to obtain the best profits. It is located in her home and is well-known in her neighborhood. She has many customers as she has the store stocked. She wants to grow the business and make a new investment but she needs capital therefore she is asking for a loan that will enable her to buy what she needs for her store. She assures that she will repay her loan and is confident that it will provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, milk, eggs, bread, candy, soda pop, etc.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru: Сергей работает на фабрике по производству жгутов. Живет в двухкомнатной квартире, где ремонт делался очень давно. Сергей хочет поставить душевую кабинку, заменить полы, покрасить стены. Он просит предоставить кредит в размере 15,000 гривен. Сергей уже пользовался кредитами и выплачивал их своевременно. Сергей надеется, что улучшенные жилищные условия помогут наладить ему семейные отношения.
texts.en: Sergei works at a factory which produces tourniquets. He lives in a two-room apartment which has not been repaired in a long time. Sergei wants to install a shower, change the floors and paint the walls. He has asked to receive a loan in the amount of 15,000 UAH. Sergei has taken out loans before, and has paid them back on time. Sergei hopes that improved living conditions will help him improve family relations.

loans.use: to improve living conditions

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Ramzan is a 45-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a laborer and is the only earner in the family. It was very tough for Ramzan to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband and earn some money. For this purpose, she started her business in animal trade. She buys small animals, brings them up, and then sells them to people in her area. Her husband assists her in his free time. Now she is playing a very important role in her family.

Currently, Ramzan requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase two more goats. She is in her second loan cycle. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья продает одежду на рынке. У нее несколько торговых точек. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Наталья смогла увеличить количество товара на второй торговой точке и получить дополнительную прибыль. В этот раз Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит на покупку лентней спортивной одежды, а также закупку одежды к школьному сезону. Все предыдущие кредиты Наталья выплачивала вовремя. 

Наталья любит спорт и пропогандирует здоровый и активный образ жизни.
texts.en: Nataliya sells clothing at the market. She has several kiosks. Thanks to the previous Kiva loan, Nataliya was able to increase the amount of merchandise at her second kiosk and receive additional profit. This time, Nataliya has requested to receive a loan for the purchase of summer sport clothing, as well as to purchase clothing for the school season. Nataliya has paid back all of her previous loans on time.  Nataliya loves sports and supports a healthy and active way of life.

loans.use: to purchase summer sport clothing

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 27 year old married man and the father of a two year old child. 

He describes himself as humble and honest.  Joshua operates a motor cycle transportation service. 

With a loan of Kes 21,595, Joshua will purchase a water tank. 

The tank will benefit three family members, and it's estimated to take two weeks to install.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a 45 year old married woman who describes herself humble.  She operates a retail shop selling flour, sugar and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Kibibi's business is located in a market area.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion.  Kibibi will use the Kes 30,000 loan to add stock of flour, sugar and cereals. 

This is Kibibi's first application of loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, sugar and cereals.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 21 year-old single man who has sold gas cylinders for three years. 

He lives in Sana'a, Yemen.  Ahmed is a hardworking man who seeks perfection in his business, especially by responding to almost all of his customers' needs.  He provides excellent customer service which he believes is the main source of improvement his business. 

Ahmed is applying for a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to increase his quantity of gas cylinders with special prices. He is a borrower in good standing.  Ahmed hopes he can open new gas cylinder stores in the future.

loans.use: to increase his quantity of gas cylinders.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 43 year-old married woman; she has been involved in crockery’s sales for twelve years. 

She offers various types of crockery, such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc.  Her husband also assists her in selling to the people of their community and in local market.  Suriya makes sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family's income. 

For the improvement of her business,  Suriya contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 35000 to purchase more variety of crockery such as plates, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. 

Suriya is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 25 year old married woman with a four year old daughter. 

She describes herself as jovial. Elizabeth operates a general store where she sells toys, umbrellas, cooking oil etc.  She has been in business for three years.  Her business is located in a shopping centre.   Elizabeth says her biggest business challenge is insufficient clean water for drinking. 

Elizabeth will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase a water purifier.  The purifier will benefit three family members. 

This is Elizabeth's third application for a loan from SMEP DTM. The previous being kes 50,000, which she repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier.

loans.name: Javan

texts.en:
Javan is a 35 year old married man. He has three children ranging in age from two to eight years old. 

He describes himself as honest.  Javan operates a motorcycle transportation business.  He says his biggest business challenge is the poor transport network. 

Javan will use his Kes 30,000 loan to purchase a solar panel.  This will benefit 10 people  This is his fourth successful loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela is a devoted mother of three children: a boy and two girls (in the photo). 

Anjela has been involved in agriculture since 2000 and over these 13 years of hard work, she now owns a small and beautiful farm in the Tavshut village. 

Together with her husband, Anjela runs her farm which currently includes cows, sheep, pigs, chickens and calves. The family also owns a plot of land where different types of vegetables are cultivated (wheat, barley, potato).

Since the family's only income comes from agriculture, it is very difficult for Anjela to cover her family's daily needs and at the same time to her farm's operational costs. 

Now she is requesting this loan to purchase forage to feed livestock and fuel to transport products to the market.  Anjela needs this loan to be able to continue running her farm and to gather income, which is vital for the family.

Anjela hopes for your support!

loans.use: to purchase forage to feed livestock and fuel to transport products to the market.

loans.name: Shamya

texts.en:
Shamya is a 47 year-old married woman.  She runs a small general store with her son at the corner of her house.  Her son also assists in the purchasing of goods from the market, as he has developed many contacts over the years. 

Shamya is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare.  

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

Shamya is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 54 year old married woman. She has four children ranging in age from 20 to 35 years old. 

She describes herself as determined.  Jane operates an electronic shop where she sells electrical products.  She has been in business for eight years. 

Jane's business is located in a market area.  She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital for expansion. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy electric wires, bulbs, sockets and extension cables.  Jane hoped to open a wholesale store in the near future. 

This is Jane's first application for a loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy electric wires, bulbs, sockets and extension cables.

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en:
Hajiran, age 46, deals in business of milk sales.  She has run this business with the support of her husband for many years. 

She has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk.  Hajiran has a good client list and makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. 

Hajiran has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  She is requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy another buffalo. 

This is Hajiran's sixth loan cycle and she has a good repayment history.  Hajiran expects to boost her earnings with her loan and plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Dimar

texts.es: El Sr. Dimar sigue con la misma actividad el es agricultor desde hace ya bastante tiempo, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de semillas para la siembra de sandia, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la siembra de papa también comprara semillas y para el preparado de la tierra, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad, Dinar en la foto se encuentra en compañia de su pareja.
texts.en: Dimar is continuing with the same occupation. He has been a farmer for quite a long time. He reports that things went well for him with the previous loan as he used it to buy seeds for planting watermelon. This time he is seeking a loan in order to plant potatoes. It is also for buying seeds and preparing the ground. He is pleased and thankful for the opportunity provided as he is growing and improving his business. In the picture Dimar is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and prepare the ground

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: Maria habita en casa de su propiedad con su hijo, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Maria es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her son's house.  She works sewing clothing items.  The business is located in her home.  Maria is an incredible and exemplary woman since she is very hardworking, responsible, and positive.  Many people have given good references of her personally and of her work.  She makes a variety of clothing items at affordable prices.  She also offers quality in her work, which is the reason many people prefer it.  She has done this work for many years, so she has a lot of experience and loyal customers who prefer her every day.  

She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business by purchasing the necessary supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons to make a variety of clothing items.  She is doing all of this with the goal of giving her customers better service so that her customers are motivated to continue requesting her services, which will increase her sales and her income.  She hopes to achieve her objective and improve her quality of life and that of her son.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons.

loans.name: Naseema

texts.en:
Naseema is a 31-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Naseema’s husband. They have been providing a service of cooking from their own home for a period of about six years.  Naseema enjoys making food and she became famous in her town for proving these facilities. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then delivers it to the respective places. 

She is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested a loan of Rs. 10,000 to buy stock of rice along with packs of oil and salt at lower rates from the market. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales. Naseema wishes to use her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and salt at lower rates from the market.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en: Taleb is a 26-year-old married man living with his wife. He has been working as a furniture painter since 2000. He is very talented at his job and completes his tasks efficiently. He was obliged to start to work at a young age in order to enhance his way of living. Today, Taleb is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase required materials and painting supplies. He states that the loan will certainly help him extend his trade and increase his income by a large percentage. In the future, he plans to borrow more Kiva loans to develop his work even more.

loans.use: to purchase required materials and painting supplies

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Don paulino  vive con su esposa en casa propia,  el es un hombre muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. El trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés a primeras horas de la madrugada para poder venderlo antes del desayuno, que es cuando las personas más lo consumen al igual que en la cena. Su esposa también le ayuda a elaborar el pan y luego sale a venderlo por las diferentes colonias. El solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para el  puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Paulino lives with his wife in a house they own.  He is a responsible man who is always trying to improve his financial situation.  He works in his own bakery where he makes French bread in the early hours of the morning in order to sell it before breakfast.  Breakfast and dinner are when most people eat it.  His wife also helps him make the bread and later goes out to sell it in different neighborhoods.  

He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to have the necessary help to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, butter, cans, and all of the necessary items to be able to produce more bread.  This project to improve his bakery is very important for the business, which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, butter, and cans.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 32-year-old married woman who has enjoyed the work of making Parandas for so many years. A Paranda is considered a traditional hair accessory in a country like Pakistan. Women use it for a traditional look on special occasions like Eid (a holiday) and weddings. She makes beautiful Parandas, especially for bridal hairstyles. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers who have helped her account for expenses she thought she could never bear. She is striving hard to meet her family's expenditures, as she is responsible for providing them with a good environment with good food, clothing, and education. To inflate her sales, she applied for a loan of Rs 15,000 through Kashf Foundation to buy raw materials including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment. This will help to attract more customers, which ultimately helps in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chocolates, stuffed bears, flowers, glue, cellophane bags, and foam decorations.

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en: Annastasia is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from five years to eight years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailor business where she sells suits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase material for knitting suits. This is her first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase material for knitting suits.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 31-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has been working as a car painter for the past 10 years. And in 2007, he was able to open his own garage where he achieves his work proficiently. In order to increase his business capital and improve his operation, Hasan is willing to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renew his business tools. Hasan is very optimistic, ambitious and always seeks the best; and this is the reason why he is doing a great effort in his professional career to progress and improve his financials.

loans.use: to renew his business tools

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 45 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has five children who are living on their own. She was unable to go to school. She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past 20 years, she has been selling hinges, door catches, door locks, and nails in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7am to 5pm. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her and she started this business with money given to her by her husband who is a contractor. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more hinges, door catches, door locks, and nails for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more hinges, door catches, door locks, and nails for her business,

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel  es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, el está es casado, tiene 2 hijos mayores independientes. El empezó trabajando con su padre como guarda de un transporte escolar, luego de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro comprar para su transporte y trabajar en el ya de forma independiente.
Se dedica a este trabajo hace 15 años. Gracias al trabajo que está  realizando pudo darle buena educación a sus hijos y llevar una vida digna. Angel ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Comenta que a una familia le da trabajo como ayudantes. Solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de cubiertas y también para el mantenimiento del vehículo. Agradece por la a oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Angel is from the city of San Lorenzo. He is married with two grown up children. He started working with his father as a conductor on a school bus. Later, with a lot of effort and dedication, he managed to buy his own vehicle and he now works independently.

He has done this work for 15 years. Thanks to the work he is doing he was able to give his children a good education and lead a decent life. Angel has shown that he is a person who is very responsible and honest with his commitments. He comments that he gives another family work as helpers. He is requesting this loan so he can use it to purchase tyres and for vehicle maintenance. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving, as it will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to purchase tyres and do vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. To deal with the demands of her customers time after time she needs to buy more packs of salt, biscuits and beverages. For this she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation.  It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Felix, vive con su familia. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos como una fuente de ingresos para apoyar a su familia con los gastos. 
El prestamo que requiere  le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros para llevar a cabo la siembra y asi obtener una buena cosecha porque contara con todo lo necesario.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Felix lives with his family. He makes a living by growing staple grains as a source of income to support his family with the expenses.

The loan he needs will allow him to purchase farming supplies, such as compost, insecticide, and pesticide, in order to carry out the planting and thereby obtain a good harvest because he will have everything he needs.

His dream is to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost, insecticide, and pesticide, among other things

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: La señora Nora tiene 51 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, almuerzos y cena en su pequeña pensión que se encuentra en la zona Simón Bolívar de la localidad de El Torno,  La señora Nora es una persona muy trabajadora  y amable atiende muy bien a sus clientes razón por la cual su pensión es muy concurrida y también por la buena sazón de sus alimentos,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un frizer y mesas y sillas para brindar comodidad a su clientes, ya que está incrementando su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. Nora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito, el deseo de la Sra. Nora es tener un gran restaurante y así de esta manera mejorar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Nora is 51 years old. She makes a living by selling food (lunches and dinner) in her small diner in the zone of Simón Bolívar in El Torno. Nora is a very hard-working and friendly person. She attends to her customers very well and her food tastes good, which is why her diner is very busy. With the money from the loan she will buy a freezer, as well as tables and chairs for the comfort of her customers, because her clientele and her income are increasing. Nora feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have given her by granting this loan. Nora’s wish is to have a great restaurant and thereby improve both her clientele and her income.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, tables, and chairs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material for tailoring suits.

loans.name: Shabnum

texts.en: Shabnum is a 30-year-old energetic, married woman. She has had a flower-making business for many years and it's been a passion for her. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays and other parties. She sells the flowers to the people of her community and also supplies the local market. She requires a loan of 15, 000 PKR to buy various types of fabric, such as silk and cotton, and packs of glue and wire as raw materials. In this way she would be able to consistently meet the growing demands of her customers. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy various types of fabric, such as silk and cotton, and packs of glue and wire as raw materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 27-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be hard-working and tolerant. She operates a tailoring business where she sells suits. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase material for tailoring the suits. This is her first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase material for tailoring suits.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 33-year-old single woman. She has a child who is 10 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailoring business where she sells suits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase material for tailoring suits. This is her first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase material for tailoring suits.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a 47-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She is a mother of four children and responsible for their food, health and education and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. She requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread in various colors, packs of buttons, zippers, ribbons and laces to complete the orders of her customers on time. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread in various colors, packs of buttons, zippers, ribbons and laces.

loans.name: Diana Melissa

texts.es:
Diana, vive con su familia, su compañero de vida y  sus hijos. No tiene familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de perfumes, el oficio lo aprendió de su familia y lo realiza en cualquier hora y la ventaja de este negocio, es que si al cliente no le parece el producto, este lo puede devolver  sin ningún problema. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de perfumes; esta inversión le ayudara para optimizar el negocio y así poder tener más productos en inventario. 
Su sueño es logar tener una sala de perfumería de toda marca, al gusto del cliente.
texts.en:
Diana lives with her family, her partner, and her children. She does not have any relatives in other countries. She makes a living by selling perfumes. She learnt this trade from her family and does it whenever. The advantage of this business is that if the client does not like the product they can return it without any problems.

The loan she needs will allow her to purchase a variety of perfumes; this investment will help her to optimize her business and thereby be able to have more products in her inventory.

Her dream is to have a perfumery full of all different brands, to the taste of the clients.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of perfumes

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ABEJITAS TRABAJADORAS está  compuesto por nueve integrantes, todas  mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Elizabeth tiene 34 años casada con cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en la zona de Villa Ingenio por donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elizabeth utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, arroz y fideo al por mayor  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, la Sra. Elizabeth va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de insumos,  su deseo de la Sra. Elizabeth es crecer en su negocio,  la Sra. Elizabeth es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: The communal bank “Abejitas Trabjadoras” is composed of nine members, all of whom are women. The president of the communal bank is Elizabeth. She is 34 years old and married with five children. She makes a living by selling food from her stall in the zone of Villa Ingenio, where she lives. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Elizabeth will use this loan to wholesale purchase food-making supplies, such as potatoes, rice, and noodles. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and increase her working capital. Her reason for requesting this loan is her lack of capital to purchase supplies. Elizabeth is going to use the money to continue buying supplies in bulk. Elizabeth’s wish is to grow in her business. Elizabeth is a hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they are giving her by granting this loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making food

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет в городе Хуст. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту она купила морозильную камеру и смогла съэкономить деньги за закупке продуктов. В этот раз Наталья просил предоставить ей кредит для развития бизнеса. Она торгует косметическими средствами. 8000 гривен помогут ей закупить краску для волос и средства для загара. 

Наталья - очень целеустремленный человек. На сегодняшний день она ставит перед собой цель помочь дочери оплатить учебу в колледже. Наталья развивает свой бизнес и является оптимистом, который прикладывая усилия двигается вперед.
texts.en: Nataliya lives in Khoost, Ukraine.  Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to buy a freezer as well as to save money to buy more inventory.  She is asking for another loan to expand her business.  She sells cosmetics.  A sum of 8,000 hryvnia will help her to buy hair dye and tanning cream.  Nataliya is a very determined person.  She has set a goal to help her daughter pay for college.  She is expanding her business and is an optimist moving forward.

loans.use: to buy hair dye and suntan cream to sale

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin  is 37 years old, married and has three daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar  IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Elchin has been breeding cattle for the last seven years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Elchin usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five or six months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Elchin also keeps milker cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 

He has already taken four loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for his fifth loan of 2000 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milker cow. With this money he wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milker cow

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida, age 47,  is a married woman and expert in hand embroidery. She has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 6 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community and is the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. She requests a loan of Rs. 15, 000 to buy raw materials such as colorful thread, sequins, stones and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is a mother of four children and wants to fulfill their demands of life including food, clothing and education. She dreams to maximize her profit from the business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as colorful thread, sequins, stones and pearls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material for sewing suits.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is 23 years old and works from home as a seamstress. She has been in this line of work for two years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Asma was not earning her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation. She requests a loan of Rs. 15,000  to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread in various colors. In this way she will be able to sew more dresses on time. She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Norus

texts.en: Norus is a 38 year old married woman and a mother of three. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband on the corner of there house. She has 2 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy packs of salt, sugar and beverages. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers. She is hopeful to get a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 45 year old married woman. She has 2 children aged 16 and 20. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailoring business where she sells suits. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase material for sewing suits. This is her 1st application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase material for sewing suits.

loans.name: Shammah

texts.en: Shammah is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three. She has been doing tailoring for seven years to assist her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase more reels of thread with some packs of buttons, zippers, ribbons and lace. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread with some packs of buttons, zippers, ribbons and lace.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 39 year old married woman and has been farming for years. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out at the market for higher prices. In this way she earns a good amount of income to support the needs of her family. She has eight children; she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet their day to day expenses. Currently, she requests a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase one more goat. She hopes to increase her earnings and wishes to spend a part of her income on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat.

loans.name: Sanubar

texts.en: Sanubar is 48 years old and a mother of 2 children.  She lost her husband 2 month ago. Now she is the only person who can take care of her family. Sanubar is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  As you can see from the photo, she has land but she does not have enough funds to a cultivate the land or grow fruit trees or vegetables. For that she needs a loan 2000 AZN  to buy fruit trees, seeds and fertilizers.  She has already taken 2 loans from Aqroinvest in past. With a good loan history she has applied for a third loan.  Sanubar awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 34 year old married woman. She has 2 children aged 9 and 12. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a salon. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase salon chemicals and beauty products. This is her 1st loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase salon chemicals and beauty products.

loans.name: Dayanat

texts.en:
Dayanat is 38 years old, married and a father of three children, 17, 16 and 9 years old. Dayanat is a Karabakh war veteran, he lost his left arm in a  minefield. To support his family, 21 years ago, he started an agricultural business. His gets big help from members of his family. The scope of his activity is the sale of animals which he buys, raises and then sells when they're bigger for more money. In addition, the income of his family is his disability pension and the salary of his wife, she works as a cleaner at a local school.
Dayanat needs to buy two calves for his business, with this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Jemmimah

texts.en: Jemmimah is a 33 year old single woman. She describes herself to be patient and tolerant. She operates a boutique where she sells second hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothing to sell at her store. This is her 1st loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell at her store.

loans.name: Julia Petrona

texts.es: Julia Petrona mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad que aún están bajo su cargo, Julia es originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega zona la cual se caracteriza por el comercio, donde existe uno de los ingenios más conocidos en nuestro país, ella se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa nueva variada, zapatos, cosméticos entre otros, sus compras son al contado en varios mercados de mayoreos, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales su negocio es de forma ambulante y en algunas ocasiones en su casa de habitación, ella inicia este negocio para solventar ciertos gastos en su hogar, Julia ha luchado por sacar a delante a sus hijos para brindarles un mejor futuro, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su vivienda y así darles un techo digno de vivir a sus pequeños hijos, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en  capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como: cosméticos, prendas, ropa variadas para adultos, niños, entre otros, julia agradece mucho a los inversionistas Kivas por el apoyo que ellos les brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Julia Petrona is married with two children, both of whom are under 18 years old and still under Julia's charge.  Julia is originally from a town in the Chinandega area, which is known for its businesses and where one of the country's best known talent exists.  Julia makes a living buying general merchandise, such as a variety of new clothes, shoes, make-up and others.  She buys in cash and in bulk in various markets.  She sells her products for cash or on credit both to regular customers and passers-by.  She is a street vendor and, on some occasions, she sells her products from her home.  Julia started her business in order to cover some household costs.  She has fought to get her children ahead and to provide them with a better future.  One of her dreams is to improve her home and give her children a decent place to live.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock-up her business buying and selling merchandise, such as make-up, clothing items for adults and children, and more.  Julia is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support to people of low financial resources.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing, shoes, cosmetics and more.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, está casada y goza de dos hijos, los cuales tiene edades de 14 y 16 años. Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace cuatro años y este oficio lo apertura por iniciativa propia; hasta el momento no tiene ningún problema.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar cuatro vacas para la crianza y luego venderlos; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y con las ganancias, seguir apoyando a su familia.
Su sueño es ayudar a  sus hijos en sus estudios y que no les falte la  alimentación.
texts.en:
María is married and has two children, ages 14 and 16.  She raises cattle and pigs and has been in business for four years, having started it on her own initiative and without any problems so far.

The loan she is requesting is to buy four cows to raise and later sell.  This investment will help increase business; and the profits earned will be used to continue supporting the family.

Her goal is to help her children get an education and insure they have food on the table.

loans.use: To buy four cows to raise and sell.

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es: Una humilde mujer que siendo madre soltera intenta salir adelante es la joven Irma, quien habita en Tipitapa un municipio a 30 minutos de Managua, ahora ella se ha dedicado a vender prendas de acero, para poderles dar la educación y alimento a sus tres hijos. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en cadenas, pulseras, anillos, dijes, para damas y caballeros, con esta pequeña inversión espera continuar con las ventas para mantener sus ingresos y que sobre todo a sus hijos no les falte la comida.
texts.en: Irma is a humble, young single mother who is trying to get ahead.  She lives in Tipitapa, a town 30 minutes from Managua.  She sells steel jewelry in order to educate and feed her three children.  The loan she is requesting is to buy women's and men's chains, bracelets, rings and charms.
