With this small investment she hopes to continue with her sales and maintain her income, especially so she can put food on the table for her children.

loans.use: To buy steel chains, bracelets, rings and charms.

loans.name: Ana Eloisa

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar frutas y verduras para ofrecerles a los clientes y asi satisfacer sus necesidades.
El efecto del  crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Ana is in need of a new loan to continue investing in her business.  This will enable her to buy fruits and vegetables to make available to customers in order to meet their demands.

The previous loan had a favorable effect and helped Ana increase her inventory and achieve more income.  Her family situation remains the same.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hector Gustavo

texts.es:
Héctor,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar repuestos para motocicleta y herramienta de soldadura.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que logro satisfacer las necesidades para con sus clientes y las circunstancias económicas se han optimizado porque mejoraron los ingresos.
texts.en:
Héctor is in need of a new loan to use as working capital to continue in his business.  This will allow him to buy motorcycle spare parts and welding tools.

The previous loan had a favorable effect because he was able to satisfy customer needs, which improved his economic situation and income.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts and welding tools.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 26 años, está casada con Emerson, con quien vive en su casa construida a base de Material noble. Marlene se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando algunos productos rentables de su zona. Lleva 6 años en su actividad laboral, el cual le brinda muy buenos ingresos económicos.
Cuando comenzó fue algo complicado porque no estaba acostumbrada al trabajo en el campo pero gracias a su esfuerzo logro salir delante de a pocos. Para empezar trabajaba en el terreno agrícola de sus suegros pero gracias a las ganancias que fue obteniendo compró 1 hectárea de terreno de cultivo en donde amplió su producción de cacao orgánico. Considera que el cacao es un producto muy rentable en su zona ya que un solo  árbol suele producir mazorcas para varias campañas productivas. Para mejorar la calidad de su producción suele fertilizar sus parcelas con abono orgánico. Suele contratar trabajadores del lugar principalmente en la cosecha donde con la ayuda necesaria seca los granos extraídos para venderlo a los compradores del lugar. Uno de sus principales objetivos es seguir ampliando su terreno de cultivo para obtener mayores ganancias. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con S/.4,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marlene, 26, is married to Emerson and they live in a house made of solid materials.  Marlene is a farmer who grows profitable crops in her area and she has been in business for six years, earning a good income.

When she started out things were a little complicated because she was not used to working on a farm, but thanks to her efforts she was able to get ahead in a short amount of time.  She started working on her parents-in-law's land but eventually used her earnings to buy an acre of land where she grows organic cocoa.  She believes it is a very profitable crop in her area because one tree can produce several cobs per season.  

In order to improve the quality of her production, Marlene usually treats her land with organic fertilizer.  She hires workers at harvest time so she can dry the beans and sell them to local customers.

One of her main goals is to continue expanding her cropland to increase her profits.  This is her first loan through Kiva; and she is grateful for the financial support and committed to paying back the loan on time.  She plans to use the 4,000 PEN loan to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: José  Juan

texts.es:
Don José tiene 43 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Es una persona que se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 15 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre; quien se dedicaba a esa misma actividad también se dedica a la producción de granos básico como maíz, frijol y maicillo y aprendió la albañilería. Don José vive junto a su compañera de vida y 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, su compañera de vida, es la que comercializa los mariscos que él pesca cada día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, insecticidas para la siembra de maíz y frijoles. El Cual sera formula que contiene fósforo calcio y potasio para la nutrición de la tierra y sulfato que contiene Nitrógeno para mejorar la producción de la planta, también utilizara $400 para la mejora de su equipo de Pesca 

De esta manera, satisfacera una mejor producción de granos básicos para el sustento diario de su familia así como para la venta del mismo por lo cual tendrá mejores ingresos económicos para poder sostener la educación de sus hijas e hijos así como también su estabilidad familiar y también tendrá un mejor equipo para desarrollar la actividad de pesca sin ningún problema y tendrá mejores resultados 

Don José planea tener una vivienda digna para su familia y sacar adelante a sus hijos con una buena
Educación que les permita tener una mejor oportunidad para laborar y tener sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and has a partner and three children. He has been in the fishing business for 15 years, having learnt this profession from his father who was a fisher as well. He also works with the cultivation of basic crops such as corn, beans, and sorghum, and he knows the art of masonry. José lives together with his life partner and three children aged 16, 14 and 12. His partner sells the seafood that he fishes every day. 

The loan he is applying for at Fundación Campo is for buying fertilizer and insecticides for cultivating corn and beans. This fertilizer contains phosphorus, calcium, and potassium that nourish the soil, and sulfate that contains nitrogen and improves the growth of the plants. He will also use $400 for improving his fishing equipment.

This way, he will have a better production of basic crops for the daily sustenance of his family, and he will be able to sell some of it in order to improve his income so that he can pay for his children's education and have more stability in the family. He will also have a better fishing equipment so that he can fish without trouble and obtain better results.

José plans to offer his family a decent home and raise his children with a good education that allows them to get better working opportunities and earn their own incomes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for cultivating corn and beans. He will also use $400 for improving his fishing equipment

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de textiles,la socia vende los textiles en diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de textiles.La socia solicita el credito para comprar textiles.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Alicia buys and sells textiles. She sells her merchandise at different festivals and she works from 8am to 6pm. She has been in this business for 7 years and everything is going well. She wants to expand her business now, and so she is asking for a loan in order to buy more merchandise. 

She is thankful to the lenders and she promises to make her payments on time, following the repayment schedule.

loans.use: purchase textiles.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa;La socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesanía, crianza de animales menores y venta de chicha(bebida a base de maíz),la socia lleva años con sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a sus negocios,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de maiz para realizar la chicha.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the communal bank “Reynita de Belen Ccorao." The bank is located in the district of Ccorao, in the province and department of Cuzco. 

She has an artisenal business and she also raises small animals as well as making and selling chicha (a beverage made from corn). She has been in business for years now, and everything goes well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. She is a responsible and dedicated person, and this is how she is able to make a better life for her family. 

She is asking for a credit in order to make chicha. 

She is happy for the credit and she promises to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: purchase corn to make the beverage "chicha."

loans.name: Celestina

texts.pt:
De 43 anos de idade, é casada e tem um filho de 8 anos que anda na 4ª classe. Ajuda ainda a sustentar o seu pai, que é pensionista e que vive com ela.
Celestina é negociante e vende quase todo o dia em sua casa. Além disso, possui também um salão de cabeleireiro em sua casa.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de cimento,cervejas e refrescos para revenda em sua casa. Celestina tem a esperança de fazer crescer o seu negócio e ampliar o seu salão de cabeleireiro.
O principal desafio e continuar com o seu negócio e ter mais um estabelecimento numa outra zona, isto e, expandir o seu negócio.
texts.en:
43 years old, Celestina is married and has one 8 year old son who's in 4th grade. She also helps to support her father who is retired and lives with her.

Celestina is a trader and sells products from her home almost every day. In addition to this she also owns a hair salon at her home.

The money from the loan will be used to buy cement, beer and sodas to resell from her home. Celestina is hopeful that she will be able to grow her business and expand her hair salon.

Her main challenge is to continue with her business and open one more establishment in another area - in other words, to expand her business.

loans.use: buy cement, beer and sodas to resell from her home.

loans.name: Latia

texts.pt:
Tem 50 anos, é casada há 34 anos e oficialmente há 3 anos. Tem 6 filhos, dos quais um estuda e os restantes são maiores de idade. Sustenta ainda 3 netos que vivem com ela.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de cimento, areia e pedra para dar continuidade à construção da sua obra aumentando um quarto e varanda.
Futuramente Latia pretende fazer um muro para vedação da sua casa. Ela tem o principal desafio de concluir a sua obra e comprar mais mobília. Diz também que quer reembolsar pontualmente o crédito.
texts.en:
Latia is 50 years old, has been married for 34 years and officially married for 3 years. She has 6 children, one of whom goes to School and the rest are of age. She also supports 3 grandchildren who live with her.

The money from this loan will be used to buy cement, sand and stone to continue the expansion of her home by adding one bedroom and a balcony.

In future, Latia plans to build a wall around her house. Her main challenge is to complete the building work and buy furniture. She says she also wants to pay back her loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: buy cement, sand and stone to continue the expansion of her home by adding one bedroom and a balcony

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 31-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. She describes herself as trustworthy and self-driven. She operates a poultry keeping and sells chickens and eggs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are restaurants. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital for expansion. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to add chickens to her farm. This is her first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add chickens to her farm.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 34-year-old married woman who describes herself as determined. She has four children ranging from six years to thirteen years old. Virginia operates a salon in a shopping centre, where she provides hair and beauty treatments and products. She has been involved in this business for five years and describes her biggest business challenge as gaining enough capital for expansion. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to add to her stock of hair and beauty products. This is her first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a 33-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 3 months to 4 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a motorcycle transportation business. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a crowded area. 

Micah describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his children. This is his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a 21-year-old single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a shopping center. 

Dan describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to purchase another shaving machine and employ someone else. This is his 2nd application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase another shaving machine.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales,la socia tambien vende ovejas y crianza de cuyes y le vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales y animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cereales y tambien ovejas y cuyes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda continues her businesses selling cereals, selling sheep, and raising guinea pigs. She sells them in different markets. She has been running these businesses for four years, and it is going very well. 

Hilda's dream is to have a fixed place of business where she can sell the cereals and the animals. She is applying for this loan in order to buy cereals, as well as sheep and guinea pigs. She is happy to receive the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy sheep and guinea pigs

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  TIBINA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Mme MARIAMA debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 1. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women. On average, they are 43 years old and have five children. They all live in polygamous families in Tibina, one of the villages in Sikasso (the 3rd administrative region of Mali). 

The women collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. This is their ninth loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Mariyama, pictured standing in the middle, grows maize. With her loan, she is planning to buy farm inputs and agricultural seed to cultivate one hectare. 

After harvest, the produce is sold at the market in the village to both men and women customers. 

Mariyama is hoping to make 100 000 CFA francs per campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and agricultural seed.

loans.name: Atuwezeshe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shamwindo est membre du groupe d’affaire  « Atuwezeshe», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un étudiant à l’université. La cliente est vendeuse de viande. Elle installe ses produits dans sa modeste boucherie. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ une année. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 chèvres. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser son mari et ses enfants et construire une maison pour sa famille. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes détiennent leurs petits enfants.
texts.en:
Shamwindo is a member of the Atuwezeshe business group. A young, experienced entrepreneur, she is 28 years old, married, and has five children, who are all at school. Her husband is a student at the university. 

Shamwindo sells meat from a small butcher shop. She started her business around a year ago, using her own money received from her husband. This new loan will help her buy three goats. 

In this way, she would like to expand her business, support her husband’s education and build a house for her family. 

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for providing support to small-scale entrepreneurs through microcredit. It should be noted that some customers are pictured holding their children.

loans.use: to buy three goats.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 37-year-old married woman. She has two children, 3 years and 6 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a green grocer where she sells fruit and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market area. 

Caroline describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add kale, potatoes and cabbages. This is her first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add kale, potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Tioumoutie 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIOUMOUTIE 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIASSO, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec Mme SALIMATA assise en première  position de la  droite vers la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 1hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tioumoutie 1 group are married women. On average, they are 43 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Ziasso, one of the villages in Sikasso (the 3rd administrative region of Mali). 

The group members collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. This is their tenth loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Salimata, pictured seated on the far right, grows maize. With her loan, she is planning to buy farm inputs and agricultural seed to cultivate one hectare. 

After harvest, the produce is sold in the village at the market to both men and women customers. 

Salimata hopes to make 100 000 CFA francs per campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and agricultural seed.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a 36-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells flour, sugar and cooking oil. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil. This is his 7th application for a loan with SMEP DTM. He had a previous loan of 70,000 Kes that he repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tioumoutie 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIOUMOUTIE 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIASSO, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme AWA assise en première  position de la   gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et  semences agricoles pour entretenir 1hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tioumoutie 2 group are married women. On average, they are 43 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Ziasso, one of the villages in Sikasso (the 3rd administrative region of Mali). 

The group members collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season. This is their tenth loan with the institution and all their previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Awa, pictured seated on the far left, grows maize. With her loan, she is planning to buy farm inputs and agricultural seed to cultivate one hectare. After harvest, the produce is sold at the village market to both men and women customers. 

Awa is hoping to make 105 000 CFA francs per campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and agricultural seed.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina;La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesanía en una de las ferias artesanales , la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de textiles para su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sabina belongs to the "Reynita de Belen de Ccorao" communal bank, located in the Ccorao District of Calca Province, in the Cusco Region. 

Sabina continues to buy and sell handicrafts at a local market. She has run this business successfully for years thanks to her diligent efforts each day. Sabina is very industrious and motivated to keep working to provide for her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase textiles for her business. 

Sabina is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on-time.

loans.use: to purchase textiles for her business.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif 45 years old, married, and the father of 2 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. 

He is repairing cars in his garage and he also does welding for the maintenance of the cars. He has been doing this job for more than 14 years. Sharif says that it’s very hard work but to take care of his family he must work. His profit from this business is about 100 AZN a month. 

Sharif wants to take a loan because he requires new equipment and machinery in his garage. With a good loan history, he has applied for second loan of 2,000 AZN. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and machinery for his garage.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a young farmer who is already highly skilled in animal breeding and land cultivation. Lusine has been involved in agriculture since she got married in 2010. Currently Lusine and her husband own a farm which includes cows, sheep and chickens, and they also own a plot of land where they cultivate wheat, barley, potatoes and greens.

The couple works hard to gather a good harvest, sell it locally and earn income in order to meet the family's needs. They are devoted parents of two little kids and work hard to sustain their living.

Lusine is requesting this loan because she needs some improvements on her farm. With the loan's help she plans to purchase fertilizer, as it is very important for successful cultivation, and also she needs to purchase fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. 

This loan is very important for Lusine and her husband to be able to increase their agricultural business and ensure a better future for their children.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in Kilifi, a town located along the Kenyan coastline. She is a single mother of one. She is also a business lady. The 29-year-old has been operating a cosmetics shop for the last three years. She also has a beauty salon alongside the cosmetics shop that earns her extra income. 

She has ambitions as well. In five years she wants to see her cosmetics shop grow into a wholesale store. She also thinks of enlarging the salon to employ more young people who don't have jobs. The major challenges that she has been facing when running her errands is the weather. Weather also affects the number of clients that visit her salon, and it also limits the styles that her clients desire. 

She learned about Milango through friends when she wanted credit to finance her business. The extra income raised by the loan use will go towards seeking sites and then opening other branches of her business. She needs a loan to buy weaves, wigs and other cosmetic items for her shop. She wants financial stability.

loans.use: to buy weaves, wigs and other cosmetic items.

loans.name: Humbat

texts.en:
Humbat is a 39-year-old married father of three children. As a Jabrayili refugee, he is an internally displaced person (IDP) in Azerbaijan and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Humbat grows fruits and vegetables, including tomatoes, potatoes and eggplant. He says this business is very hard but together with his wife he has been handling it without any difficulty for 10 years. 

Humbat sells his produce in the bazaar and earns an income of 150 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). He has plans for the future, such as acquiring more land for cultivation. He is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase a lot of fruits at that time.

Humbat has applied for a loan of 1800 AZN through Aqroinvest in order to purchase new fertilizers and seeds. These will help him to grow more produce in order to earn more revenue in the summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jeleen

texts.en:
Jeleen is 30 years old and the married mother of three, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jeleen requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Jeleen would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Henelyn

texts.en:
Henelyn is 47 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Henelyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Soha Group

texts.en: This group is called Soha and consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER. Soha is the president of this group. She is 18 years old and lives in Aden, Yemen. She has been selling phone accessories in order to make a profit. Her business is her main source of income. She applied for a youth a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy recharge phone cards for her business.

loans.use: to buy recharge phone cards for her business.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es: María Vilma mayor de edad con dos hijos mayores de edad, del domicilio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, María se dedica al destace de cerdo donde vende deliciosos nacatamales, fritos, pepenas, carne, chicharrón, entre otros, es una mujer trabajadora desde muy temprana edad ella empieza a trabajar para darle el sustentos a sus hijos, y asi poder brindarles un mejor futuro, María destace dos veces a la semana realiza sus compras de cerdos en comarcas aledañas sale a vender de manera ambulante en mercados, y comarcas, Está solicitando financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación las cuales consiste en colocación de techo, puertas y repello de pared, estas mejoras las ha querido realizar desde que adquirió esta propiedad pero por falta de recursos económicos no los había podido hacer. María no es primer crédito que tiene en los créditos pasados ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Los sueños de María es poder ver terminada su vivienda para tener así un techo digno donde vivir, con este financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción como: Perlines, Zin, Cemento, Cal, Arena, Piedrín, Clavos, entre otros. María agradece la ayuda que brindan los inversionistas Kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua que posee tantas limitantes
texts.en:
María Vilma is older, with two adult children, and lives in the Chinandega District of western Nicaragua. She butchers pigs and sells delicious foods, including Nicaraguan-style tamales, pepenas [a regional style of taco], pork dishes, pork rinds, and other fried foods. María has always been very industrious and started working very young to support her children and provide them with a better future. María butchers pigs twice a week, purchasing the animals at local markets and selling the foods she prepares in local markets. 

María is requesting funds for improvements to her home: installation of a roof and doors, and plaster for the walls. She's wanted to make these repairs since she bought the house, but has lacked the funds to pay for them.  

This is not María first loan, and she's proven her reliability by making full and timely payments in the past. María's dream is to finish the work on her home and live under a full roof. She plans to use this loan to purchase construction materials, including purlines, metal roofing material, cement, lime, sand, gravel, and nails. María is grateful for the help of Kiva lenders to people with limited financial means in countries such as Nicaragua, who face so many challenges.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials including purlines, cement, lime, sand, and gravel, and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 59 años, es divorciada y madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 4 ya son mayores e independientes por está razón solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Sabina se dedica a la agricultura, este es su principal fuente de ingreso. Inicialmente contaba con un terreno agrícola de una hectárea  en donde producía integralmente cacao orgánico, con las ganancias correspondientes compró otra hectárea en donde empezó a cultivar plantas de café orgánico. Durante muchos años contó con el apoyo de su esposo pero tras su separación contrata trabajadores del lugar para las tareas más complicadas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha de las mazorcas de cacao. Para mantener constantemente la calidad de sus productos fertiliza el terreno de sus cultivos con abono orgánico. Este es su primer préstamo y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante con su actividad laboral, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea solicitar 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y plantas de almácigo.
texts.en:
Sabina is 59 years old, divorced, and the mother of six children whereof four are already of age and independent, which is why she is only living with two of them in the house she owns. Sabina works with agriculture, this being her main source of income. Initially, she had one hectare of arable land at her disposal where she grew fully organic cocoa. With the profits she made she bought another hectare where she started cultivating organic coffee. 

For many years she counted on her husband's help but since their separation she hires workers from the neighborhood to do the most difficult tasks such as removing weeds and harvesting the cocoa pods. In order to assure at all times the quality of her products, she uses organic manure to fertilize her piece of land.  

This is her first loan, she is grateful for the financial support she receives in order to continue her work, and pledges to make her repayments on time. She is requesting 3000 PEN so that she can buy organic manure and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and seedlings

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, 30, is an industrious man, married to Fancy and the father of three children aged between 2 and 8. He is a livestock trader in the outskirts of the town of Bomet, and he has been in business for the last eight years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000. He first learned about KADET LTD from other traders in the market. Daniel has received a second loan, of KES 75,000, after successfully paying off the previous loan. The funds will enable him to buy more livestock for resale at a profit. The proceeds will be used to repay the loan, as well as to attend to the family's basic needs. His hope is to buy his own piece of land, where he can settle with his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren is a 45-year-old married woman. She has four children, whose ages range from 4 to 15. She describes herself as hard-working. She operates a retail space where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of fish and eggs. This is her first loan application to SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stocks of fish and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Sopia

texts.en: Sopia is 37 years old, a very hard-working man, married to Jackline and the father of four children aged 8, 7, 4 and 2. He is a wheat farmer in Mau Narok, and he has been in the business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has received his fourth loan, of KES 20,000, which will enable him meet the cost of plowing his now-extended piece of land. He uses a hired tractor for cultivation and better yields. He will use the proceeds to lease more land for wheat farming. His dream is to buy his own tractor for commercial farming.

loans.use: pay to rent a tractor for his farm.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She sells groundnuts in Nairobi town. She also sells charcoal and supplies various hotels in the area. She has been in this business for 7 years and it has been profitable.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of groundnuts and charcoal for resale. She will use the generated income to buy more stock of groundnuts.

She hopes to grow her business and open a retail shop, make more income and be able to own a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts and charcoal.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 30 years old, married to Winnie, both of whom contribute to the support of their family of four people. John has been in business for the last seven years, with a monthly income of KES 65,000. He managed to get a second loan from KADET LTD, of KES 40,000, which he plans to use to buy some material, threads, and needles for tailoring. The anticipated profit will be used to improve his standard of living. He hopes and dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Jenelly

texts.en:
Jenelly is a 46-year-old married mother of eight, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, Jenelly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 42-years-old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Josie has a poultry business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 28,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed for her poultry business.

Josie has been in the poultry business for two years and has borrowed 13 times from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Lesty

texts.en:
Resty is a single mother, aged 27 years, with three children who are 9, 7 and 3. Two of her children are attending primary schools. She is a businesswoman who operates a retail shop and is also trading in bark-cloth (traditional attire). She supplements her income with agriculture from which she earns twice in a year. She has been in these businesses since 2011 and she works 7 days a week, and each day she works for 12 hours. 

Her businesses are located in a rural setting. She started these businesses in order to get money for taking care of her children by providing them with daily food, paying their school fees and providing their other needs.

Resty has acquired this loan in order to restock her business and be able to serve her clients better. She sells her retail shop goods to people around her area. She also sells bark–cloth to traders from the city who use them to make crafts.

Her greatest dreams are to educate all her children to the highest levels of education and to expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop. She faces the problem of price fluctuation, because she sells her goods to poor people who cannot afford any increase in price. Her transport costs are also high. She describes herself as a successful and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items (sugar, soap, salt).

loans.name: Nayiba

texts.en: Nayiba is 36 years old and the mother of four children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and kids in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a refugee from Jabrayil. She is very kind and caring, and also very energetic in her work. Nayiba  grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar.  She plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants and other vegetables and fruits. She says, even though this business is very hard, she and her husband handling the business together for seven years without any difficulty. Her income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. She has plans for the future, such as to getting more land for cultivation. She  is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer, because people buy fruit a lot. She has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 2,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help her to grow more vegetables and fruits, in order to obtain more revenue in the coming summer, which will help her to cover her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her fruit and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is 33 years old, married, and the father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrayil and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Kamal has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than eight years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Kamal’s  income from business is 130 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his sons will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 2,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his fruit and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Demtila

texts.en: Demtila is a very determined lady, age 49 and married to Zacharia, who supports a family of six members. She operates a quarrying business as well selling construction materials. She learned about KADET LTD from one of her clients. This will be her sixth loan, of KES 60,000, which will enable her add to her staff in the quarry and to pay transport charges to get her materials to the market. She will use the proceeds to develop her newly-acquired plot. Her dream is to own a construction company.

loans.use: to hire more employees to work in her quarry and to cover the costs of transporting her products to the market.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome tiene 45 años, esta casada con Teodoro y tiene 6 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Salome se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo con quien cultiva cacao, cafe y otros productos de la zona. Al principio trabajaba en otros terrenos agrícolas pero con sus ahorros logró acumular lo necesario para comprar su primer terreno agrícola. Gracias a esta oportunidad logró trabajar como productora independiente y mejoró sus ingresos. Su trabajo en el campo es muy duro ya que es necesario mantener en buen estado sus plantaciones porque de ello depende la calidad de sus productos.  Para ello suele contratar trabajadores del lugar quienes extraen la maleza de sus terrenos y colocan abono orgánico en sus plantaciones. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Salome is 45 years old, married to Teodoro, and has six children who all live in their house built from wood.  Salome and her husband work as farmers, planting cacao, coffee, and other local products.  At the beginning, she worked on other farm plots, but with her savings, she was able to accumulate enough to purchase her first plot of farm land.  Thanks to this opportunity, she was able to work as an independent producer and improve her income.  Her work in the field is very hard since it is necessary to keep her crops well maintained because she depends on the quality of the products.  In order to do this, she wants to hire local workers to remove the weeds from her fields and put down organic fertilizer on her plants.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to move forward.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  

She is requesting 2000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en: Hashim is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a doctor who studied pharmacological science. He operates a pharmacy. He resells medicines at a profit in his home town. He started his business by collecting a small amount of capital. He has attracted many clients, due to his being a professional in his field. Because of the bad situation in Yemen, he faces financial challenges to meet demand. So he took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB, in order to supply his business with good medicines and keep his customers coming back. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open another pharmacy.

loans.use: to supply his business with good medicines and keep his customers coming back.

loans.name: Garun

texts.en:
Garun is a charming woman who lives in Yenoqavan village in the Tavush region of Armenia. Garun's son is working abroad in the Russian Federation so in order to make a living for her and her daughter, Garun runs a farm that includes 40 sheep, three cows and ten chickens. Garun also owns a plot of land where she cultivates different types of fruits and vegetables (potatoes, greens, plums, apples, pears and nuts). It is very difficult for Garun to take her harvest to the market and sell it, but she does her best to make a living for her children. 

Now, realizing the demand for agriculture in the region, Garun wants to enlarge her farm. Unfortunately she has no financial means to achieve this goal and she is asking for your help. She has requested a loan to purchase 15 more sheep. These will significantly increase her income and she will be able to improve her standard of living and also her farm.

Garun is sure that this loan will be a great motivation for her to continue running her farm and expanding it.

loans.use: to pay for 15 sheep

loans.name: Giovanny Lizbeth

texts.es: Doña Giovanny, tiene 40 años de edad habita en un barrio marginal llamado Laureles Norte, es madre soltera de 5 hijos uno de ellos de 1 mes de nacido y los de más estudian. Ella para mantener a sus hijos se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica lo cual es muy difícil porque sus ingresos son muy pocos para su numerosa familia. Solicita el crédito para cambiar el techo en la parte de la sala de su casa, con esta mejora garantizara la salud e higiene de su familia ya que estas laminas se encuentran en mal estado y cuando llueve se filtra el agua.
texts.en:
Giovanny is 40 years old and lives in a marginal neighborhood called Laureles Norte.  She is the single mother of five children, one of whom is one month old, and the rest are in school.  In order to support her children, she works as a domestic employee, which is very difficult because her income is very small for her large family.  

She is requesting this loan to change the roof on a part of the living room of her house.  This improvement will guarantee the health and hygiene of her family since this sheeting is currently in bad condition and when it rains, water comes in.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting, beams, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two bags of Bambara groundnuts and two bags of beans.

loans.name: Ernestina Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ernestina es una mujer de 41 años, nació y creció en un pueblo frío del campo en el norte del Ecuador. Se casó muy joven y tuvo dos hijos a quienes tuvo que educarlos sola después de que sufrió el abandono de su esposo hace 13 años de quien no volvió a saber nada y este acontecimiento le llevó a aprender varias actividades en el área comercial para buscar el sustento de su hogar. Ernestina al poco tiempo de haberse casado con quien ahora es su ex esposo; se trasladó a la ciudad de Quito capital de la República del Ecuador en donde se encuentran muchas personas migrantes de las diferentes provincias del país que han llegado hasta allí en busca de nuevas oportunidades. Ernestina vive en Quito en la parroquia de Yaruquí, ubicada en la periferia del cantón, que guarda en su historia grandes tesoros de los antepasados incas que habitaron el lugar. En los últimos años la parroquia ha crecido y las viviendas se han multiplicado pero cabe destacar que las actividades que se realizan con mayor vocación son las florícolas y avícolas sin dejar de lado las actividades industriales, de comercio y servicios en especial el turismo, actividad con la cual se muestra a turistas nacionales y extranjeros los lugares donde habitaban los incas, una pirámide significativa y una gruta que lleva a un santuario. 
Ernestina se dedica desde hace 2 años a la comercialización de ropa casual para damas, caballeros y niños; labor que la aprendió por sugerencia de un familiar y comenzó vendiendo de puerta a puerta a sus amigos y conocidos, actualmente esta mujer se ha superado a sí misma logrando establecer su negocio en un pequeño local en el pasillo de su casa y al cual le dedica hasta 10 horas cada día. Actualmente la variedad de productos que tiene ha reducido, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra exclusiva de ropa de temporada para todas las edades, el beneficio adicional que ella obtendrá será un descuento mayor al acostumbrado, pues al comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad le otorgan un mejor precio con lo que obtendrá utilidades mayores, las cuales usará en el mejoramiento de su estilo de vida y además ayudar a su hijo que aún vive con ella en la obtención de su título profesional. Esta mujer encontró en Fundación Alternativa el apoyo, asesoría y confianza que estaba esperando para dar el paso de crecimiento en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 41 and was born and raised in a chilly rural town in northern Ecuador. She married very young and had two children, whom she had to educate on her own as her husband disappeared 13 years ago. Ernestina never heard from her husband again and learned various businesses in an attempt to support her children.  

Shortly after she married her now ex-husband, the couple moved to Quito, the Ecuadorean capital. They were among many migrants from across the country who came to Quito seeking new opportunities. Ernestina lives in Yaruquí Parish, on the outskirts of Quito, a region rich with treasures left by the Inca people who lived there. In recent years, Yaruquí Parish has grown, with burgeoning  construction of new homes. The major economic activities, however, are still flower and poultry production, though commercial and industrial ventures, and especially tourism, are also significant. Tourists from Ecuador and abroad come to see where the Incas lived, a magnificent pyramid, and a cave that leads to a shrine.  

Ernestina has for two years sold casual clothes for men, women, and children. She learned the business at the suggestion of a family member and began selling door-to-door to friends and neighbors. Ernestina eventually gave up selling door-to-door and set up a shop in her home, where she works ten hours a day. She currently carries a smaller variety of clothes than she used to, and she is requesting a loan for the exclusive purchase of seasonal clothing for adults and children. These loan funds will also provide Ernestina another benefit: they will allow her to make wholesale purchases at lower prices than she has paid before. The greater the volume of inventory she buys wholesale, the lower the price her suppliers charge her, increasing her profit margin. Ernestina will use this extra income to improve her quality of life and help the son who still lives with her finish his education. 

Ernestina has found in the Fundación Alternativa the support, advice, and trust she was seeking to help grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal casual clothing.

loans.name: Tioumoutie 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIOUMOUTIE 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIASSO, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme MATOU assise en première  position de la   gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 35.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the TIOUMOUTIE 3 group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Ziasso, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Matou, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds in order to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production at her village market to both men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 35,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fuxion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUXION”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta. Deyra ella es soltera  tiene 23 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vitaminas para las distintas personas que le soliciten como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vitaminas para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la construcción civil, redes de mercadeo, notaria, venta de vitaminas y trabajadores de hoteles.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Fuxion community bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province and department of Cusco.  

Deyra is a member of the group.  She is 23 years old.  She balances her daily activities with her business selling vitamins to the different people who order them, such as friends and family.  She is having a good time with her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  Deyra is a responsible person who wants to continue working to improve life for her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase vitamins for her business.  The other group members work in civil construction, trade networks, as a notary, selling vitamins, and as hotel workers.  

The group members are grateful to everyone who is part of this dream and promise to make their repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Matwopig Group

texts.en: Christine (pictured raising her hand) is 52 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married with nine children and runs a poultry farm alongside earning a salary to boost her income. She sells her produce to hotels and local people in the vicinity. Her dream is to expand her business and have a bigger clientele base, although stiff competition and poultry diseases are her major setbacks. Christine intends to use the loan to buy more poultry feed. She is a member of the above mentioned group, in which each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rechie has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Rechie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chukuriemeka

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des sacs d’écoliers et de voyage pour revendre au marché, Chukuriemeka âgé de 34ans est célibataire et sans enfant. Démarré l’activité en 2003, il s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge et de faire accroitre son activité. Les objectifs fixés par ce client actif est de se marier et d’agrandir son activité c’est pour cela, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises.
texts.en:
Chukuriemeka is a 34-year-old single man, with no children, who wants to buy school bags and travel bags to resell at the market.  He started in this business in 2003.  He likes his job, since it brings an income which allows him to support himself and to increase his activity.

Chukuriemeka ia a very active client, whose goals are to get married and to expand his business.  He is therefore requesting this third loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy school bags and travel bags.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel sells kerosene in Nairobi and has been in the business for five years. He is 41-years-old, married and has three children. He currently earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

This is Samuel's first loan and he plans to buy kerosene stock to sell. He will use the income he generates to educate his children and open another kerosene sales business.

Samuel hopes to grow his business and earn more income so that he can build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 60 years old and married with eleven children. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. Thus, she has requested a 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Herminia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 51 years old and married.  She has six children. Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, sugar and other groceries. 

Corazon requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

In the future Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 49 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlita has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Merlita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette works hard to support her family. Suzette is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Suzette requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

In the future, Suzette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

Nelly has been in this business for 20 years. Nelly earns additional income from raising livestock and farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charito has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Charito requested a 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to resell. In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo a 52ans et est veuve. Elle a en charge des enfants. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses derniers, elle revend des condiments (légumes et des épices). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison. Le prêt sollicité l’aidera à aider ses enfants et faire développer ses activités.
texts.en: Adjo is a 52-year-old widow who has some children in her care.  In order to improve the children's living conditions, she resells condiments (vegetables and spices).  She buys her goods at the Grand Market in Lomé and displays her various products in front of her house.  The loan that she is requesting will help allow her to support her children and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is farmer in Tala, where she plants vegetables, maize, potatoes and tomatoes, which she sells. She also rears dairy cows and sells milk to dairy shops. Lucia has been in the farming business for two years and currently earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

This will be Lucia's second loan and she plans to buy vegetable seedlings, which she can plant in her farm. Lucia also plans to buy more feed for her cows. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and also to pay for electricity installation in her home.

Lucia hopes to grow her farming business and become one of the best farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and cow feed.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

Ida is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Felicitee

texts.en: Felicitee is 31 years old. She sells utensils and has been in the business for the past nine years. She also sells saucepans. She plans to use the loan to buy more inventory. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sauce pans and other utensils to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 60 years old and married with five children. Nena works very hard to provide for them.

Nena runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Nena has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, fruits, vegetables and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Meghri town where she lives with her husband and her twin son and daughter.
 
Together with her husband, Karine started to raise cattle several years ago. Now they keep on their farm four cows. Karine milks the cows and gets dairy products, which are sold locally. 

Karine's husband works at a local company and his salary is hardly enough for covering the family's basic needs. Realizing that agriculture helps them to have a stable income and having a good credit history behind her, Karine has requested this loan.

With the loan's help, she plans to purchase three more cows and increase her dairy production.

Karine is sure that this loan will help her to increase the profit of her family and ensure a better life for them.

loans.use: to pay for three cows.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She completed 12th grade. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother.

She sells six days a week from 7 A.M. to 5 P.M. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot. She likes her business because customers buy from her.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Tioumoutie 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIOUMOUTIE 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZIASSO, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme NATOGOMA debout en première  position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les intrants et semences agricoles pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the TIOUMOUTIE 4 group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Ziasso, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third-largest administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Natogoma, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds in order to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production at her village market to both men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 36 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Benita has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Benita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Benita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 32 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a variety store in the Philippines. In order to purchase more stock to sell, she has requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF.

Ma. Gina has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Veteliana

texts.en:
Veteliana works hard to support her family. Veteliana is married and has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years now.

Veteliana has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Veteliana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is 40 years old. He owns a store where different beers are sold. With the loan, he wants to buy more beers and sodas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 44 years old and married with one kid.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jonah is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jonah has been farming rice for twenty years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 27 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more vegetables to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Apporinaire

texts.en: Apporinaire is 48 years old. He is married with three children. He sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Trinity Wome's Group

texts.en:
Jaliah is a farmer. She also operates a retail shop in Lyantonde town to supplement her income so that she can adequately meet the needs of her family, since she is a single mother.

She wants to grow vegetables so that she can sell them to the people in town, since there is ready market. She does not have the time, however,  but she feels that if she hired someone, he would do a good job in a very short time. 

Therefore, the loan will help her with hiring the labour as well as buying seeds and pesticides. She is a hard working and innovative woman who encourages other women to be innovative.

(The eighth person on the right is the Ugafode staff member.)

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire labour to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Sua

texts.en:
Sua is 52 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a widow, and when she was younger was unable to go to school.  She has five children aged between 19 and 28. 

Sua has described herself as a hard-working woman; for the past twelve years she has been selling cold water in the local market.  She sells water six days per week from 10am to 4pm.  She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her children. She uses a shared-taxi every day to get her goods to her business spot.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water for her business with the profits from her business she plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 48-years-old woman who lives in the West point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children aged  between 28 and 14. Only one is  in school and two of her children live at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past 6 years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 4PM. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her children's father. She uses shared-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Matabishi est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Riziki», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 35 ans, divorcée et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse des souliers usagers. Elle installe ses articles au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son ex mari, Il y a environ 11 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 ballons de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
The borrower, Matabishi, is the leader of the "Riziki" business group.  Aged 35, she is a young, yet experienced entrepreneur.  She is also divorced and the mother of two children who both go to school.  

Matabishi sells used shoes.  She displays her merchandise at the public market and sometimes at home.  She started in this business about 11 years ago, using her own money, received from her ex-husband.

This new loan will be used to buy three bales of shoes.  Her goals are to expand her business, feed and educate her children and buy a plot of land.

In the end, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it provides to small-scale entrepreneurs, through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy three bales of used shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Djalilou

texts.fr: Revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale, Djalilou âgé de 25ans n’as pas encore d’enfant en charge. Il se bat chaque jour pour gagner son pain et espère à l’avenir avec le profit tiré de la vente devenir grossiste et se lancer dans la vie maritale. Il a une ancienneté de 02ans dans l’activité.
texts.en: Djalilou, aged 25, resells general food products.  He does not have any children in his care yet.  He struggles each day to make a living and hopes that the profits from his sales will help him to become a wholesaler one day. He would also like to get married.  He has two years of experience in his field.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 49 años , esta casada con Wenceslao y tiene 6 hijos que viven junto a ella en su casa construida con bloques de adobe. Victoria se dedica a la agricultura por está razón cultiva cacao orgánico y barbasco ya que considera que son los productos más rentables de su zona. Cuenta constantemente con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos en tareas menores y de ser necesario contrata a trabajadores del lugar para culminar sus tareas pendientes en menos tiempo. Para obtener una buena calidad de cacao utiliza abono orgánico.
Luego de cosechar sus productos los transporta a la ciudad en donde le pagan buenos precios permitiéndole recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales. Con el tiempo desea reemplazar los bloques de adobe por material noble. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para la compra de herramientas como machetes, tijeras de podar y otros instrumentos para poder cultivas sin problemas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old. She is married to Wenceslao and has 6 children. They live together in an adobe house. 

Victoria works in agriculture, cultivating organic cocoa and barbasco plants because she considers them to be the most profitable products in her region. She always has the support of her husband and children for minor tasks and when it is necessary she contracts local workers to complete their pending tasks faster. To obtain quality cocoa she uses organic manure. After harvesting, she transports the products to the city where they are bought for a good price, allowing her to earn back the money invested with additional gains. 

Over time, she wants to replace the adobe blocks with a better material. 

This it is her first loan with Kiva. She is very thankful for the financial support that she is receiving, which will allow her to move forward. In addition, she promises to make her payments on time. At this time she requests 2,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to purchase tools such as machetes, pruning shears and other instruments to be able to cultivate easily.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as machetes, pruning shears etc.
